name: To the Moon
description: A story-driven experience about two doctors traversing backwards through a dying man's memories to artificially fulfill his last wish.
minimum_requirements: OS:Windows 98, XP, Vista, 7, 8, 10 Processor:Intel Pentium III 800 MHz Memory:512 MB RAM Graphics:1024x768 High Color + DirectX®:9.0 Hard Drive:100 MB HD space

reviews.review_text: Don't cry. Don't cry. Don't cry...  I cried.

So...There's always a lighthouse...? This game is astonishing, it is like a wonderful novel, or like a brilliant movie. The story is so touching, so full. Just...such a HUGE LOVE and amazing dream! I can compare this game with one of my favourite movies 'Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind'. Spectacular dialogs, emotional roller coaster, great humor. And main piano theme 'For River\To the moon' it is....I am speechless. 10 out of 10 from a sentimental dreamer.

Well this game has been rattling around my library for quite some time now, I finally clicked 'play'. Then I didn't get out of my chair for the next 3 hours.   To the Moon is a great story, the whole game plays out like a nice movie. A few 4th wall breaking references here or there, some comic relief, and of course TONS of sappiness. I really wasn't sure what to expect going into this, but with so many positive reviews and such a neat pricetag I remained fairly optimistic, and honestly any expectations I might've had were blown out of the water by what this game really delivered. I didn't think such a story could be told in this format, I didn't know that so few pixels could make me experience so many feels..   I can't make a pros/cons list for this game really. It wouldn't really make sense. If you want to sit back and casually navigate your way through a captivating story then this game might be for you! If you're looking for a more interactive experience - or maybe want to blow some ♥♥♥♥ up - I wouldn't recommend this for you.   Honestly even if this isn't the type of game you think you'd enjoy I would still recommend waiting for a sale and giving it a shot, I spent 2$ and then one day I was in the mood for something different, and now here I am adding another thumbs up to the mountain of positive reviews this game has :)
Money can't buy you happiness, but it can buy you this game, which is kind of the same thing.

Even if 10years past or more,To the moon,still shining...no matter how the world has been changed.. the people changed. she is still shining.   play alone..play with your heart, peace and quiet.when everting is done...the game is finished, and tell your firend,tell your parent,tell the people you love that You love them.  a brilliant game. please try it.may you find peace.
It gave me feeling again.
'You  never  cockblock someone in the middle of a kamehameha.' Bewertung Bewegung
Sad and funny, serious and light-hearted, marveling and tragic, this game knows how to take you on a feel trip.   10/10, would not-know-if-to-cry-or-smile again.
My cup runneth over with face sweat, for men don't shed tears.
To the moon : An experience, unlike any other.  It has one of the most immersive and heart warming stories, that you will ever experience in a video game.

There's a perfect word to describe this game: Masterpiece. To the Moon is one of the best story-telling games I've ever played.  You can feel the touch of life and death on it. The convincing love story that isn't cliche, the details of a romantic life, well... the true love. If you love reading books, this is your kind of game. It will make you laugh, cry, be surprised, be shocked, everything..!  Besides a overpass gameplay, it will touch your soul. I have no more words to say about 'To the Moon', let it speaks for itself.
'I'm really  feeling  it!'

'A story-driven experience about two doctors traversing backwards through a dying man's memories, in order to artificially fulfill his last wish.'  ♥ I have finished this game ♥   This is a beautiful and well thought out game. It's no easy feat to create a story that progresses backwards in time so that you can fully appreciate the present. The game is short, which may be a perk for some and not others. I feel the length of this game was perfect. There are many references in this game, and it's fun to find them! The sound track is beautiful and really helps influence your emotions.   This game is emotion and story driven. As for gameplay mechanics, you basically walk around (using your mouse), collecting memories so that you can progress to the next period in time. You watch this dying man's life unfold from the present until he was a young child. This is a heavy dialog game, and you have to click to go through the dialog. So walking, collecting, and dialog. Each time you progress to the next point in time, you have to solve a little puzzle. The puzzles aren't that difficult, and I found it kind of fun.   You grow to really care about the characters. You sympathise with them.   If you do not shed even one little tear at the end, you might want to have yourself tested. You may in fact not be human.

One of those 'games' with terrible gameplay but awesome storyline. The basic gist of it is that you work for a company that help dying people fulfill their wishes. In the case of the main patient in the storyline, this wish is to go to the moon. Saying any more than that would be spoiling the storyline, which is by far the main reason why you'd want to play this game in the first place.   The gameplay itself is quite mundane. It looks and plays somewhat like a 16-bit era RPG, but without combat. It's rare that you'll find yourself lost for any significant amount of time. The game is also very (written) dialogue-heavy, so if you're not a fan of reading, this probably isn't the game for you. The soundtrack is quite superb.  The game will generally take you around 3-4 hours to complete. Given the nature of the game, I would recommend completing the game in one sitting.  Overall, I personally loved this game, although I have to admit that it's not for everyone. I personally bought this for $2.50 AUD, and I thought it was worth every penny. With that said, the game has practically zero replay value and is relatively short. I would overall recommend people try the game out if they're willing to sit down and appreciate a good, touching storyline.
the amazing prequel to moonbase alpha
Excellent game, will make you cry a lot!!!!

A must played game for every fan of story driven games.   Gameplay is very basic. Most of the time you will read dialogs and watch the characters move around. From time to time you will be able to control them. In most of the scenes you have to find multiple objects to move on to the next scene. But they are very simple so that you can concentrate on the story.  I really enjoyed it. Give it a try if you can spare 5-7 hours

The gameplay is dull, linear and you won't ever have to make any decision tougher than in which order you want to click specific items. There is (or was) no controller support, the game has a few bugs, it's not always clearly visible where you can walk and where there's an invisible blockwall, and i dont know if there was even an option to change the resolution.  The interesting thing about that is though, that it doesnt matter one bit. Play the game. Don't read any more about it, avoid any information about it as well as possible, and for goudas sake, do yourself the favor and dont watch a let's play. You would regret it forever.  This game is about its story and the feelings it conveys, made possible as well by the charming artstyle and the perfect soundtrack, which now is finally available as FLAC, which is actually the reason I'm writing a review now, the soundtrack alone is worth way more than anyone ever paid for it. And one has to experience it by oneself, it would be a terrible waste to know that much about it, that there's nothing to experience anymore. Or to say it like this: If i had the chance to forget all of it, so i can replay and experience it all over again, i'd do it.  Of course, it won't be everyones kind of game, I know some Idio-... people who think: 'If i want to read a story, i can read a book, i don't have to play a game for that', but at least to me, games are way more personal. Even if you don't really have many choices, you still get more involved, by moving around in the world which the game is presenting to you, and experiencing it at your own pace, in your own way.  In my admittedly kinda dull NEET-life, where every day is basically like the last, the next, or any other for that matter, I always forget what i did at some point, as there is just nothing special about it. But i can remember one of those days clearly. I remember sitting in my room (well, as always), tucked in a blanket, drinking rooibos tea. It was evening outside, later even night, and it was snowing with the snow lying around 6-8centimeters high. I still had some peels lying next to my screen, from the clementines i ate earlier that day, and they and the rooibos distributed a comfortable fragrance throughout the room. And i remember all this for one reason only. It was the day that i played To the Moon.

Personally I liked this game , but to be honest  not for everyone . Read an equal mixture of positive/negative reviews and decide.     PROS   ~The story* ~Characters (although most info on the protagonists will be found in the minisodes) ~The art   (*) The story is good , but not great. Fans of the game may say it is 'GENIUS' but in my opinion there was no genius plot element or twist, it was a a good and nice story and that`s all.    CONS   ~The controls* ~The humor**  (*) The characters` movements feel 'slidey' . I think the maps are made on a grid pattern so if you use a keyboard you might stop pressing the key but the character will keep moving to the end block , it creates a 'slidey' feeling and puts me kinda off. You can of couse you can use a mouse so it`s up to you , I prefer keyboard and the keyboard didn`t feel right. (**) The humor feels forced and cringey. Dr.Watts for example constantly makes jokes and puns, I think they are intentionally written bad and cringey but I think it was unnecessary.    I personally suggest you try it, you will probably like it. 7/10

To the Moon is a tool of such a great emotional complexity, that it's going to soften even the coldest of hearts, and water the driest of eyes. Such a great ride, hidden in such a small package. I recommend it with my whole heart!

I payed a mere $1.99 whilst it was on sale, what a steal.  I would be very happy to pay full price for this masterpiece, everything about it was sublime. The not so subtle TV show references when breaking a memento, the world design, the game mechanics... I'm not going to comment on the story that was told as I don't wish to potentially spoil anything, suffice it to say it will make you cry  MANLY  tears. The soundtrack is one of the few soundtracks I have even thought of purchasing in my lifetime; it was beautiful.  I've played this through once, and I certainly will be again. Not to mention the DLC is free!   This is without a shadow of a doubt one of the most well executed games I have played and will every play. Hats off to Freebird Games for giving us this piece of art. I'll be giving A Bird Story a go and if it's even half as good as this was I'll be over the moon *unintentional pun I swear*  I cannot recommend this enough, buy it and steam share your library to your friends if they do not wish to purchase it; it's a must play.   10/10

This game is beauty and art in their purest forms. I've read a lot of books, I've watched a lot of movies, and I've played a lot of games, but never have I come across something that has caused me so much emotional turmoil and heartwrenching bittersweet feelings than this simple visual novel. The visuals are beautiful, the music consistently compliments the mood so well while being some of the best songs I've ever heard, and the characters are so well developed I could reach out and touch them.   Whether you love games or have never played one before, whether you cannot stop reading novels or have only picked up books required by your classes, this game will stun and astound you.
Masterpiece. Deep and Touchy Story Beautiful Art and Music Unforgetable Moments.  11/10 Would crie again

Definetly the best visual novel i have played ever. I wont find another one like this. Cant even find the words to describe the game 10/10.  If this game doesnt win “I'm Not Crying, There's Something In My Eye” Steam players are wrong.
This game may not be a multi million dollar triple-a title. But it sure has a story better than most if not all of them.
this is the first game I have cried over. god damnit what a beautiful game.

Awful graphics and bad controls at all. But probably the best story i've ever seen in a computer game. Reminds me somehow on the 'Butterfly Effect'. Cute settings, cute characters. A lot of funny moments and crying at the same time. And at least an unforgetable perfect matching piano soundtrack. You should not miss this amazing experience.
Really beautiful game. Mix of adventure and interactive novel (not sure why the RPG tag though); incredibly well written, touching story so keep tissues at the ready,sweet and fitting soundtrack.

Will almost make you cry as hard as you did at the ending of Super Paper Mario. Even if you're a completely heartless SOB, the OST of this game will turn you into a sentimental old fluff, just like yours truly.

For some reason a lot of games with crap graphics have really good stories. This one is no exception. For $2.49 I practically feel like I'm stealing this game. There are a lot things I've wasted 2 and a half bucks on, but this is money VERY well spent. Not sure If I'm going to nominate this game or Undertale for the Sad game Steam award!   10/10 Amazing story and character development. Truly, To the Moon is more of a interactive story-telling experience than it is a video game. And it's a story you're gonna love.

To The Moon is an emotional journey, one that I haven't really ever experienced in games. It's a game with RPG Maker graphics so it looks simple, but its strength lies in its storytelling.  The way the story is told is done in a way that will keep you (mostly) interested during the entire experience. While it lasts only 4 hours or so, there's very little gameplay involved (there's even a somewhat frustrating part near the end).  Even though the game lacks in the graphics department, it makes up for it by its amazing soundtrack. I enjoyed it so much that I even bought it seperately afterwards.  Keep an open mind, ignore the graphics and just enjoy the ride. A must own !  (It should earn the 'I'm Not Crying, There's Something In My Eye' award)  [Rating: 83/100]

I love the game, and yes, it will probably make you cry. But I think the focus is to much on the tears .Probably because not too many games are as touching as this.   But I want to say that most of the game made me Smile :)))  There is a very special warmth in 'To the Moon' :) And you will have your laughs, too - dr.Watts see to that ! :)

Absolutely sensational storytelling. Very few games out there succeed in excellent story and character development that attracts and scars players. To The Moon is one of the few that does an outstanding job in not only nailing this, but also leaving a long-lasting impact.  Without revealing too much to those that have yet to play - You assume control of two Doctors – Dr. Neil Watts and Dr. Eva Rosalene – whom work for an agency whose job is to reconstruct certain aspects of dying people's memories and fulfil their deepest wishes before their lights are out; in this case, taking Johnny to the Moon. The reason to which I will not explain in this review, otherwise there would be no point in going through all the emotions this game sets out to deliver. Though you can expect a story filled with excellent dialogue and character development with plenty of unpredictable moments  Gameplay is fairly straight forward and pretty much the same as TWD or any point-and-click game for that matter. There are a few mini-games and puzzles to add that little challenge factor but nothing overly complicated or mind numbing. Everything is straight forward and easy to pick up.  The soundtrack is composed to perfection and aids the storytelling in a very unique way. A great mixture of tracks which change depending on the scenario at hand.  The only aspect that may throw some people off is the fact that there is almost zero replayability, with the average completion time appearing to be anywhere around the 4.5 hour mark. Unless of course certain aspects of the game did not sink in properly the first time and you attempt a second rerun, though this does not bother me at all as it aimed to convey a purpose right from the beginning and was delivered to great satisfaction.   Overall a wonderful game I would very strongly recommend. Do not let the simple graphics fool you! Deep down tears will be shed playing this little blockbuster.

Great, great game. I must say that I was rather surprised by how the developer managed to make a very good story fit within the short length that the game is. The story, in my opinion, is the biggest highlight of the game, followed by the sweet soundtrack. It manages to be both really clever and moving, and the textual dialogue within the game contains that quality to it that I absolutely love, which is the one that brings emotion and personality into the written words. The one that makes the characters sound more human, and that familiarity with them renders them very emotionally potent; a kind of emotional truth that we experience at a biochemical level quite the same as we would with strangers whom we get to know with time.  I suppose that the only one I genuinely have with the game is the fact that it only runs on 640x480 in Windows. While the art is still very good, it's a shame that it's not possible to experience the game in bigger resolutions. The lack of an options menu for that is an issue, and it's bad that the Steam overlay doesn't work with the game as well. Albeit, as usual with other RPG Maker games, the game's properties and settings can be easily accessed by pressing F1. Those can be used to alter the game's controls, in case the player isn't satisfied with them. They're smooth and easy to learn, however.  Any gamer that loves games that are story driven must have this in their library.  To The Moon  contains a heartwarming narrative, good characters, fine art, and a wondrous soundtrack. This is something to be paid attention to. It's simple, yet powerful. It's short, but gripping. It's part of why it's as impressive as it is. Very recommended, thank you for this stunning journey, Freebird Games.  9.1/10.0

The first and the only game that has made me cry so far. It has such a deep message. It has an amazing story presented in such a beautiful way along with a soundtrack that's absolutely heart warming. The graphics style is gorgeous (never underestimate the power of pixels, lol). This is more than just a regular game, it's an experience. And (spoilers) this game has one of the best and the most satisfying endings I've ever seen on a video game.  Just... get it!

To the Moon is a beautiful game on many levels. The music, sounds, story, artwork, atmosphere, and delivery unlock a cornucopia of raw and powerful emotions that cling to the obvious passion the developers put into it. It's a pretty remarkable journey of closure, one that is amazingly told backwards.  All giddiness aside, the gameplay and user interaction are definite weak spots, although quite easy to overlook. The story also showcases a striking resemblance to movie concepts from Total Recall (memory implants)--not a knock...just saying.  Only a select few indie titles have come close to pulling off the grand gaming experience that To the Moon delivers. It is every little bit a must experience game.
A great and riveting story. I liked it :)

This game changed my perception toward games. I used to only focus on them triple A and high graphic games on consoles and pc but this game showed me exactly why story>graphics/gameplay.   I’ve never been more interested in story focus games since then and I’ve kept looking but so far To the Moon is still the best in my list. The soundtrack is so amazing I ended up playing tons of hours of Football Manager with them playing at the background. Still one of my favourite game OST to this day.

Human wishes are the meaning of our life. They set our path, affect our decisions… They make us what we are. To The Moon tells us a story of an old dying man that wants his final wish to be fulfilled. Wish that he cared through his life. That made him who he is. As Dr. Rosalene and Dr. Watts you will travel back in old man’s memory to let him live through his wish. Even if only in dreams. The story you will see in this trip is full of emotional moments. Moments that can’t leave you indifferent. Main and credit melodies are unbelievable. And gameplay is easy but interesting. All who loves quest novels with heartful story should play this masterwork of Canadian designer/composer Kan 'Reives' Gao.
Manly tears were shed
Great game with a great story

This is by far the most beautiful game I've played, the story is so well made that it literally made me cry. If you are looking for a interesting, simple, entertaining game with a great story this game is for you. P.S. This should be played by every gamer out there so we can all remember that games can be artistic too.

No real gameplay, so treat this like a cinematic experience, a moving and powerful story with gorgeous pixel art, elegant music, and a treatise to memory and love. You will most likely cry. Amusing dialogue and lovely sequencing.

To the Moon is an amazing point and click game, the storyline is about t- Wait, no. I'm not gonna write a big review like I always do. To the Moon is an amazing game which can't be described by words why is it so amazing, you have to play it yourself to understand it. Buy it now. 10/10

Such an amazing game! I am not into adventure games but this one dragged me into it. The script is one of the best i have ever seen and it fits with the soundtrack perfectly. The game succeeded to create the emotional bond with the player and after 45minutes of gameplay there is no turning back. You just want to see it happens next (or should i say before?)

*UPDATED* very GOOD JOB for the updated mini sequel To The Moon (Sigmund) it refresh all Johny River memories! cant wait for the next sequel!!  THUMBS UP !! it'll be better if new achievements are added as for the new sequels too :)   'korean-like love drama' 10/10  >> visual love novel >> not really a Game >> worth the money (buy it on discount... so that u wont feel any regrets if it doesnt suits ur things ^^ )  #MUST give it a try :)

This is literally my favorite story-driven game of all time. The graphics are the best that you can find for an RPGMaker game, the soundtrack is beautiful, and the story is waaay too good. It's the perfect length for me, and unless you are the 'graphics is all that matters' type of person, this game is probably going to touch you.
Feels. That's all. Feels to the maximum

I was very 'reluctant' to play this game because the control, resolution and other technical things... Well I'm very happy because I ignored that all stuff and I just enjoyed the travel through this wonderful story.   +Music!    The music is great and plays a big role in the history. Very simple tracks but very touching. I'm writing this while I'm listening the main theme of the game. I love it.   +Characters    I dont want spoil nothing but you will love the main chars and the references that they make to movies, anime, series and more.  +Story    This dont need explain. The big point of this game is this, so play it and discover what's hidden in this apparently simple  game  visual novel with rpgmaker graphics.   -Resolution   I didn't played this game before because of this. Play with that crappy resolution and that black borders it's very annoying and horrible.  -Control  Arrows to move? Seriously?...   I can not do anything more except recommend you again to play this... Play, enjoy the story and cry like a little girl at the end for gaben sake.
An Incredible story-driven game,which was beyond my exception and impressed me overwhelmingly.
I can do nothing but playing this game continiously for 6 hours.

To The Moon genuinely hits a high mark; It's truly got one of the most interesting stories that I've ever sat through in video games ever.  You play as two doctors Eva and Watts who are traversing through the memories of a dying patient who's final wish is to go to the moon. I won't reveal any more to the plot because it's much better you sit through the events of the story yourself. It's tearjerking; everyone's review that says this truly means it. I didn't understand the story fully the first time mostly out of the fact that I didn't exactly understand the side-effects of some medical conditions mentioned throughout the game, Google anything you're unfamiliar with; it'll help you out, but after the 2nd time it finally made sense, and when you DO understand every piece of the story, it just hurts in a satisfying, remorseful way. There's no easy way to put it; if you don't feel ANYTHING at the end of the gorgeous ride the game takes you through, you're unbelievably heartless.  If stories that certainly make you appreciate life and not take it for granted, and a hint of science fiction is your cup of tea, To The Moon does anything but disappoint. The piano-arranged soundtrack is stunning; I still find myself humming the themes 3-years later, the 16-bit graphics are nice, and the mini-puzzles inbetween are a lovely touch to keep you going. I'm super excited for Kan Gao's next installment to the series 'Finding Paradise' later this year, but for now I will continue to love this game to no end.  Thanks, Kan.
Best dramatic story-based game I've ever played in my life.

This is not a game. It's an interactive story where clicking is required to progress from scene to scene and from dialog to dialog. The fact that from times to times some ridiculously easy puzzles have to be solved in order to progress doesn't exactly make it a game. There's nothing challenging about it.  Anyway, its best part is the story. It's a complex story that treats matters of life and death in such way that it gets to be felt quite close and personal. I completely don't recommend this to depressive people. I was on the verge of busting into tears several times throughout its duration. The story is great, very touching and impactful. It's hard to speak about it without spoiling it, but I guess I could say it somehow reminds of Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind, the movie, but only in just a few aspects.  Other than the story (but damn, what a story!...), there was nothing I liked about how 'To the moon' presented itself to me. The soundtrack supports the story pretty well, it enhances the feelings that the story transmits, but it gets cheesy at points, near the end. Don't get me wrong, it's an awesome soundtrack that clearly shows the loads of work it required, but it's just not my type, I'm more into the Bastion-like soundtracks.  Many people seem to have found the strength to tolerate the awful graphics, but I still can't ignore them. It's an 'RPG Maker'-like, uber low budget kind of graphics that ruined for me the immersiveness of the 'to the moon' experience at points. Since the clicking and controlling was also quite imprecise, I think I would've even prefered a slideshow of still images instead of some of the scenes where just moving around was pretty annoying and tedious.   It also lacks basic settings like sound volume controls, full screen / window mode toggling, screen resolution settings, all the basic stuff. At least it comes with steam cloud support and a pretty neat, single 'Steam achievement'.  Anyway, I don't regret the money spent on it and the 3 hours and a half that it took me to finish it. It's a great experience. It's also, indeed, worthy of still being considered the saddest game of all. I submit to this general opinion as well.

This game has a beautiful story, a wonderful soundtrack, and the gameplay was simple, fun, and unique. Not to mention all the nerdy and anime references within the game! It was enough to make me cry and reflect this upon my life in a different perspective. 10/10 would play again!
A wonderful short game which surely could be named as art with its moving story and as variety to 'normal' games definitely recommendable!

Traveling backwards through time, a beautiful story unfolds as you follow the events of one man's life. It's less of a game and more of a storytelling experience. The emotion-packed scenes are broken up with just the right amount of humorous commentary. It's hard to say how amazing this game is without spoiling it, but I will tell you one thing: At one point, the characters debate how one would get a piano into the TARDIS.

A true masterpiece of an videogame and outstanding example as a prove that RPG-Maker games can turn into real worthy games!  This story is so well written it deserves so much more to become an movie than most AAA titles.  Was playing this game until I had finished it.   I can barely remember a videogame that touched me in a way like 'To the moon' did. It really gives you a lot of stuff to think about.    I can recommend this to EVERYONE. Just funny how a game can be so popular these days without ANY violence.    Thank you to the developer for such a well written story and rpg maker execution.

To the Moon is a sincere story told through 16-bit-style graphics and simplistic gameplay. You control the characters Dr. Wyatt and Dr. Rosaleane, scientists within a wolrd in which it is possible to recover memories of their dying patients for a chance to live their final requests and dreams - even if it was not reality and only in their minds.   'Occasionally I'm fortunate enough to play a game that reminds me what's important. Not only what's important in making a great piece of interactive media, but also what's important in life.' - Anthony Gallegos  This story centers around a dying man named Johnny who wished to visit the moon, hence the games title.. To the Moon. Along the way of recovering Johnny's memory a wonderful story of love, and loss unfolds before your eyes. As you progress through layers of memories Johnny will slowly go from being an unconscious old man you don't really care about, to a complex human being whose life you are certain the empathize with. By the end of the game I came to care about Johnny, despite never meeting his 'real' self in the overworld.   The gameplay consists of simple puzzles in order to break through layers of memories and then comes to exploring the memory and watching the story unfold. In other words if you are someone who's interested in fancy graphics and gameplay this isn't for you.  My weak puzzle solving skills and exploration are not why I have 4 hours in this game, I rather rushed through these parts in order to reach the next scene or dialogue sequence allowing me sight into the minds and hearts of the characters presented. Some games are mindless and are carried through the repetitive actions, gameplay and graphics. To the Moon is reliant on the excellent plot of which will leave you broken.

It is rare that I come across a game so charming and with such a stellar story; To The Moon is both excellently written and superbly executed, and I feel like the events of this game will stay with me for years to come.  Being a huge fan of Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind, I purchased this game simply because of the parallels I had heard about, and I was not disappointed. As I played, every new discovery left me compelled to uncover more and to find out about the old man's life. At times the dialogue can be a bit silly, but it's much needed comedic relief within a setting that otherwise jumps from tearjerking to heartwarming.  The gamplay is extremely basic, and whilst it is more present than any gameplay in Gone Home, for example, I would still put this in the 'interactive novel' genre as at its core it is simply a story you are uncovering. There are occasionally small puzzles to jump between memories, but I personally found that these became tedious fast and I feel the game would be better without. They do, however, add a little more pacing to the plot and give you some time to think about what you may find next.  To The Moon is definitely worth buying, I can't imagine anyone being disappointed by such a rollercoaster ride. I am extremely excited to see what Freebird release next!

One of the best games I've ever played. It's a narrative with an amazingly well-crafted story and beautiful music. Guaranteed feels... if you're even considering getting it, get it. The story may only last a couple hours, but it's well worth your money.
Not the game, but the story. And the story that worth to be lived in by everyone.
Must buy <3
This game has a really dramatic and good story line! Porbraly the best that I have ever seen! I was never a fan of these games.... until I played this one ;D I recommend this 100% no doubt. 10/10
Voted on 'To The Moon' for The “I'm Not Crying, There's Something In My Eye” Award. Srsly.....

Brilliant emotional story supported throughout with beautiful melodies. You'll be hooked from the very start as simple curiosity turns into real attachment to the characters. I finished this game in a single setting.

A beautiful story with a perfectly paired musical accompaniment. Despite the text bubble clicking method of delivery being an absolutely brutal and uninvolving way to deliver a story, this game was amazing and was well delivered.  However; between the method of delivery and the incredibly slow movement speed of the characters the game becomes a grind towards 'Act III'. Yet, from the feeling of 'What a beautiful story' to 'OMFG pls effing end already' the game was worth the sale purchase but should have ended after they first met, when they were looking at the stars.  Could use: -a volume slider -steam overlay -a click counter

Wow. What an incredible little game. You can see that the deveoper really put their heart and soul into creating a truly magical game. The story-telling is absolutely superb. Its like reading a brilliant novel that you can't put down. From the moment I started the game, I knew this was something special. The soundtrack is just magnificent. Seriously. The first time you boot up the menu, you will know what I'm talking about. Each piece is brilliantly composed and fits perfectly with the atmosphere of the current scene. The characters are so interesting that you immediately being to love them. This has certainly shot up to one of my favourite games.
To The Moon
This Game has an Amazing Story and a wonderful soundtrack, it is a game that made me Cry a little and I don't usually cry during a game, but this one did it.

Great story although a bit shallow as a 'game'. I will still refer to it as such.  This is the best 'story game' I've ever played. This is the worst 'story game' I've ever played. The above two statements are true. The above statement is false. The above statement is false.  That's about where my brain was at when I finished the game and it didn't really click until I had it all put together (I think I completely lost it at 'beta blockers'). Presentation is a bit meh (would've love to move in a three-dimensional plane to make it easier), but writing is top notch. For some reason, F12 in this game pauses it instead of taking a screenshot?  Pros- Pony rides; Disembodied floating heads, at one point, Zombies at another (I'm serious), Compelling story that made me want to keep going. Cons- Abrupt abandonment of flip puzzles, Story is likely hard to follow on first playthrough; I wish environments were a little bigger as there were some crammed areas.  So basically, I said the story was a pro and the story was a con. But yeah, I think most people will enjoy it.
Do you recommend this game?  Yes, why yes sir....I do.

To The Moon is a deep story, exciting, sad and funny at the same time, which has an endless number of quotations along with fantastic characters and a soundtrack nothing short of amazing. A story masterfully told in front of which it is impossible to remain indifferent. if you want a story full of emotion, accompanied by an excellent soundtrack, then you should certainly buy this. A small masterpiece of its kind.

Absolutely amazing game! With such a great story, which is surprising for me. I really dislike top down and side-scroller type of games, I find the lack immersion and I struggle to find the story interesting. Of course this has changed my mind set on these style of games, absolutely fantastic!    'The ending isn't any more important than any of the moments leading to it'
10/10 would cry again.

If you watched a let's play of this game. Don't bother buying it. You already know what happens. I bought the game without prior knowledge and it reminds me everyday of my life ambitions. What it means to be alive and breathing. It's definitely something to remember and I look foward with great interest on the next installment of this series.

A heartwarming interactive storytelling game and an exceptional written story. It might just be one of the best game I've ever played. The soundtracks are phenomenal and really brings out the right emotions at the right time. One might think that the length of this game is a bit short (~4h), but it's actually just right and works out really well. I would suggest playing this game in one go.  I truly believe that people who are not into the RPG pixel art style will be able to enjoy this game, as the main focus is not on the gameplay, but rather the story. I'm going to end this review without further explaining the details of the game. The reason being that explaining too much might ruin the experience and one's expectations distorted by others can itself be a spoiler.
It really touched me. Multiple times, even. Touched deep.  This game is really worth it. Really.  Bravo
It is a mountain of beautiful storytelling wrapped in a blanket of sadness and a classic love-story with a musical backing that exaggerates even your tiniest felt tear.
This game is absolutely the worst thing that could happen to you. It will take your heart and butt♥♥♥♥ it, no lube. It left me in shambles of emotions.  10/10 would reccomend
To the feels.

A heartbreaking and beautiful story, and an absolute must play in my mind. This should be made into an film...  As for the gameplay itself... The controls aren't the best ( it is worth noting that it's clearly made for mouse play, so don't fret it when your gamepad doesn't work ) and at the start the gameplay isn't fully clear with the links and mementos (which again.. it becomes pretty intuitive), but none of this should stop you from playing this game. It is absolutely worth playing despite any minor flaws.   As a side note.. there is only one achievement, and it is granted simply for completing the game. This is actually quite perfect, because the only thing that is important about this game IS the story. Enjoy it. Don't expect a lot of gaming as this is just the chosen vehicle for the narrative. Don't stress about missing anything.. you won't. Just enjoy the story.   Also.. the music is great. Bonus points for all the nerdy pop-culture references.  See you on the moon.

The reason mainly why I recommend this game is because of the truly amazing and original storyline it has along with the character development regarding the introduced characters. This game (story) just never bores you. It has something that wants you to keep playing, something that wants you to explore more of the things that lay ahead of you. Humor, romance, adventure, puzzles and fantasy it has it all. Really worth the pocket money exchanged for the game.   Not to mention the soundtracks. They are BEAUTIFUL. The soundtracks are just so overwhelming and so well placed in every scene, that you can't help to live with the characters. To have feels so deep that somehow your heart will bump against your chest painfully along with the pixelated tears that drop down your cheeks. It is unimaginable how much work was put into everything to create this splendid game of artwork, but what I can say is that this was truly one of the best games I've played on the Steam Community.   To the RPG and Adventure lovers like me: surely try this out, especially if you're in for tearjerkers.

Overall the game is quite simplistic, but saying that it is still just fantastic. The soundtrack is beautiful and the story is practically flawless. It does not take that long to complete, roughly 3-4 hours but its worth it.
I can't recommend this enough. Beautiful music, beautiful story.  Never before has a game made me cry.
Great Journey.

This game is really more than a movie than a game. Well, an interactive movie. The game play itself is rather uninteresting, but the story is this games strong point. It starts at the death of an old man and slowly rewinds his life. You learn about why he is the way he is now. It's truly an amazing story filled with intiguing twists.

To be completely fair...I wouldn't call this a game as much as it is an engine for telling a story. That being said the story itself is pretty fair, though it lags a bit in the second act it makes up for it with a few well placed heart wrenching twists in the 3rd. Though the tale is sweet, there is no replay value in this unless you want to relive the few hours of story over and over again while wandering aimlessly from room to room occasionally looking for anything you can click on. The writing isn't the best, but it accomplishes what it sets out to do and the overall feel is charming if not overly memorable. I can't recommend it to everyone, but if what you want is a romantic story then feel free to pick it up.
Omg, just so great, I have know idea how to explain how great this game is, there just aren't enough words in any language to explain, a great story and a great OST, a real masterpiece.

The fantastic character development and compelling story make this a truly unique experience. This game will make you laugh and totally  not  sob like a big baby. Combined with an incredible soundtrack, this is something that should be experienced by all.  11/10.

Love this game i very much recommend it, its short but it deserves every penny you put into it honeslty i leave the menu on sometimes while surfing the internet to just listen to the amazing soundtrack and the ending is one of the best endings for an indie game. I have never had such a indie game change and impact my life.

Beautiful game with a beautiful story that's wonderfully written and executed. ^^ Doubt I could've done it better myself. The mood in the game really sets itself in there, and I fell in love with the music. Not really much to say without giving things away and bursting into tears all over again, but play it!!! You won't regret it!

To the Moon is an amazing story more than a game. You follow a dying man's life memories backwards to implant an artificial memory of him fullfilling his lifelong wish to go to the moon, thereby letting him have a happy memory before he passes. It's not until you reach his childhood memories do you understand the missing pieces and why he wants to go the moon in the first place. It's extremely sentimental, heartfelt, and touching. The soundtrack is so good and beautiful. The game is worth every penny.

This game is simply awesome.  I played the entire game straight through as it kept me wanting to see what happens next.  The story and writing are excellent and take you through quite a range of emotions as you see each twist unfold.  I highly recommend this game!

A must-play.   The story is absolutely amazing. Each moment of it was wonderful, and the well timed OST just amplifies the feeling so much more.  The protagonists are pretty fun to play with as well. Also just a pointer, try using your directional keys for movement and spacebar for interaction. Much better than using mouse. You can always use mouse for help, if you feel stuck, but I found the keyboard much more fun.
Great Game.

Definitely one of the most amazing games I've ever played. Well, more of a story than a game, really. But diving into the memories of 'Johnny', experiencing some of the most memorable moments in his life... Wow. That's pretty much all I've got. Just wow. It's wonderful and heartbreaking, and then wonderful all over again. It will make you laugh and cry (and laugh and cry and laugh etc.), and it will be one of the best experiences of your life. You'd be a fool to miss out on this game.
I cried. A little bit.
Awesome game. This game is only a story line, but it is a great one. Great replacement for a book!
This interactive story tells a heartwrenching tale of love and loss and is truly a beutiful masterpiece. Recommended for anyone who wants a casual interactive game to play through.

The soundtrack alone is so beautiful and the player knows they are in for an amazing experience when that piano starts to play. The music combines perfectly with the artstyle and there were many times throughout the game when I completely stopped what I was doing to observe the scenery and listen to the music. It probably has one of the best stories I have ever seen in a game and the experience is very emotional. (As was mentioned by previous reviews)  Overall, the game has a great soundtrack, that mixes well with the great artstyle, and it's amazing story makes it completely worth the time and money! Buy it!
cried twice
A beautiful point and click visual novel with a wonderfully immersive story.

This is such a beautiful game. From the atmospheric music to the story, everything is beautiful. This is a must play for people who want a rich story filled with comedy (even doctor who and pokemon references), tragedy, and triumph. I busted this out in 4 hours and with a (fairly) reasonable price this is a must play game for people who want a more deep and relaxing game.

Quite a touching plot although it is a bit dull in terms of gameplay. If you are more interested in storytelling than action this is for you, but remember to have some tissues handy (in a non-sexy way).
A very touching love story.  Definitely a must play.
Touching, Deep, Simple.... Amazing.
10/10 Everything's alright.  Don't think, just buy. It's worth it.
My god, I am speechless... and soaked in tears.  Stellar soundtrack, moving story, hilarious comic relief. Wow. Just wow.   10/10
I cried my eyes out and sat in a fetal position contemplating if life is worth living because of this game.  10/10 would go through that crisis again.

I honesty didn't know what this game was about. From one of the screen shots in the store page I somehow expected a RPG. It is not.  Gameplay-wise this 'game' does not have a lot to offer. You collect items through some restricted areas, resolve a puzzle and jump to the next area. It's not the game's strong suit. This is not about gaming, not in the most literal sense anyway.   This 'game' is all about its story. It plays like an interactive movie.  Like many have said before me, it would spoil the whole thing to go into details on why the story is so poignant. And it's also hard to put into words. Think “Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind”.  It is true that this game is all about experience, because, well, it’s about navigating through one person’s history, memories, emotions. The more you dig into that life, the more you uncover some truths. Some feel very wrong, other absolutely great, but the whole process never ceases to feel incredibly intrusive.  This is one of those story where you’re not sure where it’s headed before being close to the end. You don’t really know why that specific objective has been set (having a dying old man go to the moon), you just know you have to get there.  If I were to explain what happens during the big reveal, I would probably make it sound cheesy. But not this game. The execution is great and unravels the missing pieces at the perfect moment. (I’m thinking about the star-gazing scene, for those who are wondering, not the... hum... reverse-engine one)  Once you have reached that point, the rest of the story was pretty much predictable in my opinion, but I still enjoyed it very much. I put on my cry baby suit and didn't stop until the end, or rather 10 minutes after I closed the game.  The conclusion both feels utterly wrong and completely right, and is endearingly beautiful.  You know these movies/books/games/songs that leave you bewildered, happy and sad at the same time? And the feeling lingers on for the rest of day? This is one of them: it has one of the most heartfelt stories I have experienced, up there with the movie I mentioned earlier, Shadow of the Colossus and the likes.  ♥♥♥♥ing play this game.

Oh meh god, where do I even start. This game... this game, is a needle in a haystack. What a unique game, I'm very foutunate to use my hard earn money to give this game a shot and what I got back was mixed emotions; as I laughed, cried, smiled, frowned, and all other possible humane facial expressions out there. All because of a typical RPG game running for 4-5 hours about John's or  Joey's  life.    Joey.....   Those types of scenes, I couldn't believe that any one espically an indie gaming company can come up with these occurances that can really hit you in the feels. Knowing that John would die at any moment + Eva and Neil doing their job and making sacrifices to fulfull John's last wish + John's childhood + The soundtrack (espically the piano instrumentals and Laura Shigihara's voice of an angel) + The reoccuring rude remarks of Neil + Eva having to deal with all that....  and +...    River....  She was basically the icing of the cake in this game for her unique character... As she was limited by her autism, she really made her life complete in both reality and in John's visions. Their relationship is what made this game the most relatable, two different backgrounds and personalities; as they ended up living through the moments together through childhood to death and John's decision to change his memories before he leaves his life, really completed the couple.   I cri everitim...    Looking for a sequel as promised, Freebird Games... If not, replay levels are over 9000, speaking of over 9000    +9000/10

Masterfully written story about a man that has one specific wish to fulfill before he dies. Thanks to futuristic technology you go back through his memories and try to alter the events in a way that his final dream can come true. Even if it happens in his mind only. In your journey you will meet various likeable characters that are far from being one-dimensional. In few cases my perception of certain individuals shifted at least two times during four-hour playthrough. 'Gaming' segments (various puzzles) are integrated well into the story, however, they felt a little bit forced. To the Moon is an absolute delight of a game, I highly reccomend it.

9.5/10 I've always thought indie games were just the cheap way of making a game and after this game, I lost that view entirely. I bought this because it was on sale and I wanted to try something new and short. I did not expect this game to be as great as it was and only started it out of boredom. I'm so glad I did. **The reason my hours are shorter than most is because it was played on offline mode most of the time** The story is unique with many plot twists. The company doesn't put too much work into gameplay because it's the story you are supposed to focus on. If you expect it to be a full shooting and destroy everything game, you'll get a few puzzles for your enjoyment. You play as Johnny and has a very quiet wife, and although she doesn't say much she is one of the most loving characters in the game. The graphics are also quite nice in an indie way. You CANNOT play this game in long breaks, it's one you'd want to continue and even if you didn't, the ending is cute so go play to the end anyways. I've recommended this game to three people so far, and all three love and enjoyed it as much as I did. It's simplistic gameplay with a strong story makes one amazing game.

I usually don't like that people refer to this type of work with 'games' and give them a bad rating but... hey... this is just wonderful. I can't believe to have just been trough this amazing story on a game. This game need to be a film.

*sigh* What can I say about this game. Well, I expected more, I feel empty. The story is good, it keeps you interested enough to keep on playing. It has some really interesting and totally unexpected plot twists. The characters are likeable, you can get attached to them. It also has some awesome references that I'm pretty sure everyone loves. Music is also great.  Now, there are some small mistakes like I wanted options in the game. On fullscreen the game was slightly to the left, resulting in a black area on the right, wanted to switch resolution to solve the problem. The game also a bit loud, being able to control the volume would be nice. Controls are a bit clunky. Other things I didn't like. There are some holes in the story, I feel there are parts that requires explanation, things that the game doesn't tell you, where I feel it's necessary. I also don't get emotionally attached to River and John, at least not much. I honestly do not believe that they loved eachother. River was cold all game not even caring about Johns feelings, and I think she is selfish, while I don't think John really loved River, looking at the not looking up the illness of River, the girl was just a person who is not like everyone else for John. Since I felt no real love between them, I couldn't really grew to them. The story itself is emotional, but mainly because of the two doctors. I built up emotions, I wanted to cry but I couldn't. I'm not attached to John and River, so I'm not really touched by their death, despite the fact that I'm insanely emotional and it's easy to get me crying.  Anyhow, all in all, the story is not bad, if you can buy that the two of them loved eachother, you are going to enjoy it a lot more than I did. It's not a Professor Layton: Unwound Future(the story that touched me the most), but it worths that 4 hours it requires to play it through.
This game makes me cry :'(

I decided to pull an all nighter on a night off and play through a game. And  To the Moon  took me on the wildest feels trip I've had in a while. I feel the way the story is unfolded serves to greatly enhance the plot developments;  To the Moon  is one powerful story I don't think I'll ever forget.  The one thing I'd like to note about the game is that it's primarily controlled with the mouse (although there are some sections that use the keyboard). Using the mouse for movement is unfamiliar and may feel weird at first, but after a few scenes you'll more than likely get used to it and thus it becomes a non-issue.   One last thing I'd like to say is that if you do choose to delve into the fantastic story that is  To the Moon , be sure you have something ready to wipe your eyes with nearby. When I saw how it ended I only cried for 20 minutes.

It's interesting to look back on the days of time I've spent in big sandbox games and realize that-- in terms of experiential memory and fondness-- the five or so heartwrenching hours of To The Moon are still more memorable to me. It's a beautiful game.
A story worthwile telling A story that everybody should enjoy A story that brings tears to your eyes Can't say much more then this is def taking a spot in my top list

A game that has to be experienced, it has more humanity and is more affecting than most movies, music, or literature today - a true diamond amongst rubbish if you can get past its shortcomings.  The gameplay is very tedious and boring, looking objectively, and it was at times frustrating, but for me it was still worth the thousand clicks and badly programmed movement.  The writing was a little amatuerish, I can't help but feel like it was on purpose though. I don't think the writing and dialogue was supposed to be adult and mature. I pretty much ignored the, at times, childish dialogue and focused on the main part.   I still believe it is worth the tiny investment of time and money. Thumbs up!  I think there is a 2 mini episode game Sig corp that has been added to the game, I haven't checked it out yet and I don't know what it is about.

Epic game! Instantly fall in love. Unlike other games, it's feel more likely read a book while listen to good songs. Moreover the story also make me forgot about the graphic and only focus on their story line.  เกมเยี่ยม เพลงเพราะ คุ้มจริงๆ XD   This game deserve the award ;)

To the Moon is not a game but instead an interactive story. There are some mild puzzles but beyond that it's just you the player the story you are presented with, and what a story that is! I won't spoil anything but if your life is affected by the same thing in the story you will pick up on it before the reveal.  Great simple (read catchy) music, fantastic story telling and pace and short play time with a price to match leads this game to being highly reccommended.  Nominated for the “I'm Not Crying, There's Something In My Eye” Steam award
★★★★★ WOW! —this story! —this music! ...is perfect and powerful!

This a breathtakingly beautiful game that completely drew me into the story. I rank it alongside some of my favourite films and books. I enjoyed this game even more the second time I completed it and I hands down recommend this to everyone.

Short but sweet. I urge you to buy this game. Amazing soundtrack to match with an amazing story. The game almost made me cry haha! I can't wait for Finding Paradise :). I really do hope more people out there get to play this game. It is a story that simply can NOT and should NOT be missed! I can't believe it took me 5 years before I was able to pick this game up :)) I have no regrets finding this game whilst browsing the steam store. Mad props to Freebird Games for making this 100mb gem!  10/10 would feel again

What an absolutely brilliant game! The 'full controller support' was iffy at times but that is the only negative thing I have the say. The story was beautiful and had my wife and I in tears for a lot of it - purely because of our proximity to onions, of course ;)

If you like a good story and aren't bothered by a lack of action or modern gaming elements then this is certainly worth the price. With the right combination of humour and melancholy, the story is delivered in a SNES-era RPG format. Oh, and the music is nice.
You just need to find an afternoon, in a chair, with a cup of tea.  Enjoy.

After playing this game, it is not hard to see how much work, time, and emotion was put into creating this game. With a beautiful soundtrack and story that makes you feel compasion for the main character, this game deserves to have you play through it. This was not simply a game, it was you trying to help a dying man fulfill his dream. A simple game that kept you wanting more. I couldn't stop playing the game until it was over.

The best experience I’ve ever had on a computer ! Played it through in one sitting. Not because its short but because I could not stop and just had to know how it ended. worth every cent.  Might not be best for people who have not lived. For an understanding of life is needed to appreciate this master peace.  Voted on 'To The Moon' for The “I'm Not Crying, There's Something In My Eye” Award. There's no oher possible winner for this award!

A very beautiful game. Many call it 'story-rich', and it's story is truly what makes this game. There are some flaws, of course, but the narrative of this game earns its rating. Lots of symbolism to be had, and hearts to be touched, but there's a good amount of humor to balance it all. Worth its keep.

The story is so emotionally moving and inspiring that upon finishing it and going through the ending, you will feel so much better. To say it simply, it is without a doubt a beautiful game, regardless of graphics or whatsoever. If you must cry, it's worth it.
Unlike anything I've every played before. It's a wonderful heartwarming experience you definitely have to give a shot!
literaly good
Dark Souls: Prepare to Cry Edition
Get on the Feel-Train!
Robbed of whatever story award it didn't win
I'm not crying, there's something in my eye.  10/10 feels.
The most beautiful game ever. The soundtrack and the story are just a piece of art. I think that this game can change our way of thinking. :)
If Charlie Kaufman ever wrote for a videogame...  Touching doesn't even begin to describe To The Moon, play this, cry, thank the universe for being alive.

A brilliant example how to tell a touching story in an indie game. Gameplay is lacking and along with visuals are very simplistic, but actually it's not bad for a small indie game made with RPG Maker. What really stands out in this game is the deep and memorable story about two doctors, who try to fulfill the last wish of a dying man. Characters are interesting, although there are no voice acting, but dialogs are well written and full of funny humour. Let's not forget the music, which is fenomenal and lets you really feel the story.  ReDiR`s rating: 9.1

CAN'T CONTAIN THE TEARS    seriously, 10/10 for story and music.
I laughed, I cried, I Tornado Punched a squirrel  11/10
get ready to cry
10/10 would cry like a little baby again.

I have never been the type to sit down and enjoy a game's story and the emotions that it had. But To the Moon really grabbed me emotionally and immersed me in its fantastic story and characters (not to mention an outstanding soundtrack). I recommend buying this game and having some tissues ready becasue this game will tug at your heartstrings.  -Fantastic Game, thank you Freebird Games

I think I actually stopped breathing a few times while playing this. I don't think I've ever experienced such a deep, emotional connection with a game before. If you're here for amazing graphics and challenging puzzles, look elsewhere. If you're interested in a lifechanging experience that will stay with you for the rest of your life, look no further.

This isn't my usual type of game but I'm really glad I gave it a go! I completed this in one sitting, which took 4.6 hours, and that's how I'd recommend it to be played. It's an experience more than it's a game, and is an emotional little gem. It has a good balance of being both amusing, thought-provoking and touching, with a beautiful soundtrack and style. This is one game I'll be thinking about and I look forward to any others that may follow.

I cried at the beginning... I cried at the end... I cried half way through and I cried every time I put pieces of the story together...   And not a cute little anime girl cry. I cried like Oprah... I UGLY CRIED like Oprah
Aside from the poignant story that hit close to home, this game has a lot of 4th wall breaking hilarious moments. And Dr. Who references. Can't go wrong with those.

Wow just wow, i really just lack the words to describe this game. it may not be the most thrilling game gameplaywise, however. it has a storyline thats just beatiful, amazing and near perfect. The way the story is told is just as amazing. incredibly done. I would rate this game an 10/10. i've actually never been this hyped about a storyline before.
This is preeeetty much the best story I have ever read in my life!  ...Or played.  Experienced?  In any case, you should get it!

I'm not usually huge on purely story games, but this game definitely convinced me to try more in the genre. The gameplay was just enough to keep me entertained between the parts of the storyline, and the music and art defnitely contributed a lot to the mood. Try this one out; the story kept me guessing the whole way.
Wonderful game !!!

This is a wonderful little gem. A heavily story based 8-bit adventure game with a lot of heart. I would recommend it to anyone, it's a must for a playthrough to see experience the story. It lacks in both graphics and interactivity, but consider it more of an interactive novel than a game. I can completely understand how this makes people cry, as the story is really touching - not to mention monotone music playing in the background.  Just play it and see for yourself.
Oh my god. I mean...I have seen most every movie/film and read many a book. Almost none have as good a story.  And yeah, even though I had an idea what was happening...still cried. 28 year old man...

This game aims right for the feels. Make no mistake, this is one of those games that's on the level of 'interactive story' or 'art game', but I think it is well worth a play. If you like love stories, this is for you, and I found it especially heartstring-pulling because of how much I can relate to River. This is a sweet story and you'll love every minute of it.  Edit: Four months later and noticing this title in my game list still makes me a little teary-eyed. The soundtrack combined with the story and lovely gameplay has made this one of my favourite games of all time. I cried so hard at the end because it was so very lovely. Still even now I think about this game whever I see or hear about a lighthouse.
Heartwrenching and unique. Plays kinda like a visual novel with a little more interactivity, but the story really sells it.

There are no words to describe the last 4 hours of my life. I bought an indie bundle several years ago that contained this game, and it wasn't available on my current platform, so I never got around to playing it. Found the Steam code a week ago, and saw that a mac version had been released, so I thought, why not? I cannot tell you how much regret I have for not playing this game sooner. What a rollercoaster. Would I rcommend this game? Hell yes. To who? Everyone. If you can't appreciate this game, then you aren't human, and society is doomed. Please play this game all the way through, it is only a few hours, and I can garuntee at least one tear and a whole lot of smiles.  This game has a big spirit, and an even bigger heart.

To the Moon is a beautiful, emotional and sometimes comical tale with very little 'gameplay', but a whole lot of heart. The tale of John and River continues to linger in my day-to-day thoughts even a year after playing it. Now one of my favorite games of all time, I can't stress enough how much you should play this 3-4 hour game.  Tips For Playing:  - Forget what you know about gaming. This game is about buckling in for a rollercoaster of feels through storytelling, not you more standard gameplay machanics. Keep an open mind going in and you should be fine.  - Play it in one sitting. It's a short game! Think of it like a movie; you'll want to finish it in one sitting or it just won't have the same impact on you.  - Turn off other distractions. The musical score is fantastic, and even necessary in setting the mood of the game. If you're the type to listen to your own music collection, a gaming stream, friends on Skype, or what else have you while playing games, turn it off just this once. You'll be glad you did.
3 hours in, the game does not disappoint so far. Will get back to this when I have time.
Very beautiful game :)

And yes...I laughed, I cried...there's no helping it and no regets at all. I wish it was longer and I can't wait to start on their other title!

'To the Moon' was a great experience! Here's the best way to describe the story --- it is a mix of the movies 'Inception' and 'The Notebook' illustrated through Super Nintendo graphics.  As many others have noted in their reviews, 'To the Moon' is for a very specific audience. Do not come into it thinking it will have great game play, state of the art graphics, or 40+ hours of play time with replayability. This is more of an interactive movie experience; there are elements of point-and-click game play involved, but nothing that will make your brain swell or raise your blood pressure. If you do not care for emotional/inspirational/romance movies, this also may not be for you.   With all that being said, if you come into 'To the Moon' expecting what it is, you will not leave disappointed. It is a complex journey that shares the power of the human spirit, illustrated through one man's life (from childhood to his death bed) and his pursuit of dreams versus love, and overcoming regret and loss.   It's a sobering reminder that many of us will lay in a death bed some day (whether old age, accident, cancer, etc.) and the questions will be...will you be at peace, or will you question everything that was your entire life? It's also a simple reminder to enjoy the simple joys in life with the ones you love with what time you are given with them.  'To the Moon' was a great piece of art that I was glad to experience.
BEST STORYLINE  worth my money and tears ;_;

Bought this during the summer sale and paid $1.49 for it. I decided to sit down and play through the whole thing. 4 hours later, it's 3:01 am and I'm borderline depressed that the game is over. I can't recommend it enough. It's a typical indie game (with some bugs) but it has a BEAUTIFUL STORY that will captivate your attention the entire time.  11/10

I got this game as part of an indie bundle a few months ago. I didn't think much of it until last week, when my wife mentioned that she'd heard of it and wanted to check it out. I must admit I was a little bored with the graphics and snarky tone for the first 45 minutes or so. I almost fell asleep, if I'm being honest. But I'm so, so glad I didn't. This turned out to be one of the best gaming experiences I've ever had. The pacing is perfect, the music is beautiful, and the storytelling is just superb. This is a game that will touch you deeply if you give it a chance and will probably stick with you for weeks after you've finished it. Certainly a work of art.

An amazing, touching story for anyone, including non-gamers, to play. While the 'gameplay' isn't the its best feature, the story and music are the shining treasures of this game.   The story will definitely touch you in some way. Don't watch the ending first. This is one of those games where you just have to watch it from the beginning as everything has meaning to it. Watch a Let's Play if you have to, but I recommend supporting FreeBird Games by purchasing it yourself. Especially since one of the artists for the game is currently hospitalized.   The music is one of my favorite parts of the game. I've learned most of the songs from this game on the piano. Definitely get the soundtrack with it. It hits the right mix between calm yet emotional. Just play the game before you listen to the soundtrack. It will make the music more memorable.   All in all, definitely get this game for the story. If you like Mother 3 or sad stories, this is the game for you.

I was taught that a fantastic narrative always came from accurate storytelling. To the Moon was such a narrative.  To the Moon will make you cry, laugh, and smile at the same time. It will evoke a deep, poignant feeling that comes up every so often in our short, but memorable lives. And years from now, while you may forget what happens in To the Moon, you will never forget how it made you feel.  No matter what your age, I encourage you to experience what this game has to offer.   I give To the Moon a 10/10.

Without spoiling anything, To the Moon is one of the best indie games I have ever played, and certainly the most emotionally charged. If my heart was not a steel cage, I would have shed tears. It is light on gameplay, but it more than makes up for that with an interesting story that combines the concepts of Inception and Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind, fantastic sprites and art, and tons of charm. It's short enough to be played in a single afternoon, but it will stay on your mind long after you've played it.

In the end, I cried.  I cried because of why River gave origami rabbits to John, because of what I have seen during his life, because of that final scene.  To the moon may lack gameplay mechanics, it may lack complexity and it may lack playtime.  But it offers beauty in almost every other aspect. The game exists to tell you a story - a sad but beautiful one. It draws characters you automatically connect and sympathize with and it underlines it with lovely music.  So, if you are a person who likes to enjoy a great story which probably cracks your heart and forgive a game for not being a game: Welcome aborts the feel-train.
If you are one of those that are looking for an amazing story and likeable characters, then play To The Moon. And if you like to cry with a game then is mandatory.

To the Moon is the simplest, shortest, most emotional game that I've ever played. The only other game close to meeting that description is Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons, but that game requires more effort than To the Moon, and therefore does not get 'simplest.' Nothing else that I've played has really gotten near these attributes.  I went into this game expecting it to be highly overrated. My main reasoning for that is because I have played many RPG Maker games before, years and years back, and never found any to be really great. Therefore, I was extremely surprised to hear this RPG Maker game getting so much praise almost universally, for so long.  And surprise hit me again when I realized how much I agreed with everybody else. To the Moon has very great artistic style for something made in RPG Maker. The maps are simple but very well-made, with lots of thought in organization and layout. The characters actually have nice movements to fit their actions. The animations and designs work with the premise of the story - all are done well.  The story itself, so unexpectedly emotional. Learning about the old man in reverse time is, theoretically, a simple idea in such a sci-fi / futuristic type of story, but it was so efficiently planned. There are so much questions that pop up along the way, and as you slowly get your answers, they just make you feel more attached to the story, to the characters, despite only being invested in them for a few hours. Every little 16-bit person seems like they are real. They seem more natural than many people I've ever seen in such a simple video game.  The music and sound fit in so well with all of their scenes, and only serve to help the emotions you get as you play. It all made me smile, laugh, get angry, want to cry - you name it. The ending of the game and the song played there... I think many people have gone to listen to the soundtrack long after playing this game, and I understand why.  As I said, the game is the 'simplest' - and really, it is a story. You have control of the characters; you explore to learn; you solve puzzles to continue. But the game does not require much effort to keep moving, and in many ways, it makes sense that this choice was made. The story would not be so touching if you had to spend a lot of time trying to get past difficult puzzles, as you would only get more angry at the game itself.  I definitely wish that I could experience this game again, without knowing anything about it. But of course that is not possible... unless Neil and Eva were to help me out.

To The Moon...An emotional story about two doctors fulfilling a dying man's wish to travel to the moon. Not only does this game have a beautiful story with a balance of emotional feels and comic relief, but also including a wonder soundtrack and visual stunning graphics. Now, there are many other reasons why I love this game, but one of the biggest reasons I fell in love was because of one character; River.   River is a girl diagnosed with Autism much later in her life, unlike those who are usually diagnosed as a child. Due to River's socially awkward and obsessive behavior over certain objects and the lack of ability to understand social norms her symptoms come off as believable and realistic. As someone with autism I am extremely happy to see an autistic character protrayed so well. I found myself to relate more so towards another autistic character by the name of Isabelle. Isabelle is a friend of River's, describing herself as an actress, because she's been raised to appear neurotypical. I found myself relating a lot to River and Isabelle, two characters that I absolutely adore.   I recommend this game a playthrough for its emotional story, beautiful bgm, and the wonderful characters that run the story. ^-^

To The Moon's story could be told as a movie, it could be told as a book, but it is at its most effective as a game that you play through and experience. And ultimately, that is what To The Moon is. It's an experience that is well worth every second spent. It just might be my favorite piece of entertainment of all time, and it is glorious.
