Even though I was fully aware of how this game would play out like that and was perfectly fine with playing an interactive novel (I love the Phoenix Wright games) I couldn't help but feel utterly dissapointed in this game hence the 'not recommended' review. The whole thing just feels like it's in the wrong format, it doesn't feel like it should be a game. The only thing that differentiates this as a game from anything else is the segments where you have to walk around and interact with stuff until the story progresses and you go back to reading again. These segments were an ABSOLUTE CHORE; they were so unbelievably boring the only reason I was doing them was to progress and get to the next point in the game. The game also features cheap puzzles called momento puzzles that offer no fun value whatsoever and are so astoundingly unoriginal. In my personal opinion To the Moon should of been made as an animated short or perhaps even an animated movie, it feels like something that would fit in a Hayao Miyazaki movie. I do not dislike this game I just don't recommend buying it and I usually absolutely despise saying this but perhaps this game is best experienced by a Let's Player on YouTube. If you want to support Free Bird Games by buying this game then feel free to do so but for me this game didn't feel like it was worth the small amount of money it was to buy it.

I heard from a bunch of people that 'To the Moon' is a good adventure which story is very intimately told. So I tried it but was very disappointed. The story is super cheesy and the adventure part offers no puzzles whatsoever and reduces the gameplay to repeatedly clicking on some obvious items in the scene without brain activity. In the end I had no desire to force me through the game and uninstalled it.

To The Moon isn't just a game. It's a masterpiece.  While every short, clocking in at about 3-4 hours depending on how fast you read, the story is very, very heartfelt and gripping.  You follow Dr. Watts and Dr. Rosalene as they enter Johnny's mind on his deathbed in an attempt to grant his final request. Watch, change, and interact with the past as Johnny's life is shown and makes you wonder the age old question...'What if?'.  To The Moon is one of those games you instantly fall in love with. With it's simple, but elegant design, incredible writing, and thrilling, heartfelt tale, To The Moon is more story than game, but what a story it is.  This is definitely one of those games every gamer should play at some point in their life. I really cannot go into more detail without spoiling the story or experience. It's just one of those games you have to experience for yourself. And at it's price, it's hard to say no.    A Must Play

I had high hopes for this game given the rave reviews and made sure to play it through to completion to discover whatever twist I'd been told 'transcends art.' Instead, I got a hamfisted, entirely predictable story interrupted by some clicking. For a game that is touted as handling autism in an enlightening and sympathetic manner, it really feels as though the authors have no firsthand experience with the subject matter.  Pacing was poor, I found myself waiting rather than being actively engaged. The story itself wasn't fleshed out, and didn't really offer any opportunity to connect with the characters. The attempted humour was seemingly disconnected references tossed in willy-nilly. Adventure/puzzle are my absolute favourite games and this left me very disappointed. Progression was entirely linear and didn't leave any room for thought. I think my biggest peeve is the dialogue can't be hurried or skipped. You have to wait for an entire bout of uninteresting bickering between the two playable characters (of which there is plenty) before you can move on with the story.  On the plus side, the music and visuals were worthwhile.

I can not reccomend this game. The reason why is classical sprite games are not that appealing when showing a story line I don't see the whole appeal other than Dialog. I want a game Not A Story Board im not a 5 year old wanting watch a puppet show on the computer. There is nothing in this that makes this a actuall game other than some stuiped puzzle crap.
overrated and slowpaced, which is a shame, because I was hoping this game would be enjoyable.

I am giving it a thumbs down, but hear me out why. It gets repetitve soon and fast. I clocked in about 90 minutes (the whole game is about 4 hrs long), and I felt it being 'same old, same old.' The story so far has been solid, but I just got too bored with the gameplay to continue finishing the story (so I wikipedia'd the rest). If you are an RPG person or a person that likes Japanese-style games, I definitely recommend this to you. If you're fine with repetition and a solid story, you would enjoy this... But if you get bored with repetition fast or are not a fan of RPG-style gameplay, this one's not for you... AKA not for me.

Yeah, I bought this game on sale so I thought I'd give it a shot. I heard a lot of good things about it. That being said, I believe I set my expectations too high and by the end of the game, was a bit disappointed. Don't get me wrong, the soundtrack really helped to set the mood and the bits of comedy were refreshing, but the plot twists and the ending were so so. I regret buying this game :\
I'm so glad its over - that is one of the boringest games I ever finished. I just kept thinking, 'its almost over, might as well finish it'

No. I bought this on recommondation from a friend, and I barely made it ten minutes in before I had to shut it off. Insufferable dialogue, chitzy style and graphics, and despite all the praise I can't stand the melo-dramatic music. I realize the underlying story might be serious, as the underlying story in an over the top anime may also be serious. Simply put, the execution of this is just severely off-putting to me.  Is it a bad game? Not necessarily. Would I recommend it? No. Not really. I would recommend watching some gameplay videos (something I did not bother to do) - as if you enjoy the style, you may not have the reaction I did.

I dislike the story, dialogue, gameplay, and visuals. The plot is a Frankenstein's monster of independent movie premises. It exploits every hack writing trick to create melodrama. The music is well done, and used for generating the tone of the game.  I forced myself to keep playing just so I could finish the game, but it glitched and my horse got trapped. If I wanted to keep playing, I would need to start over from the beginning. That's when I decided to give up trying to find something redeeming in this mess.  If you appreciate good narrative, then avoid this game.  If you are easily decieved by bad writing when complimented by good music, then defend this game by downvoting my review. This is less an instruction than a forecast.

A good story mixed with a dreadful game. The gameplay is dull and the controls are awkward. In some sense, it's actually impressive how they managed to screw up the controls in such a simplistic game.  The story might be a bit cheesy and short, but good. Not worthy of any awards, but good. The story is the main selling point of the game, no two ways about it. The game is described as a 'story-driven experience' and tagged as 'story rich', so as you might expect the gameplay takes the back seat. But there's the problem: the game itself is so bad that it serves only as a distraction to the story. Every moment I spent actually playing the game was only so that I could continue the story. I would have prefered only the story, with no game at all. In other words, a movie.  So do I recommend it? Well, maybe. If you are willing to suffer through a bad game while being told a good story, then sure. If you want to support the developers, then sure. But if you want a good game, then stay far away from this one. Everything this game has to offer has been done much better. If you want a point-and-click game, there are plenty which are actually good as opposed to this one which is bad. If you want a puzzle game, same thing. And while the story is good, there are plenty of better ones. Just read a good book or watch a good movie. Even some games have better stories. This game is hilariously over-praised.

I wanted to love this game. After playing games like 'Brothers,' this was suggested to me. I was ready for the experience. But in the end, with a ton of games in my stable and decades of gaming, I ended up just dropping it - unable to motivate myself to play any longer. Here's why.  I love adventure games but I don't get why people love old school graphics. I grew up with Kings Quest, Ultima etc. and despite getting nostalgic for those classics, why would I want to play on sucky looking games? So really I found the unatractiveness of the presentation a real bore. Some peole love that stuff and if that's you, get this game and have a cry. I just don't see the point in this day and age. By all means give me a game with the meaning and the feelies, but tell me a great story with at least some decent presentation please!  But it's not just the graphics. It's the gameplay. Again, as an experienced adventure gamer who even used to play text based adventures like Zork and Wishbringer, I didn't mind it in the 80's but it's not like I want to play them again. Fetch quests get dull after a while no matter what. Adventure games need a emotional/psychological pay-off with every completed task to motivate the player. This one, for me, doesn't have enough.   There are a lot of admirable adventure games old and new. They might not all have the poignant subject matter of 'To the Moon' but I prefer something that not only has a good story but decent graphics and good game mecahnics as well. So, I just can't finish this one because I find it tedious. Alternatives: The Longest Journey, Grim Fandango, Syberia, Machinarium.

I think/hope/dread that I am half way through this drab piece of story telling, not a game! I cannot find this engaging at all and the actual game play drags on. The only thing resembling a game at all is childish flipping of pictures. I cannot recommend this even for the story that is dragging on and on.  I am very open to unique story telling experiences within games and often go for story over flashy game play, but this is ridiculous!

I know I'm gonna get heat for this...  I didn't enjoy this game.  I know everyone said the story was 'engaging' and 'heartfelt'. I know how this will make me sound like a big @$$ but it felt incredibly forced and hamfisted to me.   There was some funny writing to be had yes, but I found myself wanting to be done with the game. The subject matter is something that needs to be addressed, especially as we understand autism more and more. But it felt like that season of Community where Dan Harmon wasn't leading the show and EVERY EPISODE some other character refers to Abed's 'condition'. The same thing happened here, or at least it felt that way.
Nice game with a very pleasant plot. However the gameplay is just a followup the story.

This isn't a game, it's a barely-interative 3 hour cutscene with one of the dumbest stories: A guy's wife dies of aspergers and he wants to honor her memory by hiring scientists to trick him into thinking he is flying a space shuttle to the moon.

Sweet story, and worm gameplay. Greate piece of art for a Undergraduate school project. But I have to honest, this is not a great commercial product, not because of technology, but because of scripts and dialouges. They feel amaturish

This is not a game in any real sense. While it is “interactive” in the sense that you move around the environment and interact with objects, in truth the interactivity is an illusion; yoru movement in the environment is about as interactive as turning a page in a book most of the time, and at times is actually more tedious because you have to search for where you need to click to get to the “next page” – in the case of this game, the next bit of dialogue or cut scene. The only real “game” elements it contains is a single game of whac-a-mole towards the very end – which you do not need to succeed at to progress in the game, and which actually has no impact on the game at all, as far as I can tell – and some simplistic tile-flip puzzles which are present for the first third or so of the game. These feel wholly out of place in the game and are simply discarded later on. There is no possibility of failure in the game, and the one section that might feel remotely “game-like” is mostly just tediously walking down a hallway for about five minutes – if that. In the end, it is much closer to a movie than anything else – and most likely, should have been exactly that.  The story ultimately has four main characters. Dr. Eva Rosalene and Dr. Neil Watts are the two primary protagonists of the game, and are who the player controls throughout the length of the story. They work for the Sigmund Corporation, a corporation which specializes in rewriting the memories of dying people so that they can experience a different life in which a single wish comes true. The way this is accomplished is by entering the minds of the dying person, viewing their memories, and going back to their childhood and implanting a very strong desire to complete whatever one wish they wanted to see; because they would have a singular, powerful drive their whole life to achieve that goal, their mind will simulate them succeeding at that task (most of the time, anyway; it is implied that it is not foolproof, but that it is pretty reliable) and they will live out their dream in their mind before dying.  The inspiration from  Inception  is obvious, but the game itself has a very different take on things; the goal, in the end, is very different, and the Sigmund Corporation is paid to by the dying people to grant these mental wishes. We immediately see that Dr. Neil Watts is the funny, goofy, eccentric guy, while Eva Rosalene is the competent, no-nonsense character; even still, both have their moments of seriousness and comedy, and Dr. Neil Watts is definitely a Jerk with a Heart of Gold type character, who tries to cover up his soft spots whenever he does not absolutely have to do so.  The dying man in question, Johnny Wyles, is being tended to by his housekeeper, Lily, whose two children run around the house. Early on, I thought that Lily and the children might play some sort of significant role in the story, but in the end they’re only bit parts; the real major players are Johnny Wyles and his deceased wife, River Wyles. As we go back through time via Johnny’s memories, we see events unfold in reverse, and come to understand why things ended so badly for Johnny and River, and why Johnny was unhappy with his lot in life in the end.  The story, on the whole, is reasonable, though there are a few strange plot-holes – for instance, River dies because they cannot afford to pay for both her medical treatment and the new house that they’re building, and River believes that the house is more important than her life, but somehow, Johnny can afford to have a full-time caregiver live in his house, as well as afford presumably expensive end-of-life treatment which allows him to achieve his dream of going to the Moon – something he himself does not even understand, and which the player only learns the true reason for very near the end of the game. The final memory sequence throws a different cast on many of Johnny’s other memories, and it was neat to see how they’d incorporated the hints as to what had really happened earlier in the game.  That being said, I was actually a bit disappointed by the game’s true ending because, unfortunately, I came up with a much better plot twist partway through the story. The first time their attempts at implanting the memories failed, I went back to view Johnny as an old man and the memory was exactly the same. However, there was something which was very interesting which immediately caught my eye – Johnny could not explain why he wanted to go to the Moon, which was seen as unusual by the two doctors, and supposedly made their lives much more difficult.  It was at this point that I realized their brilliant masterstroke – the reason Johnny had no idea why he wanted to go to the Moon was because they (or someone else) had implanted the idea that he wanted to go to the Moon, and thus it felt like an unnatural desire which was simply foisted off onto him that made him feel compelled to wish for it in the end.  I was severely disappointed when it turned out that this was not the case, and the actual cause for it was very different. It wasn’t a terrible reason – even if it was a bit cutesy and a bit clumsy at the same time – but it just didn’t stack up to the plot twist I had built up in my head, and thus I ended up feeling a bit disappointed by the revelations of the true ending of the story.  In the end, the story took a fairly long time to get through, and I got the feeling that it would have made more sense as a movie than it did as a “video game” – moving around in the environment was mostly unnecessary tedium, and the game at times went into cutscenes which showed that it could have simply been a movie the whole way through. It would have gone by a lot more quickly, and likely been several hours shorter as more of a visual novel or movie-like experience, and I think I would have enjoyed it more as such. The pacing was a bit of a problem in places, particularly towards the end when Eva sets everything up for the grand finale off-screen without explaining it to Neil (and thus, the player), creating some unnecessary tension between the two for no good in-character reason. The sequence could have been greatly shortened, made much more visually interesting, and it still would have worked; instead, it felt weird and unnecessarily drawn-out.  There were also a few moments of extreme strangeness. Perhaps the greatest is when the characters at the start of the second act of the story, unable to figure out how to get Johnny to want to go to the Moon, start bursting into Johnny’s memories at random to pitch the idea of going to the Moon to him. While the characters at this point are very sleep deprived, the mood whiplash in this section of the story is severe, as went from some fairly serious memories with humor thrown in to lighten the mood to frenetic comedic action on the part of both of the protagonists. While the humor which was interspersed into the rest of the game actually worked pretty well, the humor in that particular section felt off and too extreme; it is never mentioned again afterwards.  All that aside, the core of the story worked well enough, and while it wasn’t as good of a story as the one I made up in my mind about halfway through the game, I can’t say that I disliked it or felt like the game cheated me, and am interested in seeing if they do something else interesting with the characters in the future – the story ended with the promise that it was “Episode 1 – To the Moon” and, while the story of Johnny and River was tied up in the story, Neil and Eva, our scientist protagonists, have more patients to deal with and more things to do. I’m interested in the idea of seeing what else could be done with them, but I'm not sure I want to spend five hours instead of two watching them do it.

Doesn't live up to the hype. I mean, the game is ok, but from the reviews I expected.. more.  The story is above average for an indie game, but the writing is poor, with dialog in particular being terrible. Many story elements are oddly under- or over-played. Kudos for risk-taking and creativity, but I can't recommend this as a full-price purchase. Wait for a sale, and then it might be worth 4 hours of your life if you crave a change of pace.

PLEASE NOTE: THE REASON WHY I'M NOT RECOMMENDING THIS GAME IS NOT BECAUSE IT'S BAD. DON'T INSTANTLY DOWNRATE THIS REVIEW - READ AHEAD FOR MORE DETAILS!  This game is a true marvel. The story is original, very touching, with characters you have an emotional attachment to by the end of the game, and plot twists that seem to come out of nowhere and surprise you. This game also has a great sense of humour, along with references here and there that make you grin ever-so-slightly. The graphics are also nice for their type, and dialogue is great. The music, though - it's AMAZING!  There's only one problem with this game. There's really no sense paying for it to play it. The gameplay is simply not fun. You walk around, click on objects, solve a little puzzle, and repeat some twenty times. To be honest, I recommend you watching this masterpiece of a story on Youtube. Watching the story unfold before your eyes would be so much better than playing it because, in all honesty, this is more of a story game rather than an action game. Save your ten dollars and watch a run of it on Youtube - I promise you won't regret it.  Again, I repeat, THIS GAME IS NOT BAD. The story is fantastic, BUT IT'S BETTER TO WATCH IT ON YOUTUBE. If you still want to play this game, though, get it on a sale. I would say ten dollars for fairly bland gameplay is not worth it, but the story is worth so much more.

This game is as interesting a a slice of bread with toast; it's fine as is, but still lacking til you put jelly or jam on it. I couldn't play past entering the mansion cause I'd already lost interest in continuing. It's also unacceptable there's no graphics setting for this game. If you like this kind of game, I'd highly suggest getting it whilst on sale only.

No. Just no.  I wanted SO MUCH to like this game. But the hamfisted plot and the shallow characters that try to pass themselves off as 'deep' get in the way of any sort of emotion the game tries to muster up. A lot of the plot feels like its been cheaply designed in order to wring tears out of everybody - and as a result, the game NEVER turly earns its tears, only being able to cheaply grab them through false emotions and false characters.   And what false charactes they are. For example, there is a character that is defined almost exclusively by her mental affliction. (I am trying to avoid spoilers here for the people who haven't played the game yet, but I will have a section on spoilers at the very bottom of this review for people who have beaten it already.) Anyway, there is pretty much nothing to that character - her personality and actions merely come off as side effects of her affliction. Where's her feelings? Where's her personality? They're not there.   And on top of that we have the grossly manipulative plot - look, here's a song you can cry to that has two notes!!! Aren't you so endeared because it's two notes?!?!? And, Hey, we have this actress character who won't stop being pretentious and preachy about what she has to say!!!!! Isn't she DEEP?!?!?!?!? And hey, here's this character with a sad fate that we bring up with no foreshadowing whatsoever AT THE VERY END OF THE GAME!!!! Doesn't that make you SAD?!? Point is, the game is trying so hard to show itself off as having a 'DEEP STORY' that it, ironically, reveals its own shallowness and the flaws of its own plot.  All the annoying rage aside, the shame of To the Moon is that it could very well have been a good game. The setup itself is very well-done, and could have very well been a breeding ground for all sorts of truly emotional stories. There are a couple of admittedly charming moments (a talk on Doctor Who, in particular, actually did make me smile inside). And the game has very well done 16-bit-esque graphics. However, all of these little 'good' things about the game do barely anything to get away with the bad taste of the story and the game as a whole.  Some people might complain that the gameplay, which pretty much consists of collecting hidden objects to get to the next memory and then solve an fairly easy tile puzzle, is barely even there, and that is also true. I am not opposed to a near-complete lack of gameplay if the game's story is well-done.........but, as I have of course mentioned before, the story feels manipulative and its emotions feel unearned.   In the end, I would say that if you really want to play To the Moon - go right ahead and see for yourself what you think of it. To the Moon is, at the very least, a mildly intriguing experiement on how to tell a story within a game, and it must be experienced for oneself before one can really, truly judge it. And who knows what you'll think? You might even outright love the game. But - try to consider, if you can or if you want to, how desperately the game tries to wring tears out of the player, and don't be entirely shocked if you have a disappointed reaction like I did.  4.0/10        ON SPOILERY STUFF:  I can't talk about all of what annoyed me about this game without getting into some pretty deep spoilers. So, if for any reason you haven't played the game and are reading this right now, then leave immeadiately.       As I mentioned vaugely in the review, I was extremely annoyed by   how River was portrayed as being defined almost entirely by her autism.   As someone who has   a few, diagnosed pinches of Asperger's Syndrome,   it annoys me how   River   felt less like an actual, real person and more like a checklist that ticks off all the   symptoms of autism   one by one. The character of   Isabelle   also felt like an extremely manipulative way to force the player to relate with somebody   with autism,   especially when she did nothing but preach and preach about   autism   in general.  On top of that, some of the game's philosophies on   autism   felt like a huge slap in the face to me. Am I 'concealing' myself in any way if   I don't show myself as autistic, especially if people will judge me as soon as they know that I am?   Am I so detached as to   think of a lighthouse as more of a person than actual people?   Do I   keep completely silent about childhood memories for no reason at all?   These sorts of things in the game's story are not how I behave at all in real life, and not how any kid I've seen   with autism   has behaved either. (There is a 'devil's advocate' argument there in that   every child with autism of any sort is affected by it in different ways,   but I have a very hard time believing that any of them would be   as detached as River is in the game   without some sort of extreme personal tragedy.)  I do realize that in the main review, I do kind of come off as a bit of a heartless a-hole. But this comes from anger at how - there's no other word for it - unrealistic the game's   portrayal of autism   is. I do appreciate that   some of the money that the game has received is going toward charities for autism   - but the fact is, this game is the same type of BS that I've been getting for years in   dumb social thinking classes for autistic kids (I finally got out of these classes a while back, but I had to deal with them until I was a junior in highschool, and even then pretty much all of the autistic friends who are In high school with me are still dealing with them).   I honestly don't think that we, as a society, can truly deal   with autism   until we all realize that the people who are   affected by it are, actually, generally normal people, not creepy and detached freaks   - and I think that this game is a huge step backwards, in that the people who play this will have some skewed understanding of what   autism   is, instead of seeing   how normal the people who are affected by it actually are.    (Also,   sliping in an inexplicable identical twin at the very end   is TERRIBLE storytelling form. In ANY sort of story.)

This was an interesting and touching story ......... but fundamentaly it is a story not a game and that's why I don't recommend it if you are seeking a gaming experience, as I was. The gaming / interactive aspects were limited in the extreme and bottom line for me, this could merely have been uploaded to youtube to watch rather than 'play'.

There's not much of a game here. That can be ok as other games have succeeded as being interactive novels or exploration based. But, as an interactive novel there's not much here either.   The concept is clever, but the writing gets very juvenile sometimes and often relies on nerd-culture tropes and jokes that aren't funny or clever. Also, what few gameplay elements there are (really simple hunt and find, simple puzzles) barely register. The game ends up being almost purely narrative.   There's definitely some really cool ideas here, but they've been executed better elsewhere.

Maybe it was all the hype, maybe it was something else, but I did not particularly enjoy the game. The story was underwhelming, gameplay was slow-paced and the attempted jokes fell extremely flat (Watts could be the most insufferable character ever).  I guess I can appreciate what the game tried to do, but ultimately it left me dissatisfied.

I went into this with decent expectations. I thought it looked like an interesting story from the trailers, and i had heard it had gotten pretty good ratings. But in all honesty, the game ended up just being a disappointment.  First things first, I'm gonna say the two things I liked about this game. The concept and the music.   The concept I enjoyed quite a bit. A company that goes around giving dying people a chance to relive their life or alter their memories in order to give them a more peaceful death. Sounds like an interesting way to tell a story and can lead to lots of philosophical questioning about what it means to be a 'self' and if rewriting the wrongs of your life leads you to a satified death. Could you rewrite your life so that nothing ever goes wrong? What will you have learned? The game never gets that deep though so don't worry about that. I don't hold that against it, that's something I personally find cool, but is most likely very hard to write about and probably can get a little too deep for a lot of people. Still the concept of editing memories is always a novel one to me.  The music definitely has some quality to it. Now I know everybody praises the music for this game, but I have to admit, while it's not bad, it's nothing really special either. When you finish playing the game there aren't any tunes that get stuck to you. Most of the songs are little piano diddies. They're more mood setter's than they are memorable catchy tunes. It ultimately comes off as generic piano music. Good music, but generic. Definitely nowhere near some of the best indie game soundtracks (ex. Bastion, Braid).  Now where does this game go wrong? I have to say its weakest point is the writing. Some points the writing is good. Usually anything dealing with Johnny (the central character whose memories you're walking through) is decently written. It can be sappy and is usually pretty serious, but it pulls off sappy alright. The worst writing, however, is usually between the two scientists (the characters you'll mainly control). There's just nothing believable about their interaction and it put me off quite a bit. Their relationship is an annoying case of silly guy + serious girl. It is very tiring and predictable. Here is a summary of most of their dialogue:  Guy: Makes a groan inducing joke purposely. Girl: Respond with either: '...' or *bitingly sarcastic comment*  These characters are kind of supposed to be the comedic relief, but it never results in comedy, so there is never any relief. This set up is never funny, and it actually makes the writing feel very amateurish. The game also makes self referential jokes a little too frequently for my liking. They must've made fun of the main theme at LEAST 3 times, saying how it's repetetive. If this were the only fault then the story might be ok, but the sappy story is just that, sappy and not strong enough to hold everything together. Everything ends up being quite predictable (some little twists but nothing too crazy). None of the characters really grow or seem to learn anything. It's a love story that you've probably heard before with nothing new to tell you. Honestly, a lot of the writing sort of feels like an anime or something (which is to say, not that great).  The game is made with RPG maker so it doesn't look that great. That's fine right? I mean books don't have pictures most of the time and they can convey emotion and get emotional attachment. Sadly, the writing isn't strong enough to get you attached. I think what might've helped is if there were some hand drawn pictures to show some moments in the game. They do show a picture at one point, but that's it. Though you can tell that the quality of the picture isn't the best, so it's probably for the better that they didn't have much hand drawn art in the game.  Now some people would argue that this hardly a game. I don't wanna go down that route though. I would think that you should be able to tell from the trailers and such that it's not a very 'Gamey' game. That being said, I think there is something to say about linear story telling in this medium. There are ways to do it and ways not to do it. You'd think with the premise of editing memories that the game would have a highly non linear aspect to it. Alas, the game does not take advantage of its concept and really doesn't take advantage of being a game.  That isn't to say that the game is completely devoid of game elements. You still have to walk around and explore and collect 5 or 6 orbs to move on to the next memory. You get orbs by witnessing events and clicking on objects in the memories. Click all the objects you're supposed to click and then you get to solve a little puzzle. The puzzles are simple and not frustrating. They can get a little complex but they never go anywhere too difficult. It's better that way because you really just want to move the story along, not solve puzzles, but this makes the puzzles just kind of seem like a time waster.   This is a story driven game with a fun concept but a weak story. The little amount of interactivity and poor writing makes it feel like you're just turning pages in a book written by an amateur. If you want an interesting love story involving memory manipulation, you're probably better off just watching Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind instead of playing this game.
Not a memorable story. Clunky controls, boring gameplay, low replayability value. Go read a book instead
massively overrated
I have never cried tears of rage before. I suppose I should be thankful for the experience, but you'd be surprised.

Id rather watch a youtube video of someone playing the story of this game. There is nothing else to do other than what the game wants you to do to progress the story.  There basicly is no options menu so there is no way to change windowed or etc.
Not for me, I finished the game but it was to disjointed to really enjoy, I just wanted to finish it. gggg.

There is no arguing that this is a very beautiful and sweet story. Unfortunately I have to judge it as a game and the gaming qualities are not as strong. There is absolutely no gameplay here. It is a matter of figuring out where to go and what to click to make the story move forward.

This was created with RPG maker and has made its creator money by relying on a gimmicky 'make you cry' cut and paste combination of overused sad movie tropes. Watch Rainman, Slingblade, and some other movies involving mental illness and accidental child murder to achieve the same results. The only reason I was able to tolerate this was by being drunk the entire time I played it.
There were no bitcoins or (the far superior) Dogecoins to be found. 1/10 would not use to make money.

An interactive story with absolutely no gameplay at all, except for walking from point A to point B. The graphics and music are quite good, though. The worst thing about this game is the crappy dialogue with its kindergarden level 'humour'.  Recommended for 12-year-old girls.
If you like repeating the same thing over and over this game is for you!

For something that can be finished in 3 hours it sure feels like you are stuck playing for much longer.  Terrible pacing and quite frankly the story which others seem to think is emotionally deep only goes to suggest they haven't read much in their lives. The humour also was cheap, forced and only relevent to the meme crowd.   Basically the concept is great, but every part of the execution was poor. Could not honestly recommend.

To The Moon isn't really a game. It's more of a visual novel with small amounts of interaction. The writing and plot are almost always interesting, save for a few character tropes that get annoying, but there is nowhere near enough of anything remotely gameplay related to even call this an RPG. There are 'choose your own adventure' books that have more gameplay mechanics present than To The Moon. As a game I cannot recommend it. As a story it's worth a look, but not at $10. Pick this one up at 75% off.

An okay game that -- I feel -- didn't live up to the rave reviews (perhaps I just got swept up in the hype; good thing I got the game on Steam Sale for 75% off).  It's a lot of reading, crappy controls, no options except for save/load/exit. The 16-bit graphics give it that old-school, retro feel. The story is simple enough and, in my humble opinion, cliché and predictable. Expect around 3 of hours of gameplay max to run through the story (it took me longer because I idled and AFK'd plenty). No replay value at all.  6/10
A masterpiece. The final nail in the coffin of the eternal argument on whether or not games are shart. 'To the Moon' proves once and for all, with a resounding 'YES,' that games ARE shart.
I was promised tears, but all I got was some terrible 90's J-RPG mechanics and jaded pop-culture references.
Boring as hell. The story and music are great, but its nothing more than a slow paced, spread out anime.  4/10 its just weeaboo bait.

It seems to be a common theme in reviews to this game that it might move the player to tears. I didn't find that to be the case, but I might believe that it would bore the player to tears. I think this might be better rehashed as a simple walk-through interactive story kind of game, because the 'game' components are severely lacking. The basic notion is that you play as one of a pair of scientists brought to a dying man's bedside to install in his mind the memories of having gone to the moon. It is an interesting premise and in a different medium, I would likely have enjoyed it.   The way the game unfolds is that you watch a cut-scene providing a bit of story then are left wandering around to find memory-triggering objects. When you've collected the objects, you bring them to a portal and solve a simple puzzle involving toggling rows and/or columns of an image until the whole image lines up properly. There is no conflict for the player to resolve, nor is there much interplay between the game elements and the puzzle elements (to be clear, the objects collected and images revealed are often references to parts of the story, but the player's presence is one merely of observation rather than interaction).   The graphics are very good, however, in a style similar to and quality comparable to some of the best rpg's and overhead hack'n'slash adventures of the 16 bit era. Dialog is similarly on par with games of that era. I found it generally too corny but it was definitely true-to-style of 16 bit JRPG translations (I find those generally too corny, as well). The music is well-done but overdone. There is solemn piano piece that, while pleasant to listen to a few times, starts to really grate in a depressing way in extended sessions.   Bottom line: There's no game to the game. I appreciate the dev's willingness to take a leap on an experimental concept but it ultimately fell flat for me. I think perhaps the concept would be more suitaed to a passive medium like film or prose, or that the idea should have been worked to incorporate the player into the story in a way that make's the player's role more integral. I got about a third the way through the game and never really felt any connection to the story unfolding or to the characters shown. As a result, I just wasn't enjoying the time I spent playing To the Moon (it felt at least twice as long as the > 2 hours steam reports I played) and as a result, I gave up on it.
-Soundtrack is good -Pixels are overly busy -Dialogue isn't good -Move speed is way too slow, feels like plodding along
The game play is terrible. Very tedious. The story is nice though, but would have rather read it as a book or short film instead of a game.

Ah... I was prepared for the feels when I read everyone's comments on how this game is just so feel-tastic... but holy cow. What a beautiful game! The casual banter between the two scientists really breaks up the otherwise sad tone of the game. I came out of it feeling hope for the world. Thank you again, FreeBird!

Short game (about 4 hours) with a beautiful music and a nice/sad story. I recommend you not play it if you feel sad or if you are not interested in reading. Love and dreams, all together with a 'happy' ending...

This was a very good game in my opinion. There were a good amount of slow parts, but overall I think this game was a solid buy. If you do get this game, I would recommend making sure no one will bother you in any part of this game, or else it will ruin the moments this game creates. The game was short, but I think that's how it's supposed to be. All in all, I would recomend this game
Water is leaking from my eyes!! I didn't know games could do that... 10/10
I can't remember what drew me to this game, but man am I glad it did! The whole time playing this was a fantastic journey. Wonderful story and great visuals. 10/10.
To the Moon is more of an interactive movie than a game, but it's one of the most amazing interactive movies I have ever played.    Personal thoughts
Beautiful game, beautiful story. If all games had storylines as good as this, I would have no life.

First off, let me just get this out of my system: HOLY ♥♥♥♥ I LOVED IT!  *ahem* Now that thats taken care of... I'm going to keep this short and sweet.  If you are a fan of intense storylines in your games, then this is a definite title for you. Keep in mind the gameplay is minimal at best, with it more being an interactive storyline.  Now most times I would say that the gameplay can be just as important as the story, but this tale is emotionally powerful that this is a shining example of an exception to that idea. Not just the narrative, but the music as well. The soundtrack will masterfully supplement this emotionally charged ride from start to finish and leave you speechless, wishing there was more. I, personally, am still reeling from this amazing piece of artwork.  I can recommend this to anyone who devours stories such as these with the same voracity as myself, and urge everyone to give it a shot!

i..i. ohh god the feels, i never expected this, not from this game. i didnt expect..i didnt believe the reviews that said this would take you on a feel-trip but ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ it did, from start to finish.  11/10, would lock my room and cry again
GREAT  It has meaning out of your computer. It will touch you in some way.
This game is AMAZING. I love the story and I fell in love with the characters! It is a wonderful experince!

I never thought I'd cry while playing this game... The story is just beautiful and is played out so well. It was just enough mystery, suspense, and humor to keep me playing it to the end. The character development was unique and wonderful. The soundtrack was so beautiful I couldn't help but to go back to the store page and buy it just to support everyone involved. (Not to mention half of the proceeds go to charities.) This little gem of a game really made me think about my life and just might have been what I needed to start moving forward. To The Moon has been a very inspirational and motivational game for me. I actually was able to relate to both River and Johnny, almost too well, like the developers were targetting me specifically.   I highly recommend giving To The Moon a shot, even if you aren't into games like this. It only takes a couple of hours to finish and about halfway through, if you've been following the story, you shouldn't be able to stop until it's over. There really isn't much dialogue to read as the story progresses fairly quickly.   The story is so deep and moving... It just might change your life!
One of my favourite ever story games of all time alongside Thomas Was Alone. This is worth ever penny.
Absolutely beautiful game, very touching story, great mix with funny animations/dialogs and gorgeous soundtracks.  10/10 you will cry.

everyone will tell you that this game will make you cry. and they are absolutely right. but what they neglect to tell you is that the game has a lot of laughs in store for you as well. in particular, one character named dr. watt has a lot of funny moments.

Really well written story and most of the time great graphics. Especially for us who likes the SNES era. Controls can be a bit cluncy, and a few cutscene graphics looked odd, but overall a great adventure I can highly recommend!
This is one of my favorite indie games ever! Once you peice everything together you'll ball your eyes out, i know i did lol  20 out of 10

This is an interesting interactive narrative-- it makes perfect usage of the narrative abilities of the SNES era. Alas, if only it made good usage of the gameplay mechanics of the era. As it is, the game is heavily reminescent of Final Fantasy VI-- quirky humour amongst dark and emotional themes. It's about a four hour experience all and all, and the interactive portions are a few simple tile puzzles, and a few this or that decisions in the beginning of the game that amount to no differences later, as far as I could tell. The narrative itself is disturbing, in my opinion-- not sad, or happy-- jut simply disturbing that a simple memory fail could destroy a relationship. Now about that price-point-- worth 10 dollars? If you believe watching a movie in a movie theatre is worth a similiar amount, yes. I would nay have bought this myself, personally, expect it was 70 percent off. But I recommend it over its kin Gone Home, as the narrative is much more meaningful than a herp-derp coming-out story.

Astonishing is about the only word I can use to describe this game - nostalgic graphics, a beautiful soundtrack (well worth purchasing the game/ soundtrack bundle) and a strong bittersweet storyline.  Just be prepared for your eyes to leak at the end!!
Amazing and heartfelt story! Expect a three-hour interactive movie however, I really think it is worth it!

To the Moon relies on its great story, which is accompanied with beautiful music. And thats not a bad thing! The gameplay isn't very challenging because the game itself is a point & click adventure, but for me that wasn't really bothersome. The story is balancing between sensitive and humoristic. I think they made a good job.

One great rollercoaster of emotions! It had me being suspicious and even slightly scared at some point, then happy as hell and even a lot of manly tears were shattered throughout this lovely designed game. The characters were very well designed and especially both of the scientists surprised me again and again. I also loved all of the easter eggs and references!  The best part of the game has to be the magnificent soundtrack which will never seize to amaze you due to its simpliness and absolute beauty.  All in all, it's a great 4 hour-journey I'd recommend everyone to have at least once! Very well done, Freebird!

This game astounded me. I read the reviews before I played it, and I thought 'There's no way it can be that good.' I'm happy to say I was wrong. As most reviews will tell you, the story is what makes this game, and the story is what will make you remeber this game when your done. The story is gripping, emotional, at times hilarious, thought provoking, and very relatable. It's also very well paced. The soundtrack complements it amazingly, with music equatable to Bastion. I'm extremely happy my friend gifted me the soundtrack with the game, cause its worth the listen. If the game has a weakness (and I don't know if I can fully call it a weakness) its that it has very simple gameplay. The gameplay is very much a tool to deliver the story in this game. The graphics may seem like a weakness to some as well, but I'm actually really impressed with what they managed to achieve in a 16 bit graphical style. All in all, this game was amazing, and definitely worth the playthrough. If you ever need proof that a game is a work of art, play this game.   Overall I'd give this game a 9.5 out of 10, or an A.
Absolutely brilliant game, fantastic and touching story which whilst it isn't the kind of thing I'd usually play, I'd recommend it to anyone.
It is a very sweet story. Kinda sad at moments but all in all sweet. :>

It takes a lot to move me to tears.  This is one of those few games where previews and reviews don't do it justice.  Buy it and give yourself the rest of the afternoon to play it, you won't regret the purchase.
Don't buy this game if you can't handle dem feels because you will without a doubt get them, 10/10.
Propably best four hours of my life. I would never expect it to be a masterpiece before playing it. Really worth giving it a try just bring a lot of tissues before begining.
A beautifully put together story that leaves you emotionally full. 10/10
It's been a while since a game managed to make me this emotionnal...a very touching interactive story, admirabbly told, and with perfectly matched music.

I loved this game. I actually got more than I expected from it. I'm a huge fan of story driven games, especially in the RPG maker style. This game had two great main characters that bounced well written dialogue off of each other. The old man Johnny made you want to do everything you could to find the truth and you were definitely not expecting it in the end. The concept of doctors who can make your final wish come true through memory rendering technology is really neat.   I also really commend the creators for the soundtrack. It definitely added tremendously to the already beautiful atmosphere. I highly recommend this game to anyone who wants to read, laugh, and then cry, and then feel good all over again.

Most awesomest game i've ever played. Good that so good. Like heaven. No no not heavenly beautiful,like what can i say, just imagine, angels and demons pulling kurdish halay for 14 years and naphalems play bonjos in the air with sticks in their arsess.

A very story-rich game created by RPG Maker. I got this on one of the humble bundles, along with many other RPG-Maker games, and I have to say, this is one of the few ones that is good. And not just good, it's great. It's nostalgic, its got an excellent soundtrack, it's story rich, has loveable characters, the list goes on and on. This is imo the BEST RPG-Maker Game to date.

Not even gonna lie I cried through almost the entire thing. This is such a heartfelt game, the story was absolutely breathtaking. One of the greatest games I've ever picked up, I played start to finish without even stopping.
This is game plays out more like a visual novel than anything. With that being said it tells a great story. A truly moving expirience
Good story. Great Soundtrack. The pop culture references are a little too much, but overall well worth the 2.49 I paid and a fun game to play for a few hours.
i don't do reviews a lot, but this game is worth the few bucks you pay, not very challenging, more like watching a very emotional movie, i get to finished it in a day, but it was well worth it

Brilliant. Started with me laughing near hysterically in the begining, when I got attacked by a squirrel, screamed at it and was about to throw my 'other shoe' at it before the kids told me to stop or they'll tell their mum I animal abuse. x'D And then after that I went through about 2 hours of trying to hold in tears of which I failed multiple times. BUY THIS!

I cannot talk too much about why this game is so amazing without spoiling it. However, if you are looking for compelling gameplay, that is the one area where this game is lacking. The emotions and narrative content, however, shine like a lighthouse beacon in a dark, foggy sea of bland, cookie cutter games.  ...I think I may have already said too much. Just play it.

This game, or rather, story, gave me a satisfying, unforgetable experience. This is so much like when I playing visual novels like Clannad. They story are linear, without any other paths, but this is perfect the way it is. I like how things are foreshadowed and the explaination for everything slowly revealed bit by bit. There is no real gameplay other than the simple puzzle. I can't share much about the story since spoiling it remove the fun from it.   Really, must play for the story. Just get some tissue ready nearby. But I promised you, you won't be disappointed. The soundtrack is also great with memorable characters. Even the squirrels and certain inflatable ball.   P.S: 10/10 Will whack-a-mole again in the festival. :)

That. Game. Damnit, it is good. It is incredible good. This game, it will make you feel. HARD. You will probably cry and you will cry for the right reasons, because the story of this game is really, really deep it tells that story in a wonderful way. The soundtrack and the events of that game will send shivers down your spine. I do not want to spoil the ending, but it my goosebumps had goosebumps on their goosebumps during the final scenes.
A master peice in the indie game department, if anybody likes playing games with a gripping story then this is the game for you.

overall an amazing game! it can be kind of awkward to navigate if your not familiar with how movement handles in it, but thats a small thing to look past. the story is amazing, one of the best i've seen. this is a must play for anyone looking for a great time and great storytelling
Fantastic game. Great emotional story with one of the best soundtracks iv ever heard in a game. Easiest recommendation ill ever give.

A very compelling and heartfelt story game. It'll pull on all your heartstrings and bring a tear to your eye. I laughed, I cried, and I could'nt stop playing. The game itself took me 3 hours to complete but I loved every second of it. It is definitely worth picking up and playing through it. Overall I loved the story and have no complaints about it whatsoever!  10/10 would cry again!

Most likely my favourite game to be created with RPG Maker, To The Moon is a short and sweet story-rich game with a really well done soundtrack. If you are looking for an in depth RPG than don't buy this game, it will take you no longer than 3 hours at the maximum to complete. If you're not interested in the story it tells it's not even worth it. The gameplay is not too great, but the experience as a whole is good.
Amazing Music, Great Story with simple gameplay, and the price is what puts the icing on the cake. No one should pass this up if you like story-driven games. 110% Recommened.

A very beautiful game. Worth it in the sale, worth it at full price and more. Lovely music throughout with emotions that really touch you. I wish I would have played it sooner after I was recommended it. My only comment was that the controls were a little messy but it doesn't impact the gameplay that much. If you've been told about this, then buy it and experience it yourself, that's all there is to it.
I got dehydrated going through this game, 10/10 would cry again
Only played less than an hour already crying
Definitely play alone because you're going to shed those tears.  One of the best stories I've ever experienced.
This game is incredible and moving.
This game made a grown-♥♥♥ man bawl all over his keyboard. Recommended.
Great game. Short and sweet!

This is probably the best game I've ever played. The story is absolutely amazing, better than any game and most movies I've seen. I would absolutely recommend playing this game, I liked it so much that I'm buying it for several friends. Really just amazing
Good stuff. I found it inspiring. The click controls were a little shaky but the keys can be used in a pinch. Good writing and music composition.
try this game out it really is amazing

Wow. That's all I have to say. Wow. One of the most moving, emotionally involving games I have ever played. I don't make a habit of ever having tears (I am a guy, after all), but there were several times when I could feel tears welling up. Simply splendid! Very gripping, moving story. 10/10!
Though the completion time is roughly 2 and a half hours, the additional time spent crying pads the length to about 8.  Extreme value, 10/10
A unique, deep, masterful piece of storytelling. You will laugh. You will cry. You will cry some more. And you will fall in love.

I had thought about buying this game for a while after seeing lots of really good reviews for it, so when it went on sale recently I jumped on the chance to try it out for myself. I was initially a bit put off by the controls (don't use the mouse to move around like I did, use the arrow keys >_<), but found myself quickly pulled into the story. The gameplay isn't much, mostly just exploration based and some card flipping puzzles, but then the gameplay isn't the strong point of the game, it really is the story. It's a short game so if you don't think that a story based game with little gameplay is for you, then it probably isn't. If you're ok with paying to experience the story then I'd say go for it, you won't regret it.

Didn't cry; maybe because I emotionally prepared myself for it and I separated different sessions to play as I didn't want to finish it in one sitting. :(  The story is VERY good and needs to be made into a movie. Recommended to everyone.
If you have an afternoon to spare, play this. The story is touching and heartfelt, the gameplay is enjoyable and relaxing. 10/10, one of the best games ive played in a while.
Gorgeous game. Can't stop crying... 10/10
One of the best games I've ever played. If you enjoy story-driven games like The Walking Dead, you will love this game. The story is AMAZING. If you think you might like it, buy it. You will love it.

To the Moon is incredible, with great pixel graphics and an amazing soundtrack. The story itself is so unique and incredible that you'll play it in one four hour long sitting; and then you'll probably get emotional like I did before going to listen to the soundtrack again.  This is one of those games that you absolutely need to play, and if you haven't already then you definitely need to go and give it a try!
A very rich story and it hurts all the feels. No spoilers, but there was one point that I almost lost it.

A short review for a pretty short game:  It's funny, interesting & the story is pretty strong. Point and click without the tedium of clicking on every inch of the screen until something activates. Not a tough game, there is no action as such and the gameplay is basically a more interactive version of reading a short story.   personal opinion, a very nice little game & i will be picking up the next one. I can't give a traditional rating because i can't compare it to any other game i've played. Do not get the game if you are looking for platforming, shooting or super advanced graphics.  Do get it for a low cost interesting story & a change of pace from other games.
Amazing. Everything about this game is amazing.
magical, romantic and one of a kind. a 'snes feeling' with modern story telling and score. 10/10.

I can honestly say I've never played a classic style RPG that sucked me into the story quite like this. I believe I actually played through the entire story in my first sitting! I've replayed this twice now, and it remains the most emotionally evocative game I have ever played. Highly recommend it for anyone who wants to play a good story.
This game was soo beautiful. The storyline was pretty good, easy to follow as well as humourous at times. Despite the humour I still cried a lot ! Definitely recommend worth the money ! 10/10
Really good short game

This game plays very similar to a Visual Novel. This is a touching story about a man's life and a dream that he has had. There's a lot of different ways you can interpret the story. Overall, I felt like I grew as a person from playing this.   Warning: This is a bit of a tear jerker.

I think it was worth the price, and while not very complicated as a game in itself, it still used player agency effectively enough to enrich the story. Very story-heavy in general, and the puzzles are pretty minimalist; it's entirely unchallenging, so if you're not one for story-based games, don't bother.
One of the best games i've played.  10/10 Feels ;_;
To the feels
Easily one of the best stories told through a game. Absolutely loved it.

I never review games but 'to the moon' touched me so much I felt compelled to give my thoughts. The story is so well written and thought out, along with the accompanying musical score they blend together to create a genuine masterpiece. I can not recommended it enough. Cried like a little girl twice, and the ending was perfect. I'd also be first in the queue if someone turns this into a film. Compliments to the creators, some AAA developers should be embarrassed at the trash they churn out year upon year, such games pale in comparison to this game. Don't think just buy.

Awesome storytelling. It was great to see how the plot unravelled itself and the end was satisfying. The little jokes here and there kept the story fresh and lightened the overall mood from time to time. And the soundtrack fits in the story perfectly. If you like story-based games, this one is definitely worth playing.
This is a game with a great story full of emotions. If you don't mind the graphics, play it yourself and you will not regret it.
this games soundtrack will stick with you forever and so will the story. i can see why my friends recommended this game to me
Made me a tad bit misty eyed.

A wonderfully bittersweet story about a dying man's last wish and the contractors hired to help grant it. If you are looking for a traditional point-and-click adventure game, this is not the one for you. The gameplay is incredibly simple: You explore different parts of Johnny's memories looking for links to other memories. This basically involved clicking around and reading dialogue, with the occasional minigame thrown in. The story, though, had me in tears by the end. Literally, I was bawling over my keyboard. At the same time, the humor in the game is great as well. A few of the jokes made me laugh out loud.  The game was only a 2 or 3 hours long and doesn't have much replay value, but I am so glad I bought it. If you are looking for a well-crafted story, then I highly recommend To The Moon.

Beautiful, beautiful game. It's not so much about the gameplay, but more about the story around it - You play as Eva Rosaline and Neil Watts, two doctors with very unique jobs - they give dying people the chance to relive their lives, fulfill their wishes, and ease their regrets... And sometimes, these journies can lead to the most emotional discoveries, and pasts... This game - no, this STORY, is a prime example.  Again, this game doesn't focus on the gameplay - it focuses on the narrative as you peek through Johnny and River's life together, and use their memory-altering abilities to fulfill his deepest desire - to go To The Moon.  If you are into deep, emotionally-driven narratives, or even into the music, or hell, just a few laughs, please do yourself a favor - get this game. If not for the story, then for the soundtrack, because I PROMISE, you will Laugh, you will Cry, you will stay on the story until the final act, the inevitable death of the patient.
i cried, on the moon

I loved the story of 'To the Moon' it had me hooked the entire time. However, To the Moon isn't really a game, it's more of an interactive story. I did expect more point and click elements are more challenging puzzles so if you are looking for anything like that you will not get it here. The story more than makes up for any flaws this game has though and I highly recommend it.
This game makes me crying,literally,crying....so bad

To The Moon is a story game. You play two agents helping a client achieve a dream by moving backward through his memory to plant the seed of the dream in him during his childhood.   The story was very nicely written, and I really enjoyed the story mechanic of going backward through memories. It made everything more special as you learn context for each part of the man's life.   I would without a doubt recommend this game to everyone. 10/10
My God this game is so good!!! 11/10

Block off a few hours and play this all in one sitting. I'm not sure how much of a *game* it is. But it's gripping, heartrending, and powerful, a meaningful interactive exploration of what it means to live a fulfilled life. Probably the closest to literature I have seen video games approach.
If you enjoy great music, thoughtful dialogue and a great story then you should buy this game. It's only a few hours long but the ride will be worth your while.
If you like Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind, you would love this.  RT if you cried 10/10
Great game,full of emotion. Not very long but still very rewarding. A must try.

I just finished 'To The Moon' and I have to say, it is the most emotional game I have ever played. The story was amazing, the art was gorgeous and the game itself was fun. I've never played a game before that is this heartwarming and I highly recommend you play it. The only let down was some awkward controls, but other than that the game was perfect. 9.5/10
This game is phenomenal. It may be short, but it is tremendously moving and wonderful. There is no reason not to play To the Moon, and the story is superlative. Go play it.

This game isn't actually 100% a game. It's an interactive story. An emotionally lovable interactive story. Yes, the controls aren't the best, but the story is the main feature in this interactive story. This interactive story is also funny sometimes (thanks to Neil), and it has changes at somepoint. Like puzzles and killing zombies. And the ending is some of the best I've seen. This ending actually made me cry, and that rarely happens to me when I'm watching a movie or playing a video game, Still, for the story itself, I would give it a 9/10.

To the Moon is an emotional experience and a must-have for everyone that want to play a game with a brilliant and well-narrated plot. The negligible cost is another factor that should bring everyone to give a chance to this fantastic game. Must-buy. (The ost is GREAT).
This game is amazing as you go through the story with Dr. Rosalene and Dr. Watts, the soundtrack, the humor for me the game was a 10/10
This game has almost no gameplay at all, but the emotional story and the beautiful soundtrack make more than up for this. Probably the most touching and thought-provoking game I have ever played.

To the moon is a pixel puzzle game about two scientists who are trying to save a mans wife from death but their man objective was to go back so they could take the man to the moon.  The two scientists then go back into the mans past and collect things that were special to him so they could go back even further to when he was a child so he is strong enough to go on a rocket ship  Game Goods: Amazing Storyline Smooth And Lovely 8bit Gameplay Some Good Comedy Quite Hard  Overall, I Suggest That You Need To Buy To The Moon
This is a visual novel in the style of a 'golden era' SNES JRPG. It is fanstic. That's all I have to say about it.

Only about 4+ hours of gameplay, but a very solid game. There is very little gameplay that is not challenging and the story is linear, but a fantastic story with a good soundtrack. This game is more about story than anything else, and the writers sure knew how to knock this one out of the ballpark. I would reccomend To The Moon to anyone and everyone.   Apparenlty they are coming out with future 'episodes' and I will be sure to play them. Will you?
it's a very beautiful story
This RPG is heavy on story.. not for those who want battles and mayhem.
Just... tears. Beautiful, beautiful tears.

To the Moon may not have the most compelling gameplay, and you could even say there is none. However, To the Moon does have a strong story to tell, as it entirely depends on its story to entertain its gamers. As much as that sounds off for a game, I can ensure you won't be disappointed.

This is more of a vehicle for a story than a game. But oh, what a story! It will break your heart over and over again, with just enough humor to keep you going. I recommend this short yet wonderfully bittersweet game to everyone, and eagerly await more from this developer.
Fantastic game and great music! Highly recommend.

This game touched me very personally , and it's one of the most emotional stories in a game..only a game can do this and this clearly shows that graphics, budget , promotions etc are not at all important fr a game..The only thing that's imp for the game is the gamer who plays it and how it makes him/her to feel !! Hands down to the story and setting... I think abt my childhood , my past ... cherish the happy moments i had... see the sky and moon.. wonder abt my life ...'To the Moon' will be in my mind for a long timeee...  I recommend every1 to play this and enjoy the journey of life

I realy recommend this game to others, it has a incredable story line and its a easy game to play. it also has a nice soundtrack that I enjoy listening everytime. The beginning of the game might be a little bit boring but that chance once you ge into it. and for rpg maker maker fans you seriously need to play this game

Those who enjoy story based games such as “Gone Home” will appreciate To the Moon. (And vice versa) There is no fighting system, No XP and there is no need.  A great game doesn’t need HD graphics, just a great story.
great story, awesome music, and simple gameplay. You don't need to grinding for level.

This game was an interesting game about two doctors who had the difficult task of fufilling a dying old man's greatest wish. The game flows like a story as you traverse therough the man's life from old man to child and learn his journey. This game was not particular challenging, but it offered many suprising twists and was very thought provoking. I appreciated the humor, romance, and dramatic themes that this game offered. Definitely a game that will leave you thinking about it afterwards for some time. Very creative game and the music is delightful.

Great 'game'.  I wouldn't necessarily call this a 'game' more like an interactive movie. The actual gameplay is rather little and what there actually is, is tedious but the point of this 'game' is to tell a story. A rather brilliant story at that!   Shouldn't take you more than 3 hours to play it so get off work for a night, or whatever but play this 'game'!
Great Story, I recommend this to anyone who enjoys quick puzzles and a touching storyline

Loved this game from the moment it went up on steam, it made me cry so much. Its just one of them stories. Once you start, you NEED to see what happens next, then something else happens, and you need to see it thur.   The soundtrack is amazing as well, im in love with the piano theme.   Just beauitful.  10/10
It's hard not to get sucked up in this story! Really a must play with a great piano soundtrack...

This is perhaps less a game than it is an experience. It also has one of the most touching stories and emotional soundtrack of any game I have ever played (and that's quite a few). It is well worth a playthrough.

To the Moon... and straight into the feels. I'm not the biggest fan of games that are simple but, this one had one hell of a music score and a story that began grew with me as I played and at the end, it got me.  It is very rare for me to have tears in my eyes from a story yet, even after a second playthrough, I felt tears well up as I watched the story unfold and the characters interact.   10/10 WILL RECCOMMEND TO EVERYONE

To The Moon picked my interest when someone wrote about it in a Facebook group I'm a member of. Few weeks later I remembered for some reason, so I watched the trailer and bought it.  Saying that I was not disapointed is to say the least; It is the first video game to make me tear in front of my PC monitor.  It does not need fancy high-end 3D graphics, nor voiceovers or sophisticated gameplay mechanics.  It's simple. and it's perfect. 100/10

Don't let the cutesy 16-bit graphics fool you; this is a serious and mature treatment of the tragedy of human relationships. It's merits as a game are minimal, but it's one of the best interactive stories I've played.
short game. amazing storyline. pls play it.
The best game nobody has played...
Very nice emotional game.
Touching story and wonderful soundtrack. Well worth the trip through Johnny's memories.
An excellent, emotional story, but more of a visual novel than a game. About four hours of linear play.

A decent adventure game with a good story, interestingly written with a game engine which is often used for amateur fan projects; the RPG Maker. However, funnily enough, it doesn't actually have any RPG elements despite the engine typically being used for turn-based RPGs. Think of it like an interactive novel, I guess. With its unique gameplay mechanics and low price, I recommend this game.
This is an amazing game, and it shows how storytellers are moving from traditional books to new media. The story is unconventional and awe-inspiring..
A beautiful story that pulled at my heart through the whole game.

This is the quintessential game that PROVES video games can be art. It is the most beautiful, touching game I have ever played, and if you like story-driven games you literally cannot go wrong with this masterpiece.
Really good game,would cry again.  10/10

This game has a really good story. At times, it feels like you're watching a movie or reading a book. The resolution and unfolding of the plot is pretty unexpected, giving it an aura of constant mystery. The ending is both quite touching and uplifting.

Great game, got it as a gift from a redditor. I loved it. The characters were funny..the story was sad and by the end I wanted to cry.   I would definitely replay it again just for the sake of it, the story does come together well towards the end. Wish there was more like this.

An emotional top-down story-based game. Unlike many 'art' game, this one is very interesting, by having a storyline that constantly exists rather than having bits of doing nothing. There are many interesting plot twists, and it is very emotional, and some themes that will resonate particularly with some people, one with me particularly, however no spoilers. Seriously, you need to play this.

This, this is more than a game. This is a way of the developers to send the message to the players to understand that life, as incomplete as it is, can never be completed the way you want it to be but you should always be happy of what you have achieve, and what you have overcome in life.  This is a game rich in story and MY GOD THE SOUNDTRACK IS AMAZING. Its a 2d story telling game so I can't really comment about the graphics, and also because its not important here. This game is all about the story and its all it needs to make you reflect YOUR LIFE.  I don't think I can comment much without giving out any spoilers, so all I can say is this. This is not an adventure action game that makes you feel awesome as a gamer. This is a game, no, a story that makes you question of your actions in life, your goals in life. One of the best story I have ever EVAR read in my gaming experience.  12/10, it makes me tear up so bad, its great.
Such a nice and cute little story. A definetely must have and play.  (Tough guy alert: A tear might try to escape while you play this game)
I'm not crying...there is something in both of my eyes.
Touching story and excellent music
I love everything about this game! :D

Perhaps one of the single greatest games I've had the privelege of playing. A highly emotional story that can't help but keep the player interested throughout, To The Moon is an astounding experience and tale shown in the form of a video game. Gameplay is relaxed and entirely based on the story with small portions of comic relief tied in. An absolute must play for anyone wishing to hear out Johnny Wyles' touching life story.

This game is simply beautiful, exploding with emotion. I didn't play it all in one sitting but I couldn't keep my mind off of it when I wasn't playing. It's gripping and so very well made. The story is just riveting, one I can't ever forget.

Two doctors set out to alter a very ill man's memories so he can die happy . . . one of the best storys I've ever experienced in a game. Not much gameplay at all, but if you can look past that for a good story, this will blow you away.
This is one of the best games I've ever played. Loved every minute of it.

To the Moon is a self-proclaimed RPG that focuses on interactive storytelling. This game takes a few hours to complete, yet weaves an intriguing and touching tale of marriage and memory. Coupled with an enjoyable and evocative soundtrack, I'd recommend To the Moon to any gamer who appreciates adventure or indie titles. And if $10 seems like too much for an indie game, it's often on sale during Steam's Summer/Holiday events.

That's a game I delayed playing for too long, and I regret it immensely. It is, no doubt, a story written to bring one to tears and I must say it fulfilled its purpose with elegance and precision. I cried when I was supposed to and I enjoyed every aspect of the third act plot.  The argument mixes good sci-fi ideas, almost in a Charlie Kaufman meets Inception fashion. It is a poignant and beautiful story and it approaches personal tragedy, loss and regret in ways I rarely see games doing. The point is that, even if other games also bring up these themes, not many give the player enough space to let the feelings really sink in their mind, because the majority of games just have the necessity of throwing the character, as soon as possible, into the next combat or feature, exploring the most intricate mechanics. 'To the Moon' has no such thing as elaborate mechanics. Whether this is a positive thing or not depends on the kind of player you are. To me, the lack of complexity in this aspect not only is compesated by the good, touching plot, but it enhances the quality of the storytelling by dictating a more peaceful and reflective pace. The graphics are just pleasant in their simplicity and beautifuly drawn. The colors and the details of the scenarios are great and just help to build up the development of plot and character interaction in ways you don't imagine at first.  The soundtrack is simple but extremely well executed. It pulls at the heartstrings whenever it is needed. It sounds like a cheap trick to make one cry, but if so, as I said before, it achieves its goal with such perfection that I find myself unable to complain. The character construction, although it has received some criticism from the players for lack of depth, it's as good as it should be, in my opinion. All the main characters are relatable and captivating, although flawed. There are good dialogues, full of nerdy references and some punctual jokes that fit perfectly as a counterbalance to the melancholic tone that pervades the game.  This has been a hell of an experience to me. Graphics, soundtrack, plot and characters, all simple but so well delivered.
