I finished the game in one night through tears and laughs and, in the end, its beauty and sadness stick with me. It is a real testament to the power of story in the game universe.

In general I hate point and click games. I am glad I played this.  It is sentimental. The music is pretty. The pixel art is nice. There is just something about this that is touching. I couldn't help being affected by the story. I just finished the game and I feel like you do after seeing a good emotional type movie that stays with you for awhile.  It only takes about 3 or 4 hours to play through. I recommend playing it through with the sound up in one or two sittings when you don't have much else to do. I am a puzzle dolt sometimes, completely missing the obvious. If you get stuck like I did, don't get ticked off, just look up the solution and move on.  If you hate point and click but are bored with your regular game schedule then this might be the little break you need. If you like point and click then why don't you already have this?  This game is worth the time.

So I just finished this game. Bascially it's a visual novel with a good chunk of the interaction being a tile flipping puzzle game. You can expect a change in the game element for a segment in the latter part. The story was decent though I found myself with some questions as it unfolded -questions that I found unanswered, unless I missed something. It's probably me looking too closely, however. I don't know.   Anyway, I enjoyed the story well enough and the puzzles weren't tremendously challenging. It's pretty much more about the story, I think, and if you're into stories with a bit of 'sappy bleeding heart' stuff, this just might be for you. The ending is a bittersweet, depending on how you look at it.    If you're unsure about the game, you can always get it when it goes on sale, where won't break the bank, though at about 10 dollars I guess it's more like a rude shove more than actually breaking anything.
This game is so hard. It made me sweat from my eyes.

[6/10] Overall this was an enjoyable game. It is best when you just want to sit back and lazily work your way through a story. It is one of the few games that really elicited emotions while playing. Although at times I spammed clicked trying to get through parts faster. There are some moments of jokes so bad, they are good. The art direction was ok at first, but quickly seemed to lose its appeal. Warning: there are some very sad moments.

Oh man, 2-3 years since I saw pewdiepie play this game. After watching, I KNEW this would be the first game i'd get if I ever got a computer. I just recently got one for college and sure enough 2 years later I kept to my word, it's just that worth it. But the most incredible thing to me, is even though I know this game so well, 2-3 years later I still cried when I finished just now. As the other reviews say, 'To the Moon' is nothing short of beautiful (in every aspect). Please pick it up and A birds story as well, that just came out today and I can't wait to play it! but show the developers the amount of love that they truely put into this game.
An amazing game which made me cry so many times which made me love it that much more

It controls like utter garbage, its very simple, but the story is absolutely beautiful. It's the only game that I have ever had to take breaks from playing simply because I couldn't handle the feels. if you are on the fence about paying $10 for this, do it. you won't regret it
One of the best stories ever told through a video game.
Good story, pretty pixel graphics, I recommend it.
This is a wonderful experience. More of an interactive story than a game; however, the story is quite entralling and the ending brought me to tears.

What an amazingly beautifful story and game. The gaming world needs more productions like this. I was full immersed through the entire game and I didn't want it to end. Fantastic.   I look forward to playing future games from Freebird.  My only issues were one or two moments where the controls were kind of weird and I had to resort to a walkthrough to figure out what to do.
right in the feels

Very human story, a nice and immersive experience. No gameplay really, and it's only a couple hours long, but certainly worth picking up. There was no specific aspect that really carried the experience, just a sense that the creators knew what they wanted to do and did it really well.  The bit with the horses is a real pain; trigger the event with the kids before you explore that huge area on foot, and be sure to get really close to the memory when you're finished. If you can't find anymore links, just assume you got them all and didn't notice.  I'd love to see something balanced between this and Remember Me, with the same sensibilities but more open-endedness and the player has access to all the 'controls'.

For those looking for a great story in a game with an incredible soundtrack to go with, you have to play To the Moon. I guess the best word to describe it is: poignant. You definitely have to play this one.

Thank you Freebird Games. Don't bother with the manual save.

no matter what I type I can't seem to get the right words out so i have given up on trying to describe the wonderful beauty of this game altogether (tis a lie)... honestly whatever i could manage to write simply wouldn't do this game any justice but I'll try my best, To the Moon is overall fantastic it has characters that grow on you immediately with their great sense of humor, it has music that fits the situation it's given like a glove, but the part that stuck out the most to me would be when the game checks to make sure where heart strings are and begins to playfully tug at them a little bit just for fun, then it rips them out stomps on them sets them ablaze and makes you clean them up... the long and the short of it all would be i definately recommend this game to anyone who like me has a face. 10/10 would play and fail to write a competent review again!!!

A short, yet wonderful rollercoaster of emotions, To the Moon is a simple indie game that you can, and probably will, play in one sitting over a few hours. Yes, it may be predictable at times, not always hit home with the comic relief, and be a little quirky with movement at times, but overall 'To the Moon' is well worth the time invested.

One of the most amazing and outstanding games I have ever played. It is not so much of the gaming and interaction aspect, but the story and comprehension that makes it so.  The story is about two doctors who traverse back in time through a man, Johnny's, memory to fulfill his wish to go to the moon. They learn of his unstable past of his first love, the horific accident of his childhood, and a meaningless life filled with regret and guilt.   The story brought me to tears. Literally. It was so moving and so complex. The doctors take big risks to make fulfill the dying man's wish. It is so reminiscient of the past, and it makes me wonder what my own life will bring.  The music also amazed me. It's all instrumental, except for one bit at the end, which has lyrics. The music made everything better. And I don't think that just because I'm a classical musician.  Despite minimal physical gameplay, and more dialogue, the story was very moving and a very fun game to play. I normally hate dialogue and reading and clicking, but this time it really didn't matter. The gameplay was also very clever, how you have to find meaningful memories and travel between time peroids in Johnny's life through mementos. Very clever and very simple.   There are a few cons, however. The movement and controls were a little goofy, but it didn't matter. The dialogue between Rosalene and Watts (the two memory doctors) was also very childish. It catered too much to an immature, younger crowd, rather than an adult/teenage crowd. The references made me feel like Niel Watts is a comic relief to the story. While every story needs a comic relief (Shakespeare devloped that very well), I feel like Watts was a little off the deep end. It was childish humour and references and all around useless and meaningless and long dialogue. For once, swearing bothered me. There wasn't too much, but just enough to know that the story doesn't need it.  But all cons aside, it's definitely an amazing game with a touching story that will make you so upset you don't want to play anymore, but it all resolves in a bittersweet ending.   10/10. I am looking forward to recording this for YouTube
This is one of the more well written video games I have ever played. There is an unexpected depth to the story, making it one of the most emotional games I know of. Truly captivating.

That's an accomplishment on the developer's part.

**Get This Game**  To the Moon is a point and click adventure game. You play as Dr. Watt and Dr. Rosalene two scientists from the Sigmund Corporation sent to help virtually fulfill John, a dying man's, last wish... to get To the Moon.  To accomplish this you use a machine (almost like the animus from Assassin's Creed) to go back through John's memories backwards starting from John's most recent memory all the way back to his early childhood memories.  In each memory you have to find an item that will connect you to one of John's earlier memories. This item has a barrier on it that has to be broken by finding items and talking to people that will give you different colored orbs that will unlock a puzzle which when solved will take you to the next stage. Through the exploration of each level you discover more and more of what John's motivation was for wanting to go To the Moon.   You can beat the game in one sitting if you want to. With a story line this good you might actually do it. The story will make you laugh, make you cry then laugh then cry some more when you see the ending of the game. The sound track is good and for the price it's totally worth it. Don't buy the game looking for a high graphic, high action game. This is a story telling game that takes you back through John's life and moves you emotionally. Get this game and see if you can get To the Moon!!!

This game reminded me why I love scifi novels. It's not because of the wonderful and sometimes inaccessible science, atlhough that's part of its charm. But at its heart, good sci-fi reveals to us truths about the human condition. God I'm so thankful I played this awesome game.   And really looking forward to playing more adventures of Eva and Neil.

I can't say much without spoiling the game, so I'll start by saying if you don't have it and you like the story side of games, buy this ASAP.  So this is an interesting RPG that is less about actually playing a game and more about interacting with a story. I think this game is the perfect example of a book in game form. While story telling is the primary goal, the player gets invested in the characters because as you play as them, their problems are yours as well.  Also, the story has an interesting twist (not a spoiler); the story is told backwards! From end to beginning! It's intersting and has a surprising emotional impact as you see the pay-offs in the story, and latter what caused them. At first you think, 'Okay, that happened,' and then later you learn the significance of the event. The foreshadow affect is amazing!  Again, this game is all about story. You want to shoot monster, buy something else. This game is for those who love the story put into gaming. I personally believe games like this can have more emotional impact than a book, since the player controls the character instead of just reading about them. I rate this 10/10, 5/5, 1/1, whatever scale you want to use. 100% all the way.  (Played this with my mom, and we both cried together at the end, if that says anything. Oh, and if you can, get the soundtrack too. It's just beautiful, but you might want to cry upon hearing it if you've played the game through.)

Ok, so I played 'A bird story' before 'To the moon' and it was a lot shorter and, while equally emotionally stirring and thoughtprovoking, a bit too surreal for my taste. As these two are the first interactive novels I've played, and from the same developer, I will compare them to some extent.  'To the moon' is an interactive novel. It's more interactive than 'A bird story' (also from Freebird Games), but it is mostly about telling you the story. Even so, the interaction feels more meaningful in 'To the moon'.  The setup is a company that works with fulfilling wishes for people who are at life's end. This is done by going through their memories and help them remember a life where their wish was fulfilled. If you've seen the movie 'Eternal sunshine of the spotless mind' this game has a similar feel to it.  While the story is told you're provoked to consider things like what memories really are and what they mean. To me the story was also very emotional and had me in tears at times. They manage to bring up the issues in a very serious manner interlaced with some light comedy and breaking the fourth wall, without retracting from the overall experience (apart from one scene that I will not spoil, but that did annoy me somewhat).  Is it worth €8? In my personal opinion this story really touched me, and even though I got it on sale, I would happily have shelled out the 8 had I known how good it was. But if you feel unsure, wait for it to go on sale.  For those who like numbers this was an 8/10 in my opinion.

I'm not really sure how to even start talking about this game. I guess the best way to begin is to say that this is one of those 'games', in that some would argue whether this is a game or an experience. It's a fair argument to make as the most game-like To the Moon ever gets is some simple puzzles throughout and an out of place chase sequence. Unimportant issues of what defines a game aside To the Moon contains one of the best stories I've experienced from a game in a long time, and one of a very select list of games that broke me down. As you may put together this is a game that you buy for the story more than anything. To the Moon is about a pair of scientists working for the Sigmund Corporation who use a special machine to change the memories of their clients (all of whom are dying people) so that they can die happy. To the Moon focuses on their client named Johnny and his wish to go to the moon, and to say anything else about the story would ruin it. All that needs to be said about the story is that it is beautifully told. Additionally To the Moon has one of the best soundtracks I've ever heard in a game, perfectly complementing any moment throughout. The only complaint to be had is the gameplay, as mentioned before the closest to a game that To the Moon gets are some short puzzles and a sequence that was really odd and honestly felt mood breaking. However, as long as you go in knowing that the point of this game is to convey a story and allow your self to become immersed in it, then the aformentioned problems are minor at best. To the Moon is a beautifully realized story, humourous, heartwarming, and tragic throughout. I do not regret a single cent of the money I spent on it. If you could play a game that has a very well composed story that you more experience than play; than To the Moon is a great game that you will enjoy.

Lots of fun and adorable, yet sad. 'To the Moon' is a great RPG that will captivate you and keep you playing for hours on end. The controls are fairly simple, yet it's still a bunch of fun and totally worth it.
i loved this game best and sad ending great storyline loved it

To the moon is a rpg puzzle game where two doctors Dr Neil and Dr Eva are employees of the Sigmund company, a company specialized in delving into your memories and implant your final wish, in this case Johnny who wants to go to the moon, but it's not as easy as he has parts of his memories blocked for some odd reason and they have to use drastic methods in order to bring them back.  The plot is very well paced, doesn't feel rushed at all and it takes its time to develop , specially considering you venture through all important parts of Johnny's life, his constant misunderstanding of his wife, his marriage, his debts even his youth ages all very well connected and with nice major revelations through the game.  The soundtrack is damn perfect, setting the mood for the funny , sad and even dark scenes of the game, you can't complete this game without at least crying once, if you do then maybe you're not human.  The game also comes with 2 free DLC, called minisodes set on a xmas party after your last job, they about 20 minutes each but packed with a lot of plot and seems to prepare us for a third minisode, or maybe a sequel, but doubt it will be called 'to the moon 2' unless next patient wants to go to the moon as well.

Honestly, I didn't feel the extremes of emotion people claimed I would feel. At many times, I was touched by the story, and the music, but overall it was a somewhat tame experience. That isn't to say that this game isn't beautifully made,   or that minisode 2 didn't ♥♥♥♥ me up,   so definitely give it a try, but don't expect to be taken on an acutely intense emotional journey.   8/10
I can't remember the last time I cried. It must have been at least five years ago. This has now changed. This game was just too much for me, and it feels so incredibly good. RECOMMENDED.

To The Moon was an AMAZING game. I LOVED everything about this game. I will say, if you like games that will take you on a roller coaster going from happy to sad back to happy again, this is great. This game touched me, and almost made me cry, which is hard for a game to do because things dont make me that sad in video games. This game can be finished very qiuckly because its not overly challenging, which I like but if you like challenges then sorry. Even if you dont like the look of the game or the difficulty level, I still think yiu should get the game for the story.   10/10 1,000,000/100
Cry me to the moon

An amazing storytelling experience sprinkled with classic RPG elements.  This is a RPG Maker title, a game creation toolkit of which I have some years of tinkering experience behind me, and far and away this group of talented individuals, Freebird Games, made the most compelling and interesting titles that I have seen come out of that community.  Their prior noteworthy title, Quintessence The Blighted Venom, is a free download from their website if you want more amazing RPG goodness from this same group of folks. It's a bit more traditional RPG than To The Moon, but nonetheless also very much recommended.  Though they really outdid themselves with To The Moon. More of a playable story than much in the way of an RPG, but I was instantly drawn into the world, its characters, and the great storytelling that goes on here. The music is excellent and very fitting and draws out the emotions of each scene.  Being familiar with the RPG Maker XP tools, I can vouch that both To The Moon and Quintessence have a very impressive amount of customized details, work, and game systems implemented. I could go into many specifics, but suffice to say, far above and beyond the standard tools provided in the kit, and a mastery of those that have been provided, are clearly shown in all Freebird Games' titles.  Very impressive work folks. A job well done. A very memorable title. If only more big game companies could remember how to make games like this...  ...needless to say, all Freebird Games titles come very highly recommended by me.

This is the first game in quite some time that has such simple mechanics and simple storytelling combiend and yet isable to provide an emotional feeling unlike many games. I was constantly invested in where the story would end up and I think the fact that it is very simple, plus the music help create a perfect open/closed story that you just don't see a lot of. In fact I'd say there are few games like this. If you have a few hours pick it up it doesn't take long to finish and you'll certainlly be happy with your time spent in a beautifuly crafted game.
Great story, and an overall amazing experience.
This game made me cry on an airplane in front of a bunch of strangers. One of my favorite games of all time. Buy it.

Man... emotional game dude. Powerful stuff mane. The story for this game is GOOD and sad as hell..... seriously, give this game a shot. Know that it's not for the graphics or gameplay that people like this, it's the story. Even people who don't like story games will appreciate this. Only issue I have is resolution and the controls are a bit off but story EASILY overpowers these weaknesses.
Was looking for a quick game to play one night and saw this one recommended, never has a game been so deep or pulled on so many heartstrings like this game, I loved every second of it

To the Moon is great if you want to spend 4 hours or so crying. And giggling, sometimes. But mostly crying.  It's a beautiful story. It's about all the tragedies and joys that make up our lives. It's about flawed people finding happiness. It's about death. So you'll cry. You'll cry a lot.  But it's also an interactive story, it's 3-4 hours long, and the controls are clumsy. You can either tediously click your way around the screen or use the keyboard (which is easier, except you need to mouse over things to see if they can be interacted with or not.)  It comes with 2 DLC minisodes, but that's approximately 30-40 minutes of extra content and both of them are teasers. Neither of them are very profound. They just hint at big questions that--I assume--are going to be revealed in the sequel.  I got it on sale for $2.49, which is *perfect* for this amount of content. $10 seems a little steep for 3 hours of game + 2 teasers, but you might find it worthwhile if you're looking for a good, tearful story about life.
It was amazing! I love this game. How it started, ended, and everything in between! The story was better than the objectives, but it was interactive enough. It was an emotional piece of art!

If you value story over gameplay, get this game. If you're a sucker for emotional stories, get this game. If you want a game with amazing music, get this game. If you love character detail, get this game. If you want to sit back after a long day and get involved in a story so unlike anything else, absolutely get this game.
Tears fully stacked 750/750
To The Moon is an emotional game that plays out a bit like a Doctor Who episode (there are even a couple of references to Doctor Who in the game). Definitely worth the price despite the short length.
To the moon is an amasing game filled with emotion. The music is beautiful and the story is great.

I bought this game today and rushed it to the end in 3.5 hours. Although I didn´t quite understand the ending, it´s defnietly one of the most memorable games I´ve ever played. 'SHE´S COMING! ALT-TAB, ALT-TAB'.   Sadly, the DLCs are not working for me.
I can't recommend this game enough, what an emotional rollercoaster!

One of the most beautifully written stories ever and the gameplay, graphics, and especially the music all fit perfectly together the whole way through. One of the best story-rich games I've ever played. I 100% recommend this.

I thought this game was great. It has a nice story that really drags you along and hits you right in the feels. You can also scan through your game files at the end and find a little bonus mission which was also kind of nice. Great game 8.5/10
lovely and touching story about the life of an old guy. dont forget to take tissues, u may need them! ;D

Absolutely amazing writing and music. The game managed to invoke quite a lot of laughs and almost equally many moments of sadness. There is a limited amount of gameplay, but it feels like just the right amount and it supplements the narrative very well. The game is very well worth the full price and on sale it is an absolute steal!

Do yourself an enormous favor and pick up the soundtrack with this game as well. The music is beautiful and it adds to the atmosphere of one of the most emotional and moving games I have ever played. This game is a labor of love and it shows. Go into it spoiler free and really experience the story as it unfolds. Immerse yourself and you will be rewarded. This is more of a visual novel but don't let that deter you. This game is beautiful in visuals, in sound, and in story. Well worth your time and emotional investment.

I guess this is what folks call a 'visual novel'? There's not much on actual game mechanics, and it looks like something out of one of the RPG makers series, but the story it tells was heart wrenching. It isn't that long, but it's an emotional ride while it's going.
to the feels :'(

To the moon isn't a big gameplay game, only really containing some tile flipping puzzles. But it is big on story, athmosphere and characters, and it does them well.  The game can be funny at times and sad at others, and you are compelled to advance by the mysterious plot.  I would give this game a paper bunny out of ten, I cried almost as much as I do at Thai insurance company ads.

So... yeah. To The Moon doesn't need my positive review, really. It's already got a ton of praise, all well-deserved. It's essentially an interactive novel, but a very good one. What puzzles there are, either encourage you to explore, or distract you from making certain connections too soon. Would easily make a great movie. Gorgeous soundtrack that is now part of my background music at work.   But here's the part I want to point out. There are at least 5 different spots in the story that are known to make various people cry, and each spot makes you cry for a different reason. You're the type to cry at weddings? There's a spot for that. You only cry at tragedies? Yup. Chances are good that if you have a soul, at least one of the 5 will get you.  The point is, this game doesn't rely on the same emotional trick over and over to get you. It's an emotional roller coaster, if the track was designed by the inmates of an insane asylum. It pokes and prods you until you're tender and weak, covers your head with a bag of delightful dialog, and then it beats you mercilessly with feelings. And that's before we even get into the two DLC's.  You know what? Just buy the thing and play it. On sale, it's like, less than a coffee. Start it up, screw around with it, and before you know it, you'll be marveling over that beautiful ending.
An emotional rollercoaster. 10/10 would cry again
This is one of the best stories I had in a long time!

Words cannot describe this experiance. Watching and playing a story that you will always remember. After this game you will think about life, cry a little bit, listen to all the songs over again and the continue to cry for multiple days. This is what a game should be, this is what a movie needs to be. If I had to describe the game i would simpily say that you wll watch a trainwreck in reverse.   Pros: Fantastic Music, Fantastic Story, Great Charaters that will pull you in from the beginning of the game  Cons: No Gameplay required, but it doesnt need it 11/10 would cry for multiple days straight again
I haven't played this kind of game in almost a decade. But this one is 10/10. Buy it, it's cheap.
Was it for the better Eva?

To be honest I was getting this game in a bundle and was just thinking of going for the easy perfect game but the more I got into it,the more the game just grabbed a place in my heart. This was a unforgetable emotional trip for me and I catched myself in this 4 hours several times grinning and laughing and other times just shivering from the intense feelings the game gave me. The moment the story ended I felt a small tear running down my cheek and I was sure to give this game a positive review so maybe other people give this game a chance to let them touch their hearts

A beautiful and emotional story played in the shape of a point n click with few and simple puzzles, lots of nerd reference (just enough fun to balance the storyline), some nice plot twists and a great soundtrack. It got sadness, anger and happiness out of me in quite a short amount of hours. Let's not talk about tears... just play it =)

To The Moon is an RPG maker that has a lot of qualities and several flaws. But overall is an enjoyable game to play.  Pros: - Likeable characters - Solid emotional storyline - Good humor at times - Some nice references - Great musical score - Trading cards/achievement  Cons: - Little to no replayability - GUIs could be improved - Some sections of the game could be improved to better point player to objective - Character's movement speed is inconsistent at times - Some bugs/glitches (my game frozen at one point)

Got this game settled in my library along with bunch of other games long long time ago, just has a chance and a desire to download and play it. finished the game within 4.5 hours, the rest of the time i spent was idle and listening to the beautiful music, which is not the only one good thing this game have, the game itself tell a beautiful story, touched my heart and yeah I admit it, I cried at the end of the game, and then I found myself crap my hands alone infront of my notebook to the devs, they sooo deserves it, they really done a beautiful work here, for anyone, still wonder if you should get this or not ?  I would say 11/10 just give it a try, and even with a full price, it still worth it !  Reasons ?  - 4.5 hours that I am not regrets  - Beautiful Soundtracts >> So i suggests you just get the game with the soundtract, cuz you will get it after you done anyway  - Beautiful and heart touching storyline  - Easy to play, you can control the character with the mouse or keyboard arrow - You can come back here and throw this reveiw on me if you played this game and dont feel anything I said  - As far as I played this game, there is not a thing I feel its a cons for this one
Right in the feels. A very good story albeit short.
Didn't really think of it much until i actually played it. One of the saddest games ever made in the history of humankind.

Oh man, I have a lot of feelings about this. So many are mixed.  I think the biggest problem for me was that lack of gameplay the other reviews talk about. I went into this game totally blind and found myself sighing and clicking. And I think because it wasn't immersive enough for me, the story fell flat a little. Yeah, okay, I see how it's sad, I felt a bit 'awww' by the time I figured it out, but by the big reveal I felt they made it a bit too ham-handed. Kept forgetting how to save/do anything so it got a bit awkward and I gave up at times. The one-puzzle-a-level was interesting, but no restart in case you just get so, so lost. No reward for making it in your 'minimum moves' but I wouldn't even know how, since there's nothing on the side to save towards.  Those 'pros' though. It's an incredibly beautiful game, and I appreciate it for that. I was warned it wasn't gameplay heavy IF I had read any reviews (it was given as a gift) so I can't fault them for that. And dear lord the music. It is gorgeous. Excited to see what this game will spawn.

This game made me laugh, and it made me cry. I still listen to the soundtrack because it is so incredibly beautiful. If you like story games and are OK with a game that's funny but also heartbreaking, i definitely recommend it. It holds a special place in my heart.
This game is lovely. If i could forget the story, I would play it all over again.

Rarely does a game tell a story and touch a person the way this simple one does. An easy game, unless you're going for a perfect score. Well worth the small fee. Better than a movie. This is a casual story-driven adventure everyone should play once.
When this world is no more... The moon is all we'll see..
An awesome way to tell a history and make you remember it long after ... after playing this to the end the music will get you crying in the first notes
Couldn't believe how well told this story is. I recommend this to anyone who enjoys emotional games and has a bit of nostaliga for 16bit era.

This is basically an interactive movie, and the 'gameplay' essentially consists of walking around and moving the characters through the story. There's no actual challenge anywhere, you can't 'lose', and you can't do anything to affect the overall outcome. Still, despite all of this, moving through the world of To the Moon, and watching this particularly story unfold....well, it's simply beautiful. You'll laugh, you'll cry, and you'll never quite look at a paper bunny rabbit the same way again.

I am not into retro pixel graphics, so when I saw this game last year, I didn't think I would enjoy it. I was wrong. Really wrong. Once I started playing it last week, I immediately got hooked on the story that the graphics no longer mattered. It has the saddest - as well as the sweetest - story I have ever known in a video game. The OST is worth getting too. 'Everything's Alright' by Laura Shigihara (the writer of 'Zombies on Your Lawn') will probably make you cry every time you listen to it, days after you finish the game. lol

Not sure if I'm supposed to feel happy or sad at the ending...  -Graphics- The pixel art is beautiful and gives this game a unique feeling. There're also some delaited drawn artworks that looks great. My only complaint is the game has a low resolution, which makes the game too small to play in windowed mode. I had to play it in fullscreen mode which I don't like because it upscales the relosution and made it looks blurry and it stretched the 4:3 ratio of the game to fit my 16:9 ratio display which makes the graphics in game look disorted.  -Music- The music in this game is amazing, they express the atmosphere very well. One of the reason that I decided to purchase this game is because I really like the piano music at the beginning of the game. I also like the sound effects in the game that plays when the character moves their arms or when they facepalm themselves.  -Gameplay- This game focuses on the story so the main gameplay is exploring places, reading dialogues, and solving light puzzles which I have no problem with if the story is good. If you're not sure what it's like just think like you're 'experiencing' a story in an interactive way.  -Story- The story is the main focus point of this game. It lasts about 3 - 4 hours depending on your playstyle. I think the story of this game is really good because it leaves the player to think after the ending and also because it's so unique and I really like these kinds of story.  If you like good stories then this game is definitely worth the price.
One of the most beautiful stories I've ever read.
I love the music and the story. <3

I am a man of stone. No form of media, whether it be movies or video games, has ever brough out enough emotions to make me cry. I simply don't do emotions, because I've just always been that way. It's tough to make me even close to sad. Throughout this game; however, there were many moments where I felt something... Like something was pushing on my heart and making the air feel a bit lighter. Was this... feeling...? Such emotion, such sadness, such feels!!! As the excellent soundtrack was playing in the background and the final pieces to the story were unfolding, I suddenly felt something on my hand. Could it be? No... It couldn't be... But it was. A tear had fallen onto my left hand. To the Moon is the first form of media ever to make me shed a single tear. For a guy who's girlfriend's goal in life is to see him cry at least once, that's saying something. The story in To the Moon is a 10/10. The music is 10/10. The feels... are 10/10. I fully recommend this game.
I love music background-game, and 2-D game like this. Well... This game is so amazing Highly Recommended :'D
Mean Mr. Mustard's short To the Moon review    1) Essential - buy it NOW   2) Recommended - buy it on sale
One of the best narratively driven games I have ever played. The characters, story and dialougues are just amazing. This game writes itself into your memory.

I had to finish this game without even closing it, because i coudn't. It's history is completely engaging that it doesn't let you go away.  There is no man when THOSE part comes; I've litteraly cried a River (heh got it?).   But even though it's sad and emotional (in the good way), there's also space for humor.  Conclusion: god i love this game, it's so beautiful s2 s2 s2 s2
A beautiful game with a very interesting story and an immensely relaxing soundtrack/in-game music (for the most part)  Also...the feel-trip was real!
I just finished it.   This is more of a story than a game, but what an amazing story ! It doesn't take too long to finish, I totally recommend it.   This story is worth it. Really, buy this game !
NIce
Wasn't sure what to expect when I started this game, but I was pleasently surprised. I highly recommend this for anyone that enjoys a narrative-focused game with some unexpected twists.
A good little game with an interesting scenario. I am not sure everyone will enjoy it, but to my opinion, it's worth playing it.
Amazing game... took me by surprise... I didn't expect to almost cry in this game!
The dialogues are hilarious. Love it!
simply beautiful :)  felt like watching a very touching animation with a mini game, the story is absolutely full of joy and pretty  worth to buy!!
It's been 2 years since I finished this game, and I still remember how it made me feel

Whilst the gameplay is simple (navigation, a few 'puzzles'), the story is fantastic. I have been moved by these 4 hours in many more ways than by any AAA trying too hard these days, pretending it's all about 'emotion'.
'Interactive fiction' is a far better way of describing To the Moon than 'game' is. Nonetheless, To the Moon was very well written and extremely enjoyable for what it was. I loved it.

This game is just.. wow, it blew me away. Makes me sad to think that I just found this game not too long ago.    The story   The story in this game has a way to captivate the players into every situation the game has to give. Every little scene that makes you giggle like a child on Christmas morning, makes you go 'Aww' like you've just seen a puppy, makes you want to rip out your hair in frustration and makes you sniffle and maybe even shed a few tears. The music that plays really matches with each scene, I even found myself humming to 'Everything's Alright' after I finished the game.   The art style   Oh, the art style! For an RPG game, I find it quite detailed. Each little thing can be the next key to get to the next objective! Its beautiful in my eyes.. just look at them.. LOOK AT THOSE PI-- *Cough Cough* Pardon me. It could describe the characters well enough, I especially love the wife's wedding gown.   The controls  They're simple enough to remember and do! Except for the occasional bug of having to press somewhere else to get to a certain area, press something else to take or look at an item, etc,-  v v v [ Here's a simplified version in case anyone doesn't wanna read all of that ] ^ ^ ^  Pros: -Awesome Feels-Inducing Story -Lovable set of characters -Freaking hilarious moments -Easy and simple controls -Rabbits and Platypuses.. Platypi..? -Music fits with each scene  Cons: -Minor Bugs [Click Areas] -Controller Not Fully Supported [Unable to finish puzzles with Controllers] - 'A Hop Under A Tire', If you get what I mean.

At first glance, I wasn't sure I was going to get into it as much. Oh was I wrong. This game is beautiful. The story is really interesting. The characters are great in so many ways. I played this straight on without any breaks. This game will definitely tug your heart strings.

I didn't personally enjoy this game or the puzzles or the even the story. It felt too much like it was 'Just something made in RPG maker' and while I can't fault anyone for liking the narrative, nothing about this game really clicked with me. If nothing else the setting and premise are definitely interesting, the kind of creativity I'd like to see in more games honestly.

This seemed like a short game so i decided to play it and finish within 2 hours to submit a refund. However the game is so marvelous that I'm feeling ashamed of my desire to get my 60 pence back. (And i didn't finish even half of it yet) So I decided to keep the game and let the emotional rollercoaster roll on. A must have, worth the money and thanks to the developers for producing such a great game for so less.
Amazing. 20/10. Story was fantastic.
Gripping heartfelt story. Lovable characters. Excellent dialogue with good references. Retro-style graphics. 10/10

This game has something special to it, it makes you not want to stop playing until you finish it, which doesn't take that long. It's a short yet extremely pleasant experience, the soundtrack is awesome and the story is very well thought and executed, making you curious about the characters and their past. Simple mechanisms that work very well for this game, overall, I give it a 9/10, losing 1 point for not being a liiiiittle bit longer(I still want to know about the painkillers)  -Now played the mini episodes-  So far, they're pretty interesting as well, a little bit confusing, but I'm sure some of it will be explained on mini episodes to come or even the game sequel, I'm curious to see what the developers are coming up with!
A very touching, well written story. Be prepared to have your heart strings pulled. It has a familiar classic RPG feel to it as well The critics were spot on when they said this game is a must play.
To The Moon, Itself, Is one of the best games ever. There's emotional scenes, Funny scenes, Drama scenes, etc. Its great, That's the point. Check it out.

I knew about this game from watching youtubers so I knew exactly what to expect. But to experience it myself made me closer to the characters. I have recommened this game to others without spoiling it so they can experience it wholly. This is honestly one of my favourite video games. I appreciate a game that can make me 'feel the feels' and make me want to play it over and over. It has memorable characters, witty dialogue and a beautiful design that frames a unique narrative. At times the motion controls feel awkward, but it is a trade off I'm willing to have. Thank you Kan Gao; I am so excited for Finding Paradise!
Very nice game, trully enjoyable and long enough.

If you like story driven games I cannot recommend this enough. It lasts about 4 hours and many people cannot put it down after we start. Utterly fantastic. The gameplay itself is pretty basic, but the story more than makes up for it.

Just finished this FANTASTIC game for the first time and literally didn't leave my seat for my whole almost 7 hours of gameplay and left and huge buttprint on it.  If you haven't play this game YET, trust me, you're missing out a big thing!  10/10!!

'Has it really been 5 years?' Is what I asked myself today. This game has been out for 5 years and I still smile everytime I see something from it. I wanted to buy the 5 year anniversary bundle, but then I saw I already got everything in it.  If a game still makes you happy after 5 years, it is amazing.

What if you have one chance to go back and make a last wish come true before your dying breath? Would you do it? In To The Moon, you are two scientists who could access your patient's memory and rewrite his past. As the story unfold, you will come to know intimate details of his life and solve puzzles to continue. It felt more like a game-like story than a game with a story for me, but I enjoyed every moment and wish this service is available in real life too.  Can't wait for the sequel Finding Paradise. :D

To be honest, against the mass of positive reviews here, I didn't feel  that  moved by the emotional bits of the game, even though I pretty much liked it. However, the writing is simply superb, and I became so attached by the two central characters that I kept playing nonstop just to see what they would do next, what would they talk about with each other and continue on exchanging insults in an amusingly way. I was fortunate enough to have never played it until recently, as I don't have to wait for so long for the second part of the story (and maybe, who knows, it was the right time to play it - if I had played before, maybe I would not have liked it so). The Sigmund Episodes let me curious as hell, and it was a delight to look a bit more onto the life and routine of these two characters.   I can't wait to meet them again.
-wonderful game -touching story
This 4 hour game has a better story than any AAA title I've ever played.  Oh and it was only $1.50

Wow what a game. Loved everything about it..especially the soundtrack. What a rollercoaster of emotions. I recommend this game to everyone who doesnt mind point and click games (literally). I assumed to always be one step ahead in games and boy was I wrong because i was shocked one quest at a time.
A fantastic emotional rollercoaster that should be played with a good set of headphones late at night all in one play through to get the full effect. Cannot recommend this more.

This is a very good STORY. I also think it deserves the positive reviews because of the ending and the music. If you are an individual who will not be interrupted for 4 hours, I suggest you buy this. HOWEVER. I want to stress that there is not really any replayability, and the choices you make in the beginning have little impact on the story. If you are able to accept this minor con, then purchase this game and hop on the feels train.

How to sum up this game?! Probably the best storyline I've ever played in a game. So good. Great soundtrack too. Definately worth picking up - best played without any prior knowledge of the story at all :)
10/10 Would cry again.
A great 3 hour game with a amazing story to tell.
Buy it, play it. Get your friends to buy it and play it.
A story told perfectly.
I nominated this game for the The “I'm Not Crying, There's Something In My Eye” Award in the Steam Awards. This game is beatifull, play now this game!
Simple, beautiful. Don't expect a technically brilliant game, just approach it with an open mind.  Yanked my heart.
Brilliant, simply brilliant.
This is the obvious choice for the “I'm Not Crying, There's Something In My Eye” Award.
First of all this game is ♥♥♥♥ing amazing, not only is it worth EVERY PENNY it has the most 'feels trip' story line.  10/10 will cry again!

Buy this. Love it. Buy the soundtrack. Love it. Buy everything associated with it. Love it all. This is not just a game. It is a story. A wonderful, emotion-playing, thought-provoking story. I cried even though my eyes were dried up from a blowing fan and from looking at the screen for too long. You are doing yourself a disservice by not playing this. Your life is objectively worse.  This is the first serious review I have ever made for anything. To The Moon is that good.

Masterpiece. But there're some things that i don't like about this game. Controls are not too good. A lot of bugs. And I'm actually in tears , BUT still disapointed in ending. I'll rate it 7/10. Good puzzles. Good story. Exciting soundtrack.

Beautiful game. Brought a tear to my eye
It was good !
Its an awesome game. Really recommend it!

I didn't need the feels, I really didn't... and yet I loved every moment of it.  The gameplay may be a bit tedious for many players, however the story really touches your heart.... and the songs in the game.... God damn, they fit perfectly with the scenes.

'because... one day i'm going to befriend one of them' does that mean River would be able to be an astronaut? just curious this story ends well, but I hate they removed their memories for some parts of school(am i right??) deserves the award

Not so much a game as a visual novel coded in RPG Maker, this bundles a beautiful love story, a subtle mystery (or two), and a tale of end-of-life regret into a 3-4 hour package. Easy choice to nominate for the 2016 'Something In My Eye' Award, and I'm impatiently awaiting the next game in the series. If it has a flaw, it's that it tries a little too hard to include gameplay elements for the sake of having them.
The feels...
You will cry a lot...

Fist thing, I just love the narrative. The basic (or rather rudimentary) game mechanics is a filler or backdrop to narrative. The game is best approached as as a visual or kenetic novel instead. By going on that approached, the story stands out on its own, even to the extent of fitting in the 5 elements of a short story (charcters, setting, plot, conflict, resoultion) better than most other KNs. The music cues are timed well into the story to provide memorable moments.  The expansion does provides some limited world building of the technology and society. The ending of the expansion is reminicisent of a popular movie of the prior year.  tl;dr approach this game as a kenetic novel to best enjoy and tear up as you progress through.

To The Moon is a spectacular, story-driven adventure that will make you weep and laugh. To me, it is the single most wonderful game I've ever played and to all those who want a great experience; buy this game. And play it. It's not the longest. But the journey is amazing.  The gameplay is fairly simple. Move through memories, find mementos that help you go further back in time, and complete puzzles to properly advance through the stages. It's nothing to write home about, but I found it enjoyable just the same.  The soundtrack is probably the best I've heard in a video game in a long time. The creator of this game did the entire soundtrack himself, and he did absolutely magnificent work. To The Moon could be a sound game, and it'd get by on this alone.  The story. To The Moon could be considered something of a visual novel. But it is the best damn visual novel that I've ever had the absolute pleasure of reading. The story in this is one of beauty. It'll make you laugh, it'll make you cry (a lot). And in the end, I think it may be one of the most fulfilling experiences you ever take.  I wanted to nominate To The Moon for a number of catagories. However you can only nominate a game for one. As such, I've nominated this game for the 'there's something in my eye' award. To The Moon is a beautiful experience, and I defy you not to cry at least once through its' many stages. This game is a thing of beauty, and on sale for far too cheap right now. If you can, buy it. It'll be an experience you don't regret.

To the Moon....certainly took me to the stars! 4.5 of them anyway. So let's get down to reviewing.  To the Moon is a story driven 2d RPG/Puzzel game. What I mean by this is that the game includes momentos (hah...see what I did there.) to the common mechanics in the genre's but really is nothing more then an Role Playing game. The role which you play is of two Sigmund Corp. scientists, Dr.Neil Watts and Dr Eva Rosalene, who are sent to asssist a man named Johnny who is on his death bed. Their job is simple, use a large machine in order to edit his memories to allow him to die with his final wish, to go to the moon. Over the course of perusing around his memories to collect momentos the dynamic duo learn Johnny's entire tragic life as well as about River his late wife whom place a major role in making you cry. The story of the game is exceptional, one of the best and most memorable experiences in indie games. It will make you cry, laugh, cry and laugh, feel unsure of how much you should be laughing or crying, etc. It's a tear jerker and a memorable experiece for sure. And there's something that will forever be rewarding in the final sunset of the game. The characters are well developed and beautifully dynamic (Neil is also my spirit animal). River and Johnny's interactions will make you smile like a child and cry like your wife died. So if you love a good story, head To the Moon. However you have to be into this game for the story because when it comes to game mechanics and game play there is very little. To the Moon is meant to be detail based in it's gameplay. It asks the player to searh it's 2d environments for objects and conversations of significance to Johnny to progress. After the environment his been explored you have to take the memory links you've gained and used them to unlock the momento. The momento can then be used to travel through to anouther memory by solving a puzzel. And these puzzels are easy. it doesn't matter how many moves you solve it in you will still progress. Other then these 'fetch quests' and puzzels, there is one hallway fight involving throwing trees and it's a fun change of gameplay however breif. So in short, the gameplay is a fine change of pace and the fetch quests let you absorb alot of the envirnment and story you would otherwise miss, but honestly there just isn't alot of game. The graphics are also heavily stylized. Kan Gao made this game in RPG maker, so I understand that the engine has it's limitations and the game doesn't look bad. Areas are well modeled for the most part and diverse. And while I personally didn't care for the NASA HQ, it certainly doesn't mean that the designer did a poor job. Ontop of that, the diversity of the characters looks to the NPCS is very refreshing, as there is always clarity on who to talk to. Not to mention each of the chosen Momentos are symbols, and these symbols are designed with great litterary purpose. The only thing that I would say detracts from the game's look are the cut scenes which look like they were made in GIMP. But even then, these computer drawn images have alot of charm to them, so as much as they are bad, they are good. The OST is breif yet beautiful and mostly is composed of piano. And while I wouldn't say to go out and buy it, as the OST is very related to the game itself, I would say it's meshed perfectly into the story. Each song builds up emotion perfectly and never feels out of place in a scene. Honestly, after you finish the game then by the OST as the soundtrack will remind you of every heatfelt moment.   So to sumarize: - PROS - Memorable, emnotional narrative - Heartfelt and memorable OST - Beautiful character design - Extreme Detail and interactability - 'Charming' graphical design - Forces you to explore the environments your in. - Emotional replay value  - CONS - OST tracks are brief and repetitive if not for what they are related to. - One area modled strangly - Cut Scenes look cheap.  So what if you're a completionist? Well fear not, this game will be the easiest you've ever completed. While it has no completion bonus beyond closure to a beautiful story, you only have to do one thing to complete it. Get Johnny to the moon! Just sit back, and enjoy this five hour story and as long as you don't keal over from heartache or smiling so hard your face gets stuck, you'll have completed the game. As for the DLC minisodes, they just add 40 minutes of story and a cool new gameplay mechanic and are completely worth playing. They expand the universe nicely without making the game any harder to complete. So in short, just finish the game and congrats, your a completionist, no struggle at all.   So finally my rating for this game is 9/10 , Complete it!

To the Moon is a fantastic story! It's not your typical game, it is more a story than anything.   The story starts with two doctors who are trying to get a dying man, John, to the moon through his memories. However, to implant the memories, the doctors must first plant that desire on him as a child as the will was not very strong to begin with. John says at he doesn't know why, he just wants to go to the moon. As you travel backwards through John's memories you learn more about him and what he has gone through. The characters feel alive in a sense that you care for all of them you talk to. Each new character that is added as the story progresses feels natural. Not all is dull either, Neil, the male doctor is always providing comic relief throughout the game ('HADUKEN!').  Visually the game is well done. At first I thought I would be put off by the style but it really grew on me. There are a few cartoon drawn moments that I felt were out of place. Thankfully that only happened two or three times.  Gameplay is where the game is at its weakest. Between each set of dialog in the memory you are suppose to find five important items that give you orbs to use on a memento. This memento allows you to proceed to the next memory. Items are hidden and sometimes leave you moving the mouse cursor left to right waiting for the cursor to change into a hand to pick up the item. Other times orbs are randomly given by just walking around exploring. This can be highly annoying if you have four out of the five orbs and can't find the last one. Thankfully that only happened twice for me.  After you beat the game, within the game's folder in steam there is a free DLC that adds 20mins onto the ending. It doesn't add anything to important to the story but if you enjoyed the main game, you should check that out as well.

More visual novel than video game, the technical edges of this experience are a little bit rough. However, that doesn't distract too much from the very intense story. The game's little details in design more than make up for the occasional hiccup (like getting stuck in a wall). On another level though, I personally think that the game could have taken itself more seriously at times, because it simply deals with very serious topics.   You may find that playing To the Moon is the first time you even encounter those topics in a video game. It's always nice to see the medium grow and tackle new subjects. As far as narrative structure is concerned, you will probably not be disappointed by To the Moon's innovative approach. It feels like a bunch of literary devices were taken from different movies/books and fused into one, but this combination does not feel dated at all.  The way the game's themes are integrated into the story world is very confusing at times, which is actually important for the narrative itself. Sounds too abstract? I'd spoil it for you if I said any more.  On the whole I consider To the Moon an exceptionally interesting and moving game/narrative, which is supported by a nice(ly used) soundtrack. If you are interested in video games as 'vessels' that contain stories, then I definitely recommend playing this. And yes, you will cry.
