One of the best games I have ever played. Very good storyline, soundtracks, and I was really attached to the characters.  I'll give a 10/10.

First and foremost, don't be mislead by the game's genre here on Steam: it is no RPG and no adventure. This game is a pure visual novel - and although the gameplay is much more interactive than in your classical Japanese-style 'read plenty of text in front of a still image' visual novels, don't expect a whole lot of actual, you know, gameplay. It is very important to get this out of the way first in order to not attract people who want to see running and shooting in their video games to this one.  But if you're not one of these people and would enjoy just sitting down and watching a beautiful story unfold in front of you (with very minimal imput from you side, as it is 100% linear) - then To The Moon is definitely worth your time and money. It has everything you could ask for in a game like that: extremely engaging but also thought-provoking story, very livelike and likeable characters, beautiful presentation and a great soundtrack. It may be somewhat short, but I couldn't get myself away from it until if was over (took 4-5 hours roughly), and would definitely recommend it to anyone not looking for an actual RPG here.

Short but very entertaining. It has an excellent story and some great music. The story is very engaging and keeps you entertain from the moment you start right up to the finale. It is a truly beautiful game.

If it was possible to describe how amazing this game was in words, I don't think I'd be able to find the right ones. This game is easily a 10/10 and forever a favorite.   I recommend this game to any fan of an immersive story, and more so to anybody who wants to hear a good one.   Warning: Game may make player shed some tears...
Simply one of the best stories told out there. Buy it!

This game is simply amazing. The story is great, but also very sad. It will probably make everyone who puts themselves into the game emotionally touched. Also, the soundtrack is just amazing. I completed the game a long time ago, but I'm still listening to the soundtrack to this day. I really, really recommend this game to everyone who will give it a chance. It might be 2D, but trust me, you will find out that 2D games, can be just as good as 3D games.

I'm not into these RPG's, at least i though that ! And then i played To The Moon !  It really has a great storyline and I loved it !  Give it a chance, i think you wont be dissappoited if you love great storylines

To the Moon is living proof that a game does not necessarily need to have superb graphics or complex gameplay in order to be entertaining and intriguing. Utilising a simple gameplay system and character development, the game unfolds an amazing story of a man's life of regret. While I wouldn't promise that this story will make you tear, completing the game will probably move the hearts of even the most cold-hearted. Also note that the game is only the First Episode of its series, with the game developer promising the development of sequels.   That being said, the story/game is complete in its own merit. If you're someone who's not particularly looking for awesome graphics or gameplay, but rather just looking for an emotional, fascinating and relatively short story, this game is definitely worth a go.

Truly a masterpiece it's not often that games like this are made. To the moon is telling a story a story of a man's life. Using lots of gags excellent music Freebird created a msterpiece showing that not all games have to be about killing and war.  My rating 10/10 Great Game I look forward to Freebirds next game.
Magestic and thought provoking. Plucked the heart strings real good. If you like a story...this is it. I wish i could have temporary amnesia and play this game again for the first time...
I cried, buy it.

You'll laugh, you'll cry... you'll mainly cry though but still, this is a great game to play.  If you haven't bought it yet, buy it now. If you haven't played it in a while, give it another playthrough.
Wow just finished it great music,great graphics, and the story will make you cry

'Emotionally evocative story' describes this game perfectly. It's a poignant, thoughtful, and touching without being blatantly trying to do so. There's also plenty of comic relief and jokes sprinkled in for players who have lived through the 90s, delivered via Dr. Neil. The effect of viewing John's life in reverse has a great effect similar to that of the film 'Memento' (2000) in that the motivations and reasons behind his actions (as well as others) are revealed in a sort of twist.  While created in the visual style of traditional JRPGs from the 90s, 'To the Moon' is definitely no Final Fantasy (and I mean that in a good way). First of all, the game is very much story driven--most gameplay involves exploring the areas for small cutscenes and searching items/people for 'data bars' to unlock the next part of the story. There is a puzzle component in 'preparing' each memento before accessing the next memory, but there are no move constraints or special conditions to complete the easy puzzles. For a player who plays primarily for story, this may be a plus since you then spend significantly less time distracted from the main story. 'To the Moon' definitely plays quickly--I finished it in a matter of hours--but is extremely worthwhile.  The music of this game is also as beautiful (if not more so) as the wonderfully nostalgic quality of the graphics. One could easily listen to the soundtrack as a standalone and it is a perfect accompaniment to the touching storyline.  In short: great emotional story, beautiful music, must play for those who love playing games for their stories.

Very well made Indie game but not worth the 10 dollars in my opinion. I got it on the humble bundle luckily but I would wait till it is on sale to get. If it is $5 or below buy this game. Definitely going to be checking out more freebird games in the future.
One of must play game ever! I have nothing to say, just give itt a shot and you'll love it :D

I almost didn’t play this game. I almost passed up the Humble Indie Bundle which included this game. That would have been a huge mistake. What first caught my eye about To The Moon was it’s pixel art. I decided to give it a try and now it’s one of my favorite indie games. A moving story, great music, and fantastic characters make this a must-play for anyone who likes story-heavy games.  Story To The Moon follows Dr. Eva Rosalene and Dr. Neil Watts who work for a company that changes people’s lives. They are hired by those about to die, and have the power to change the dying person’s memory to fulfill any last wish they may have. Their current patient is an old man named John who wishes to go to the moon. It’s up to Rosalene and Watts to make their way through John’s memories to change them in such a way that allow John to visit the moon, at least in his memory. It sounds rather complicated, but the game eases you through it. Also, the game progresses reverse-chronologically through John’s memories, and some of the more sombre subjects are dealt with early on, so their impact isn’t as depressing to the player. And there are a lot of adult themes in this game. I don’t mean sex or drugs, I mean real adult themes like death, marriage, mental illness, family, etc. The story is very moving and has a touch of Miyazaki about it, and I’ll admit I cried more than once during my playthrough. Thankfully, the game does a good job of breaking up the heavier sections with more lighthearted ones. Rosalene and Watts are hilarious, and I found myself cracking up on multiple occasions. There were some pop culture references that felt a bit shoehorned into the game, but aside from that, the story was spot-on. It’s hard to go into a lot of depth about this game’s story without ruining what makes the story so great to begin with. Just play it for yourself. You’ll understand.  Gameplay TtM is marketed as something of an adventure game, but it feels a little more like a visual novel. As such, it’s light on gameplay and heavy on dialogue. Not that this is a bad thing. I personally love these kinds of games, however if you’re expecting explosions or killstreaks or powerups, or are an IGN writer, you’ll have to look elsewhere. The game involves top-down 2D movement through environments. You can either move by using the arrow keys/numpad, with the spacebar to interract, or use the mouse to click on your destination. I wasn’t fond of the mouse controls, however moving the cursor over items allowed you to see what you could interact with, which was nice. The pathfinding with the mouse controls also didn’t always work well, so arrow key control was the most effective method for me. Throughout the memory sections, your goal is to find important items in the environment that allow you to unlock the next memory. At the end of each memory, you’ll also have to complete a tile-flipping puzzle to move on. None of these things are particularly difficult, however it’s enough to keep you feeling involved.  Presentation The graphics in this game are all pixel-based. I really enjoyed the characters and some of the environments, however the outdoors environments are a bit cluttered and it’s sometimes hard to tell which tiles are navigable and which are obstacles. However, I really enjoyed some of the subtleties with the character animations. It’s amazing how changing 2 pixels can carry a huge meaning. The music for this game is absolutely beautiful. Most of the tracks are emotionally moving piano pieces, however strings and music boxes are also used in the soundtrack, and every song has meaning and emotion to it. This game would be nothing without its soundtrack. One minor thing I noticed while reading through the dialogue in the game is that there are a few spelling errors and places where the grammar seems a bit awkward, suggesting that this game was probably translated from another language, however it detracts little from the flow of the game and is perfectly excusable.  TL;DR To The Moon is a beautiful visual novel game with a stunning soundtrack. The game will make you cry from how moving it is, however it knows how to interject humor to lighten the mood. The developer has also decided to make this game into a series, and I’m beyond excited to play the next installments. This is a game that everyone needs to experience.  Pros: - Moving story - Beautiful soundtrack - Great characters  Cons: - Some shoehorned pop culture references - Some confusing environments - Some minor spelling/grammar errors Final Score: 9/10

Whoaw, didn`t expect this. Gameplay is basicly non existent but if you are looking for something else, look no further. This is hands down the most moving game I`ve played in my carreer. I say game, rather it`s a interactive story. Highly recommended.
To the Moon is ofter more like an interactive movie then a game. Lovely and dreamlike.

Out of all games I have played, this one by far has the best story. The way it progresses is amazing. The art is also a very strong feature that adds a lot to this game. You'll be wondering what's happening throughout the game and each time you find out why it won't be dissapointing. Get this game, you will not want to stop playing it until you reach the end. As for me, I'll be looking forward to the next episode by freebird.

In my opinion 'To the Moon' delivers a very interesting and touching story that would make a wonderful movie by Studio Ghibli. You just don't have to expect much from the gameplay, as there is virtually none besides clicking objects to proceed and the occasional very easy 'Flip Tiles' puzzles.

DONT PLAY THIS GAME!!! The Story Line and the Soundtrack will get you to the Sadly Atmosphere When i finished this game i got manly tears And please dont Play this game!  Btw this is the best RPG Game i have ever played
This game, this soundtrack, this... everything is amazing. Can't wait for more.
Great story, enjoyed this game, amazing soundtrack too
Such an amazing game, the story is so good, and the humour of characters goes hand in hand. You'll laugh, you'll cry, you'll enjoy this game. Pleasantly surprised.
I don't normally go for this kind of game but I'm glad I did! The storyline is great and keeps you guessing and the game is accompanied by a superb soundtrack.
It made me feel a feeling other than hate
Great!

I had this game for a while just sitting in my games list and thought I would try it I wasn't expecting much but I loved it!!! And I'm a big wuss and it made me very emotional lol I played it in one sitting too, not that it's long just I don't usually do that lol Anyway brill game!!!

This is a true diamond in the rough. Very rarely (Pretty much only the Walking Dead) has gotten me in the feels like this game has. To pass this up is to pass up something that is pretty one of a kind. Very point and click, with random interspersements of other genres at times. Also uses plenty of culture references, which hopefully will maintain some of their humor in the future too. No replayability, however, since it is basically a short story in the format of a game. I would buy on sale, however, if you appreciate games for their story alone, this is worth full price.
Definitely a story worth reading through,  with interesting character development as the story progress   and its a better love story than Twilight
Here comes the Feels train!
This game is excellent. Aside from the few points when the music forgot what volume it was suppose to be, an excellent game worth your time.
This is more of a story than a game. Even so, doesn't take too long and the story is entertaining, would recommend.

What a slap!!!  Working for a memory altering service, you gotta handle a new case. Johnny's about to die, he always wanted to go to the moon. You've been contracted to make his wish real, in his memories.  This journey through his memories tells us more about him, about the characters who crossed his path and the choices he could make and their consequences.  You won't be able to escape these terrible questions : - Who am I really? - What is my true dream? - What if I'd done differently?
Just finished it. This is, in my opinion, the most charming game ever created! Indie gaming at it's finest. I almost cried a bit there... I strongly recomend 'To The Moon' to everyone!
It made me cry
This is one of my favorite indie games of all time. Once I started and really got into it I couldn't stop playing it. Short, great soudntrack and and amazing storyling.
Not at all what I expected, but ended up being an excellent use of 4 hours. The humor elements and references sprinkled throughout were a nice touch.

This is a really lovely little game. Great music, great old-school graphics, and characters you grow to care about. It's barely a game, but I don't think it would have worked as well in another medium. I still recommend it very, very highly.  Lastly, I have to praise the game's fairly subtle storytelling. Everyone has different points where the game hits them in the feels, for me it was 10 minutes after the game had ended, taking in the whole of it.
Liked the game, tells a good story, graphics are 90's-ish. Had buggy issues with one part in the game that has you chasing horses. I would play again.

It is not a good 'game'. I does not have cool mechanics. Even walking around does not feel very good (and it is all you do). But the story is very, very good! I was crying in the first half hour, it is that emotional! Every human who has a soul must play this game as soon as he can!
This is my favorite game ever, topping all N64 and SNES titles in its wake. fight me.
A short and excellent game.
This is the most emotional experience I have ever had in a video game. An excellent indie title.
Just play it. It's around 3-4 hours long and is more of an interactive story than anything else. One of the best written games I've ever played. Do it.
90/100 Definitely a great game. Story wise it has everything. From funny moments to tear jerking ones, this game has it all.
A beautiful and hopelessly romantic story plus heart-warming music, spiced with a little dose of good humour.
even though its terrible graph, it really does tell a moving story.
9/10  Boy. what a ride.  Worth every penny. Though Bit short. the ending is BYOND beatiful and amazing

Oh boy where do I begin on how much I loved this short and simple indie game.  It may have only taken me about three... may four hours to beat To the Moon. But within that time I laughed, teared up, and smilled as I watched the slowly unfolding past of Johnny, who hires an agentcy who's goal is to grant any wish for someone before they pass on. I won't explain everything here but it's really neat and orignal what they come with without it feeling like the excuse of IT'S MAGIC THAT'S WHY or some kind of Deus Ex Machida.   However don't expect much from the gameplay as it story and characters take center stage here but for only being about a three to four hour experiance it dosen't really hinder the game. You'll quickly find a pattern to the gameplay and while it dosen't really change it's designed to keep you engaged in the story (actually for almost the whole last half-hour there's almost no gameplay to speak of).  The pixelted graphics looked great and dat soundtrack... I won't say anything else besides pick up the OST along with this game. You won't regret it.   Overall for such a cheap price just buy it and take an evening to play though it. It's certainly not for everyone but to those who just want to play a relaxing game with an emotional story give it a look.  9/10

If you want to play this game, and think you are a 'manly man',   don't.  You will cry, you will chuckle, you will feel relation to one or more of the characters. Overall this game is visually astounding, in gameplay and story. Two scientists that fulfill a dying person's last wish, meet with an old man named Johnny that wishes to go...can you guess it? To The Moon. This game will tug at your heartstrings and play with them until they snap. Not only is it an eomtional train wreck, but it has some fun moments, like when the scientists talk about an episode of Doctor Who when they try to fit a piano in the TARDIS.  You will not see ANYTHING in the story coming. As soon as it happens you'll pause, make a face, and say 'The ♥♥♥♥?!' tl;dr- You'll cry, because this game is about lighthouses, spaceships and roadkill.

This game will make you cry. No matter how manly you are. About 2 1/2 hours long and a wonderfully written story about a team of doctors that enter a dieing mans mind to insert the memory of a wish he's always wanted, to fly to the moon. Kind of like Inception meets Eternal Sunshine on the Spotless Mind. If you are married, this game will resonate even deeper with you.

'To the Moon' is the single most moving narrative I have ever experienced in gaming. Depressing, heartfelt, hilarious, and powerfully beautiful all at once. These characters are so naturally realized, and this story is so expectly crafted and scored, that I dare-say even one with a heart of ice, will be feeling the heat by the completion of this story.   While constantly breaking the 4th wall and referencing 90's culture, this game delights with pulling you in by your own nostalgia and your own personal memories, wishes and feelings. Constantly asking you to question how different things might have been, and reminding you of all the things you've experienced instead, good and bad and inbetween; full of regrets, fear, and longing, reminding you how meaningful, breif and precious our time, and each other, really is.   Your time would be well spent travelling into Johnny's memories, and learning to live (and die) with love.    10/10 -Beautiful in every way
A nice story!

Great soundtrack and story combined with a style similar to classic SNES RPGs from Squaresoft. I would recommend setting aside the three or so hours to play it through in one sitting to get the best impact of its fairly emotional and engaging story.

It's not very often that a game really gets you right in the feels, but To the Moon does it, and it does it well. It's an emotional roller coaster from start to finish. The story is heart-breaking and heart-warming at the same time; I never really knew if I should be crying or smiling. I'm sure that if it wasn't for Neil, I probably would have been a blubbering mess by the time I finished. The music is perfect in every scene, and it was even just patched to FLAC for even better sound quality.  There's very little actual gameplay, and it's not a very long game (3-4 hours, tops) but that doesn't take away from the game in the slightest. It's the best 3-4 hours and <$10 you'll spend on a video game in a very, very long time. Buy this now, keep a box of tissues on hand, and thank Kan Gao when you're finished for making such a masterful work of art.

Not really an RPG but an interactive story. Takes around 3.5 Hrs to finish. Deep and moving plot about two scientists trying to alter the lifetime memories of a dying man to fulfill his wish to fly to the moon. No battles, just moving around and exploring but totally worth it if your into a nice story. Good music and some jokes too. Needed to deactivate 'DEP' on Windows 7 for the game's *.exe to work though.

May not look like much and is mostly an interactive story rather than an actual game, but the story is good and the premise is charming. Will keep you engaged for an afternoon, which isn't a bad thing for that low price point. Part one of a series to keep an eye on!
Beautifully told and emotionally moving.

One of the most beautiful games I have ever played. A love story that would put even the best to shame. While marred by its awkward and clunky controls, the gorgeous soundtrack, crisp visuals, and narrative will evoke tears or chills from even the most hardened of men.

IF you are a Sociopath, this game is not for you.  This indie game has graphics like Chrono Trigger, and a story to rival it. The controls are mainly click oriented, but without a waypoint system you will get stuck if you're not careful.  Play this game if you like unique science fiction, or if you enjoy romantic comedies.
This story is phenominal. 10/10
Buying the game even just for it's OST is worth it.  The game play, while not for everyone has a great storyline!

Most games wouldn't go near the kinds of topics that To the Moon crafts a whole story around. I haven't connected with a game narrative like this since the days of interactive fiction.   Across its four-or-so hours and seventy-or-so years, To the Moon touches upon deeply personal moments in its central character's life. They range from the most revelatory to the most minute, yet every one is as relevant and poignant as the last.  The most common critique of the game seems to be that it's not a game. Balls to that! Approach it as you would an IF-adventure and this production is sure to amaze.

A well told story of a man having his desire to go to the moon realised using a machine that alter memories as if they ever happened. The music is phoenominal and the overall game looks stunning and beautiful. Coming from RPG Maker XP, this is one of the best commerials RPGs of its kind on steam.
Amazing story. We rarely come across a game with such a plot. After passing I had the feeling that I have read a good book. Highly recommened.
The best game in the world.
Absolutely heart warming. Changed my view on video games. A story worthy of an oscar. 100/100, worthy of a AAA 60$ game price.
You will cry like a baby at the end.

Honestly, it's hardly even a game, but the feelings it evokes, the absolutely beautiful story and soundtrack... It truly is as good as it gets... I would pay even more than the cost of the game to watch a movie half as well-executed as this game... So many feels...

Oh my god... I don't know how to express how much I loved this. Everything is amazing, especially the soundtrack, the story, the characters, everything. Easily a new part of my favorite games of all time. I don't care what you have to do to get the money, buy this game.
I can't get over this story. It is one of my favorites of all time, Short and not much to the game play. Story and music are fantastic. Runs about 2-3 hours, but well worth your time.
Crappy graphics, awesome music, GREAT story!
'To the Moon' is an enchanting and wonderful game, the story is captivating. Can't wait for the sequel.
Not a story that grabs you straight away but stick with it. For a game this is exceptionally emotional.
Incredible.
This game is a must play if you love great story telling! The story is just beautiful and touching and incorporates rpg elements within the gameplay. Play it and you will be in love with it!

This game wasn't really a game. It was more of a love story told through the medium of a 2D pixel graphics interactive program. Think of this as a story book with visuals. I really enjoyed it. It was a great story and I think would make a great movie. It is only 3 hours long and has no replay value, but it was 3 hours well spent.
Very powerful story. Plays like a visual novel mixed with a JRPG and takes about 4 hours to completely clear. I would greatly suggest it for the story, music and the great 16-bit styled art.
i love this game it has an emotional story that will drive you to play more with a beautiful art style to contribute
Best story
buy it and cry all the tears.

To The Moon is one of the most incredible storytelling experiences I've ever encountered in video games. It has a unique topic that really makes you think about life and how you have been living. Basically you travel through the memories of an old man and learn his life story. To The Moon is not a long game, has little gameplay variation, and mediocre graphics, but this game is about something else. This game is about the story. You will laugh, cry, and think while playing To The Moon. I highly reccomend this storytelling masterpiece. 8.5/10
This is, without a doubt, one of the best games I have ever played.

This game cannot easily be summarized. It is a very different experience. Simply put though: I smiled, I laghed, I cried, got my heart broken and after finishing I think life seemed a bit brighter. 10/10
An excellent story that gets you right in the feels. Get ready to ride on an emotional rollercoaster. Excellent Soundtrack as well!
A simple, but beatiful story about love and family.  Not the best game (simple, and sometimes too little control for me), but sometimes a simple, well-told story gets everything right.
This was an amazing experience for me, I'm not sure how to describe ti without giving away what makes it so.

This could have been made in RPG Maker, and it's only about 4 hours long. The $10 price tag is fantastically low considering the quality involved in this game. When I saw it after a friend purchased it, I thought it looked interesting enough to buy during a Steam Sale or something. This was a mistake. That same friend bought it for me after he finished, and I'm convinced that I should have bought it at full price as soon as it came out.  Since it's essentially a 16-bit visual novel, the focus here is clearly on the writing. It is outstanding, both in terms of plot and dialogue. It's done the best job developing 4 major characters in 4 hours that I've ever seen. The game elements are few and far between, but they're all thematically appropriate and they never overstay their welcome.  This is going to be my new go-to for giving people games.
The comedy falls a bit flat. The drama definitely doesn't. Well worth playing.
Oh man..... Buy this. Playing this game will make you a better person. It will also make you cry for at least the second half of the four hours you will spend playing it.
Great story, although the only gameplay is one small whack a mole game, good story though

To The Moon is heartfelt, intriguing and overall a fantastic game. Do not expect 'gameplay' that is not what this game is about, it's all about the story and characters. I started this game not really caring about the old man John at all and by the end I cared for him on a very emotional level. If you want a game that will entice you with a very emotional, in depth and all around incredible story that will keep you invested in the characters then please do yourself a favor and give this game a try, you won't regret it.
Wow! Just Wow!
Elegant is the only word that can come close to describing this game.

I really didn't know what to expect from this title and to be honest there wasn't really much gameplay at all except point and clicking, and the same puzzle over and over again after every scene. To The Moon is based solely around a sad but fantastic original story brought to life in a game. The graphics seemed to fit so well along with an amazing soundtrack. You almost forget you're playing a game because it's so much like watching a movie. All of it gives this game replayability. I recommend everyone who craves a strong story driven game to play it.
So Beautiful :'(  Even calling it a point n click/JPRG hybrid is a stretch, but it's a damn fine work of interactive fiction, thats for sure.

Strongly recommended purchase for 'To The Moon'. It's a well written semi-interactive story. Even though it's not a game, it's WELL worth the $8; far more entertaining than any movie I've seen this year.   Do not argue. Buy this game, set aside 4-5 hours to play it through in one sitting. You'll thank me later.

To the Moon is not a game to be played, but rather, an experience to be had, an excellent piece of work that cannot be explained why it is without spoiling its plot.  Soundtrack bundle is highly recommended, as the music compliments the content To the Moon delivers nicely, leaving a bittersweet aftertaste as the credits roll.

Many manly tears were shed. ;_; Just like Dear Esther this one is more of an interactive story than a game. If you're looking for interesting gameplay mechanics, you're going totally wrong with this one. But if you're a dreamy romanticist like me you'll probably burst out in tears at one point ..

Interesting game, not an RPG at all... really just a point and click adventure game. Story is nice and music is very nice. I think I'm about 2 hours in, suspect it lasts another hour or 2. Wish they had some window settings... it chooses fullscreen exclusive by default with vsync off, which is silly for this kind of game.

There is no need to go to great lengths about this game. It is a beautiful game, and it's one of the only ones that made me cry. It didn't make me cry because somebody died or anything cheap like that, but it made me cry at the beauty of everything.   My brother's girlfriend called me a 'p-p-p-♥♥♥♥♥,' but I can live with that.

Is it bad when hearing snips of the sountrack can still bring me to tears? Its not long, but its amazing. i'll 'deduct' 0.0000001 point for jerks who are going to whine its not really a 'game' its an 'interactive entertainment experience' just to make them happy. Anyone else, buy it, holy grap god damn buy it.  (9.9999999/10)
Very minimal gameplay, but a good interactive story that is definatly different what we see in games. It takes 4-5 hours to be completed.

This game... In fact more an interactive story is just incredible. No other words can describe it. Anyone with even a sense of playing decent, memorable games should buy this and play it with an open mind. Honestly, I really hope some crazy fan makes this into a movie and pulls it off geniusely just so everyone can enjoy it's majesticness.

One of the best stories ever told in a video game. The majority of movies and books cannot even touch the plot of this game. If you enjoy a great story in a video game its a must buy. If. however, you enjoy PLAYING a game then well don't buy this because its not really a game so much as a story. It is pretty much going to be a one and done type deal too so no real reason to play through multiple times. Despite its lack of gameplay and replay value, the game has great music and is really well written. Every character is well fleshed out, there are no 'filler' characters at all. What it all boils down to is if you want a story and music that easily surpasses the majority of books and movies nowadays buy this 'game'. If however you want a GAME well then don't buy this because you are pretty much just getting the story. If you decide to buy it, i'd recommend an indie bundle or sale since it only takes about 3-4 hours to complete but its worth it.
Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind meets Total Recall in pixel-art form.
Deep, touching story. Gameplay doesn't get in the way like a lot of other indie story games. Highly recommended.
The pixels, they make'a me cry! It has a classic RPG look to it, but they play is mostly finding relivant items to advance the story, which was great, and what you should play this game for.
Another one that's not much of a game, more of an interactive story. A good one though, I found it very interesting and worth it if you can find it on sale.

'To the Moon' is one of the most well written games on the pc to date. They somehow were able to balance appropriate humor and a heart wrenching story to give you a perfect 3 and a half hour package of story telling magic. And what's even more impressive is the fact that they did all of this with just pixely sprites and text. No photo realism or voice actors, just barebones(almost novel like) story telling.  My only gripe about this game is the fact that it's not really a game. It's going around clicking on objects to trigger dialogue meshed with unnecessary an minigame in between memories.   Also the soundtrack is really good.
Fantastic game. If you enjoy games where the main focus is on the story then this game is for you.
A must play. I heard a lot of hype about it and decided to check it out. The storyline is absolutely amazing, definitely plays with your emotions a bit too :3. A very intriguing storyline. 10/10
fantastic game, one of the best game stories i have had the pleasure of experiencing.
A love story told in reverse with the graphics of Chrono Trigger. One of the best games of 2012.

A great story can be measured by its ability to draw you into its world, its narrative. Whether it's a book, movie, song, any other form of art, or even a video game, all truly amazing stories strive for this same, singular goal. By the end, you should be affected in some way, some piece of that story will stick with you. No one can argue that the experience of playing a game lives on, we all have rose-tinted glasses in a drawer somewhere for some game. But for a game's story, not the gameplay, to live on, that's a rare thing. 'To the Moon' is one such rarity. I've called games must-plays before, but they all pale in comparison to this RPG-Maker gem. Simplistic gameplay and graphics hold on their shoulders fantastic music and an absolute marvel of a story. 'To the Moon' accomplishes in just a few short hours what other games and stories in other mediums can only dream of: a connection to a world and its characters. As more and more games try to reach this lofty goal, 'To the Moon' has set it higher. I only hope that in the future more games can climb this peak, because the view is breath taking.
I don't know what to do with my life now.
Great sci-fi elements, amazing drama and very suspensful. Beautiful game; must play.
The game is amazing. Amazing story, Amazing music, amazing use of an RPG. Just amazing.
Just an amazing game with a fantastic story, if you can put aside a few hours to just sit down and play this i promise you that you will enjoy it :)
Grab it if it's on sale! This game is more like a story telling than a game though, a story rich game. The only reason I'd say grab it if it's on sale is that $9.99 is kinda too expensive for me XD

Wow. This game. It's funny, charming and intelligent, but most of all it is absolutely stunning in terms of how emotional it made me. There isn't much 'gameplay' to it, but if you enjoy a brilliant story wonderfully told, think how the first ten minutes of UP made you feel, then pick it up without delay.

This game was such a joy to play. The controls might have been better if controller support had been present. However the story was propbablly one of the best adventure game stopries I can remember in recent memory, and it more than makes up for any short commings. The graphics are so fitting, and remind me a of games I played when I was younger. All in all this game is Great, and is a must-play!

So I wanted the achievment for writing a review and I've wanted it for a while but never decided to grab it cause I don't wanna do some half-baked review. So this should tell you that finally picking a game means this one stood out above any other game I have! The story is magnificent! Even without the music, art, creativity, references, pluckiness, and user friendliness, I would have played this game for the story. I swear if this became a movie or an anime or something, it would be one of the better recieved and spread like wildfire. The story is just brilliantly written!!  I read the other reviews and one said people thought it was slow. I will tell you that the emotional roller coaster everyone is letting on to is the second half of the game, with the first (probably the 'boring' part people were talking about) is exposition, wonder, and getting information. Like solving a mystery. It's all delving deeper into who this man is, who his wife was, and setting up the question 'How did it end up like this?!' and 'What was this supposed to mean?!'. The first half of the game makes you ask questions. Questions you want answers to and questions that drive you further into the game. And when you get to the second half, the roller coaster begins. And let me tell you. Anger, Fear, Sadness, Happiness, Horror - I felt all of those feelings to a degree in the second half of the game. And it was amazing.

Nice game with a great story. It is not entirely too long either, which makes it excellent for completing in one sitting. One thing I enjoyed greatly about this game is that there is really no way to lose, which makes it a nice change from all other games. It really is a game that is just driven by story.  Get the tissues ready...
I have never had a video game make me feel so strongly. if you haven't picked this up and aren't too objected to strictly story based gameplay then this is something you need in your collection.

When I started playing I thought I had wasted my money... I was plesently suprised when I found strange origami rabbits everywhere.  I dont want to spoil anything but the story was amazing and I am ashamed to admit as a man that I was crying the last hour of completing the game... ;'(  It was so sad and I dont know how they came up with the twists and stuffs.  The two 'main characters' who you play as are very funny. I loved all the refferences :)  Worth every cent!!!
The game is well done, and is a story that can bring tears to your eyes. It's puzzle-story game, so if you like a game with a story this is a must-get game.
WHO LET THESE ONIOS HERE GOD DAMN IT  10/10 game would cry again
Confused as to why not that many people know or have played this game. To The Moon hits home and leaves you like an emotional wreck. All aboard the feels train

While it is a short game that is 90% point-and-click, it has one of the best stories the medium of video games has to offer. Game takes about 3 hours to complete (one hour for the game's 3 acts, but there's an option to save). The humor is simple, but perhaps a bit intrusive in an effort not to take itself TOO seriously. Still, it is a memorable experience and highly recommended.
Nothing other than perfect
Worth every cent.

From the reviews of this game I was expecting a short game with a good story. And having now beat the game in a little over 3 and a half hours (having only looked up if I needed to get off the horse to exit the stage; we'll get to that in a bit), that's exactly what I got.  To the Moon did make me start to tear up at one point, as the game progresses from a man's old age to his youth, and you see what happened to bring him to where he was.   The art is good, the music is fantastic, but the controls leave a bit to be desired. I ended up playing the game with part mouse and part keyboard for movement, and quite frankly I still don't know which was better. Perhaps using a controller would have helped (if I even could; I didn't look). As mentioned above, the movement controls, and sometimes even the mouse selection, can be iffy.  While I understand it's built on top of an RPG Maker version, there's no real RPG elements, just point and click and minor puzzles.  But despite the minor issues, the game is recommended. 4 of 5 stars.
An emotional story that is worth every cent you spend on it.
Why am I crying?
The best story-based exploration game I've ever played, by far.
The feels! Such a good game. Kind of short though.

Really good game... awesome story, and would've made a great movie. It's about four hours long, has very casual gameplay (mostly just clicking through dialouge and moving characters). It's funny, it's sad, it's happy, it's creepy, this game makes you feel the entire spectrum of emotions.  Short synopsis (first five minutes of game)... You play two doctors that grant dying people their last wish by altering their memories (though in real life, nothing actually changes). Memories are altered by stepping backwards through the patient's memory. In this fashion, you see the patient's life events backwards. Once you can find the right motivation to trigger the patient's wish, you've completed your job. In this game, the doctors try to grant a dying man his wish to go To the Moon.

This game will make you laugh... it will make you cry... and cry some more...  This game effected me emotionally in a way i'll never forget. It's better then any movie ive ever seen, which it kind of is, but not in a bad way.(recommended to be played in one runthrough... have tissues in close proximity)
Somewhere in the land between game, interactive art, and movie. Deeply emotional. You learn the story as you travel back through Johnny's memories. Not grimdark, just heartwrenchingly sad.

A story worth reading. The gameplay is very limited, but this was expected for a story game. The narrative is very engaging, but be prepared to get emotional. This game broke me, but it was definitely worth it.

I cannot emphasise how much you need to play this game without spoiling the masterpiece of a storyline. Not to mention the music, humour, and genuinely heartbreaking moments. Play it, that's all I can say.
Can't recommend it enough. The whole game is ~4 hours, and it's fantastic. Not a game to play for action or puzzles or anything like that, but a wonderful little story.
The story is amazing, and the music is amazing, even though the control is terrible and interface isn't always obvious, overall the game is pretty good.

To the Moon is a perfect Game..It's story is perfect too,The characters are unique(especially River),And it's so touching.The graphics May not be rich but this could no way affect the game. It's ending is a little bit confused for my opinion (What Dr Rosalene do) but it's absolutely flawless!! 10/10 Would strongly recommend to anyone!!!
Story and music were amazing. The length was just right.
Such a touching game.

Not really a game as such, more of an interactive story. Well written with some funny and emotional moments. About 5 hours of play. Nice for a change, and was on sale. A couple of pound for 5 hours is good value, full price... well, not really imho
Yes. Just all of the yes. Music, story, everything is amazing. It's a must-have game.

To The Moon was a game that I didn't want to stop playing and I didn't want it to end. It had me laughing from its hilarious quotes/scenes and references, to crying from the story. You really feel like you have an attachment with the characters and that if something happens to them, it's just like... woah. I played the entire thing in one sitting and loved it. It's 2:00 AM for me right now. And i just finished it!
Made me feel sad for three days straight. I recommend this game.
This is a very beautiful game and worth any price you pay for it. The story is great and the music is fantastic.

I will be really, really glad to see if people want to play this game as well. The game is amazing! I'm sure you'll enjoy it too :) I watched Cry and Pewdiepie play it and most of my friends suggested it. (warning: gets very emmotional :_:)
cried.
Gorgeous game, beautiful soundtrack, engaging story and characters. A good use of 4 or 5 hours of anyone's time.
I cried like a ♥♥♥♥♥.

First of all, 'To the Moon' isn't really a game, it's more like a visual novel where you click on things and solve trivial puzzles from time to time. But let me say you this: It's the best %$§/ing visual novel I have ever seen! The story is sad, lovely, heartwarming, happy and tragic at the same time, the writing is astonishing, and I ended up with wet eyes after playing it. Marvelous!
I wouldn't say RIGHT in the feels, but it's close.

This game is, beautiful. A most play for every gamer. I can not reconmend this game enough. It's funny, witty, and beautifly sad. I want this to be a book so more people can expirence it. I want this to be way more popular and people to know what it is.
Words can't even began to describe how Beautiful this game is, Best story driven game I've ever played
the game feels alot like a very long quick time event but it works. the story is sickeningly sweet with a bunch of fun refrences from other franchises thrown in. this game is short and sweet.
Holy ♥♥♥♥ so good so many feels 10/10 would cry again
Play it for the story... brilliant game!

Don't let the RPG Maker-esque graphics mislead you; this is a great game with a lot of work and love put in it. If you like mystery, humor, sci-fi, psychology and bittersweet feels you'll love this game!
This game is more of an interactive movie. Worth every penny, very interesting plot, you get emotionally invested in the story sooooo much.

I'm at a loss for words.  No, really, there is no much to say about this game. I can say that this is a game for those who have patience, the ones that loves playing through the story, and everybody that loves happy endings.  But you shouldn't buy it if you are a lazy person, or someone that always plays games in a rush. Take your time. Play this game a couple hours. Finish it. Cry a Lot.  Good Luck.
More of a story than a game, but beautiful, interesting, well written and evocative. I would recommend checking it out.

This is a fun interactive visual novel.   The premise is that a company that specializes in 'wish fulfillment' hires itself out to people who are on their deathbed. The company will try to rewrite the dying person's memories so that, before they die, they believe they actually fulfilled their last wish. You take on the role of two company doctors as they travel back in time through an old man's memories. Their goal is to gather enough info to fulfill the old man's wish of going to the moon.  It's actually a well written story that's part drama part romance and part adventure. There is an excellent soundtrack that helps to convey the mood.   The art is unfortunately pixelated (this was made with RPG Maker) but this is forgivable since 'To the Moon' is all about reading a good storyline. But this is an interactive storyline, which I think is a better medium than a regular paperback book. A paperback book is passive entertainment, but a visual novel like this keeps the reader engaged through constant interaction.  In addition to navigating through the story there are also some minigames that are short, easy, and entertaining. There is no way to lose or die in this game, and since it's fairly linear you won't get lost either.  If you like a good story you should check out 'To the Moon.'
wow wow wow, and more wow. Such an emotional game. So good.

Great story. I loved it!  Altough the gameplay is just walking around and looking for items and at the end of each level, you have to solve a simple puzzle to proceed.  That doesn't mean the game is bad. You have good music, pixel art for the retro fans and a great story with good characters. The game just shows how some actions and people in the past have affected your present/future... how different choices in life might have made your life better/worse. If you don't like walking around and reading a lot of text and dialogues.   I really recommend this game, if you like all this psychological... all this mental... stuff.
It was worth two hours to read a good story about communication, the human condition, and fulfilled promises.

One of the most satisfying stories i have been through in a long time. Awesome soundtrack,and an awesome story. Now keep in mind this is pretty much a visual novel but I dont think i have spent better money on a game in a long time.
Heartwrenching story complemented with right-for-the-mood music and few humor thrown at right occassions. Be sure to have tissues or handkerchief nearby. :'(
There are few glitches, but whole game is superb!  The story is just awesome. You have to get this game!

I tried this game late at night with a very skeptical mind, thinking that this would be yet another cheap indie title and that I would drop it a few minutes in. Couldn't have been more wrong. To The Moon features the best story in a game ever, and is surely one of the best games I have played. The soundtrack is a true masterpiece and a must-buy, and together with the relatively cheap but successful graphics it lives it up to one's imagination to recreate the scenery as the story unfolds. Now I only need to recover from the post-game depression.  10/10.
This game is very deep... No funny review here just play it! (There's actually a lot of comedy in this game. lol)

This is essentially a point and click adventure with few other gameplay elements. It's easy, strait forward, and shouldn't take very long to complete. However, don't let any of that discourage you from playing. This has an amazing story to tell, and I believe that the experience is well worth a playthrough. I'd recomend picking this one up if you have the chance, particularly if you find it on sale!
Best. Game. Ever. I'm not even kidding. This is some brilliant and moving storytelling.
Wait, did I seriously just play through and really enjoy and maybe tear up from a game about a love story?

This game easily one of the most touching, well written stories ever made. While the actual gameplay is rather light (it is a visual novel after all), it's still worth it to play through. This is the perfect example of video games as an artform.  Also grab the soundtrack while you're at it. And some tissues when you play the game. You're gonna need them.

Beautiful story and OST in particular, with detailed pixel animations. Keep up the good work Freebird Games and don't bother with some people's comment of 'boring gameplay', they have been missing the point.   Can't wait for a bird's story!
Very interesting game. One of the best stories in a game. Play it for the story, not the game play.
Amazing...I was left speechless
I cried so hard at the end of this game. Honestly one of the best story driven games I've played in a while. If you have 10 dollars buy this game. Do not hesitate, this game is a masterpiece.

Wow..... I just finished the game about five minutes ago, and the story shown here was the best I have ever experienced. Perfectly balanced and truly touching. If you enjoy deep and meaningful stories dabbed with excellent humor, this is your game. The gameplay is not the point here, the story is front and center, as it should be for one of this caliber. As such, the point and click interaction was lacking, but I cannot stress enough how insignificant that is. It is merely the machine with which to push the story forward. This game is a true work of art and I hope we see more like it. I played through it in one sitting simply because of how engaged I was. 10 out of 10.
To the Moon was an amazing surpise of a game. With such nostalgia style graphics and beautiful soundtrack, and add its heartfelt story along with it and you got yourself a great game.
the feels are strong with this one
Good original score, great story but the gameplay is pretty lackluster.  I think this would benefit more in book or film form, but none the less, the feels will stay with me a long time.

Absolutely beautiful story of love, loss, and missing someone so much you'd do anything. I cried like a baby and I don't regret a minute of it. I deeply recommend this to anyone who wants to experience something which can be called very truly 'an experience'.

This is one of those games that can only be described as an experiance. the game play is not the greatest in the world, and the puzzles are rather easy, but those are my only two complaints.  The positives are the following:  Amazing story,  unique way of telling a life's story,  a rather believable future,  the most beautiful pixel artwork in modern games,  icredible origonal music,  fully flushed out charectors, great humur, real moments that bring out raw emotion, and an ending that puts mass effect 3 to shame!  Listen, I know that this game isn't for everybody, but I have to say that this is one of my, if not the, best game I have ever played. I implore you to play this game and see what it is, I don't think eough people know about this game and it is a shame. WORTH EVERY PENY AT ANY COST. 9/10

The story...the music...everything. It's just perfect. Eventhough I've watched the gameplay of this so many times, I still cry when I play it myself >:  If this is made into a movie, I would watch it 100%, again and again

This is not a game, gentle reader, but a tale. It is story. It is music. It is beauty. If you're the weepy sort, grab a box of tissues or two.  The art style reminds me of Chrono Trigger and other SNES era RPGs (also Secret of Mana or Final Fantasy VI). The character sprites are amazingly expressive.  The music, dear lord, the music. The story of this game might be good, but the music adds Soooo much.  Speaking of the story: you'll laugh, you'll ponder, you'll feel all the feels you didn't think you could feel. Hmmm, have you ever watched an anime from 'Key'? Like 'Kanon', 'Air', or 'Clannad'? Very similar vibe. This game has so many wonderful red herrings to throw you off the track, but then brings you back with a new piece of information.  Ugh, explaining doesn't really do it justice. Look, do you like nice stories with complex layers and GORGEOUS piano driven soundtracks? Then buy it already. It doesn't even take that long to get through, about as long as 'Gone Home'. You won't regret it.

Surprise game of the steam sale for me. Took me a minute or two to get into it but once I was charmed by the witty banter and soothing music I rode the feels all the way to end. Looking forward to the next offering by Kan Gao!
An excellent game with moving psychological themes. Highly recommend.  Very relaxed gameplay, with no real ability to screw up, but still very rewarding.  Short, only about 4 and a half hours long.

This game is incredible! I wasn't expecting such a deep and emotional story (If you are a crier, prepare to cry). Even though it is essentially a story driven point and click adventure game, the gameplay never feels dull. I can't say much more without spoiling the story so.... just buy it and play it already!

The gameplay is not so spectacular, it having been made with plain old RPG Maker. But the music and the plot will pull you in tight. What you will experience over the course of a few hours is an absolutely wonderful story, one that brought me to tears and will stick with me for years to come.
play this bloody good game
This game made me feel things. Things I've not felt in a long time. A long time...
Absolutely fantastic. Not hugely interactive but entirely story driven. With a wonderful plot and characters that have you laughing, having fun, and yes...even crying down the road.

This is a fantastic game for the storytelling, and there were honestly very few times I felt I knew what was coming at all. It is essentially an interactive story, but an extremely well done one. Highly recommended.

One of the finest games I've ever played. Some cheesy puzzles, and the usability is cumbersome, but they do not subtract from the storyline, which I believe puts this game up there as a game that I'll never forget. I still recommend this to everybody who asks me to recommend them a game.

Absolutely phenomenal game.  Overview: 2 partners work for a company that gives people wishes before they die. They go into thier memories and alter them in order to give the person what they want. It has an amazing love story in it.  The soundtrack is amazing, and it alone can almost bring me to tears after playing this game.  You can judge the graphics yourself based on the images, but I personally loved them.  The game is 100% story. There is no action of any sort in it. And that is 100% okay because the story is incredible. It brought me to tears.  Also, there is quite a bit of humor in the game. To be completely honest, I found that it was put into places where it shouldn't be, where it took away from the emotion of the story. But other than that, it was funny,  NOTE: The combat picture shown is part of a joke in the game. There is ZERO combat in the game. Once again, this is absolutely fine with me, just want to warn you if that is what you are looking for.
The Best pixelgame iv'e played, Fantastic storyline, it has both funny and sad moments. It was defenitly worth the money.
I can't remember any other game that emotionally impacted me as much as this one did. Though it's more of an interactive story than an actual game, per se, it's definitely worth picking up.
11/10 Would cry again

Storyline is one of the best I've ever played; musical score is beautifully done and fits the game well. Certainly drives more on emotion than action, however that is not a bad thing at all. Prepare for a few good laughs and, unless you've never experienced a happy or sad moment in your life, you might even shed a tear or two. The only negatives are the control issues that it inherits from, RPGmaker, the program that was used to make it.   Very highly recommend it.

The format makes this game drag a bit, but the storytelling is just perfect. Take some time to play this game at your own pace.   Pardon me while I go back to sobbing in the corner and reflect on life... T.T
Simply wow, a miniature masterpiece that got me crying like a baby for hours, worth every penny, the history is superb and beautifully conducted.

A really interesting game, like any great book, it has that way to introduce us and make the world they`re describing our own to imagine, fuelling the desire to explore and ask.  It's a 16bit like rpg, but with no battles. The point here is the story. Well, I'm sure glad that the PC world is so open to different ideas and ways to explore a tale. This last generation has been a bless and a curse for new experiences... with the resurging of the indie and the damn mass-produced FPS by big corporations...  This is a classic example of what an interesting experience is. One that didn't cost millions to make, nor asked us for our lungs for it, nor is trying to 'expand' itself by DLC for our amusement. Just our good and old complete experience that the developers clearly spent their time and money on the game, not on the package. This one is not another child of the beautification of marketing. But, it's in fact, a good example of the organic marketing... Good game that many people care to tell friends to play.

This game is sad. It's TOO SAD. This is the saddest game ever made, and it's absolutely amazing. It's almost all story, but honestly if it was more gameplay heavy it wouldn't be as good. Storytelling is amazing, the story itself is great, and the music, dialogue, hell everything, sets the mood for a tearjerker of a great game. 10/10 would die inside again.

This is probably the most moving game I have ever played, beautifully done in terms of story and music. The gameplay is a bit lacking, but this isn't a game I recommend for the gameplay. Everyone should play this game at least once to experience its story. I seriously couldn't stop playing this game until I had finished it.
Super immersive and a very emotional storyline. I'm not ashamed to say I cried. Good game about the nature of life and its tragedies, pick it up if you like shedding manly tears.

Wow. This hit hard. The control is simplistic, and only makes you force yourself to look into the story more. There's nothing complex that will take away from the game and for the near two hours I played, I experienced the variety pack of emotions on display. I teared up, I'm unafraid to admit this, and anyone who doesn't is not human. Please, PLEASE, take some time away to play this game. It may be a game that doesn't have much in regards for replayability (Probably a two-fer) but it gets you in and refuses to let you go.

This game is really amazing. I almost cried at the end. This game is best described by me as 'an eomtional trip through memories that you can even connect to in real life.'. I would definately reccomend this game to everyone, and especially to people who like a game that has a confusing storyline but by the end you have figured it out. The game will always surprise you all the way to the very end.
Simply a very beautiful and insipiring game. You should give it a try , you wont regret it!
Get ready for a feel trip...

Wow. What a beautiful and moving work of art. With a touching story, sad at times, and humorous at times, this game will definitely be one you'll want to add to your steam library. I'm not ashamed to admit that I cried. Now I just need to dust off my old Animorphs novels...

BUY !  PLAY IT IN 1 SITTINGS ! Finish it !   Cry for a few hours  And Realise how beautiful Life is!  Make the right decisions, decisions you wont regret !  Because Remember Time only moves in 1 direction !
Gamplay wise it's nothing fantastic but the story just keeps you playing. I dare you not to cry. I ♥♥♥♥ing dare you. 4/5

This game is really awesome! Well, to tell the truth...it's more like an interactive graphic novel. The story is fantastic, it's like a puzzle and you have to find the pieces and put them toghether. The music is touching! Definitely a must to play!

Absolutely magical. It'll whisk you away on an emotional and heartfelt story, lined with beautiful music. The graphics give just enough and leave the rest to the imagination - everything is very complimentary. I'd definitely recommend this game!
An excellent story; it's a touchy feely story, so if you're not into emotional sad stories steer clear. If you're okay with a story that has some 'feels', then I would highly recommend it.
Amazing game, the story line was thrilling and emotional!

This is one of those rare games that puts story at the forefront of exploration. The beautiful pixel artwork and sound create an environment that pulled me into a wonderful love story. The mystery of death and how our perceptions can take us to wonderful places in our last moments. Highly recommended gaming experience
Absolutely beautiful. Clever, too. And a soundtrack to die for :)
Great story. Great soundtrack. Great characters. Great platypuses.
Sweet story about human dreams, accompanied with amazing soundtrack. This story made me cry.  Thanks to Freebird Games. 10/10
This game is sick, it makes you think you know it all. Then outta no where *SUCKER PUNCH* right in the tear ducts you thought you left behind during childhood....   childhood....oh god...
Interesting, funny and brilliant story. Great gameplay and hit you right in the feels.
Absolutely beautiful. This is an amazing point and click story. I won't spoil the plot, but I deffinitely recommend this to anyone who enjoys an amazing story.

I think this is actually one of my favourite games of all times. It's very much focused on the narrative which means there isn't much in terms of gameplay, but this doesn't make it bad. The story, characters and setting are all so beautiful that it's a pleasure to accompany the characters as they discover new things.  The game focuses on an dieing old man called John, who has requested the services of a company who can alter memories of the dieing so their final moments are pleasing. You play as two scientists from the company (with great character dynamics) as they traverse his memories in order to learn more about him and to change his memories in the right way so that he goes to the moon. I won't spoil much more, but you get to see John's journey through life meeting some great characters and gradually learning more and more about him.   The music is also fantastic, accompanying the beautiful, funny and scary parts of the game perfectly.  Apart from a few puzzles (which never become very difficult) and minigame, most of the game consists of searching from objects that will allow you to traverse John's memories. That might sound tedious, but you often learn things as you explore, so I never really felt annoyed when having to search the level. If you prefer gameplay over a narrative, then you might want to give this game a skip, but I would prefer it if you gave it a chance. There's a lot of dialogue, but it's so well written and engaging that you won't minding sitting and reading.  The graphics are done in the 2D RPG style and they are very well suited for this sort of game. The fact that you grow attached to what are quite blurry 2D characters means the game has done a good job. Graphics won't blow you away, but they are still good and serve the purpose.  BUY IT NOW!

This is less a video game, and more of a video story. Despite its pixel art appearnance there's very little about To The Moon that qualifies it as a 'game'. There are some puzzle solving elements, a 'key finding' mechanic that amounts to clicking all over the screen LA-Noire style, and there are some very minor mini-games scattered throughout. I would opine that some of these detract from the experience, and I think most players will find them superfluous at best. Therefore, the reason I recommend To The Moon is not on its strength as a game, but on the strength of its story.  It's a story about loss, about love, and about sacrifice. I can't say that you will feel the same way I did, but I was emotionally affected by To The Moon. I don't think 20-year old me would've appreciated it as much as mid-thirties me does, and I've found myself thinking about the story even after I've finished playing; wrapping up stray plot threads in my mind, and refelcting on how the characters interacted with one another. The soundtrack is also very good as well, tonally setting the scene in many places.   The game does have its weak points. The writing is uneven, with some moments feeling oddly placed, and some falling flat (there is an action beat involving a life-threatening event that seems unnecessary). The interplay between the two doctors is cute at times, even funny at others, but at certain points it gets tiring, Mouse detection can be wonky, which is frustrating at times. The ending is a little saccarrine, and I wonder if the story couldn't have been wrapped up differently without the neat little bow that gets placed on it, but these are just minor quibbles - any game that can make me feel emotions like To the Moon must be doing something right.   I got it during the Summer Sale for $1, and it was worth every penny. I'm hoping the sequel is produced with the same care, quality, and originality as this one.
A beautiful game that I will play over and over again just to enjoy the story more.
AMAZING. Story and music. Throwback to old style RPGs.

Well, let's see... I purchased this game (more of a visual novel really) back in march of 2013. It's been two and a half years since then and when I accidentally opened windows media today and saw all the OST tracks that I bought it remined me about this game. Then I realized I never formally wrote a review.  Few things affected me as much as this game, though there are some. There is a certain realm of innocence and simplicity to be tasted and enjoyed in reality. Not enjoyment brought about by shallow desires, the rewards of complicated obligations, and so on. Rather, it is the type of simple joy brought about by life's simple yet greatest gifts: love, care, understanding, compassion, and bonding during difficult times. Though surrounded by complex, scientific methods of changing a person's earliest memories, at its core the story of To the Moon is no more than that: simple, pure, and good. It's a story about a man and his peculiar wife, whom he loves and understands and with whom he endures a great deal. To the Moon is a game about the fullfilment of this man's genuine wish due to his sense of love, loyalty, and unity he feels towards his wife. It's a story that will make you laugh, cry, and ponder life, as it certainly made me do. This game explores life's simple treasures and truly emphasizes what is important in life.  If you're not sure if you should get this game, get it. As simple as that. 12/10.
By far one of the most compelling stories I've ever played. A mix of humor and connections makes this game a must play if you're into storytelling games.

To the Moon is more of an interactive story (or stories depending on how you look at it), with some gameplay elements. The aim of the game element of the story is to unravel these stories. The lionshare of the work that went into this game clearly went on writing an excellent story with a unique way of letting the narrative unfold. To the Moon creates deep, sympathetic characters with their own intriguing histories, and it all feels incredibly well done and deliberate.  The game played with my emotions on many levels, from scratching my head in confusion, to piquing my curiosity, to making me laugh out loud to tugging on my heart strings. This game creates a wonderful blend of emotions. The world is immersive, and the story sucks you right in.   I pretty much played this game in one sitting because I wanted to see the story to it's conclusion without losing track. There is a beautiful sound track to the game with each track matching its' corresponding scene perfectly. THe music also helps to convey the mood, in addition to the well thought out dialogue and appealing scenery. The controls for the game are simple and difficult to go wrong with, though the mouse can feel a little clumsy at times. The graphics are pixel art, which for me is a testament to the immersion I felt with the game, as it didn't need to be a realistic, fantastical world to draw me in. The art style, scenery and level design was just right to achieve the intended purpose and led to an overall polished feeling to the game.   There is a real beauty in the juxtaposition of opposing emotions in adjacent, or even the same scenes and the psychology between game and player is spot on. Completing the game, for me, was like finishing reading an epic novel with a sense of achievement, and a connection with the characters. To the Moon is a triumph in story telling.

Think 'Cabin in the Woods' meets 'Inception' meets 'A Walk to Remember'. To the Moon flows like a movie and keeps a similair pace too. The writing and plot are top tier. The soundtrack is beautiful and a tear-jerker. Even the game play is fun. This is one of those games you won't get out of your head.   The only con is the controls/movement. It needs to work like Broken Age/Deponia with clicking and autowalking.

Despite its short length, it stays with you.  If you want a meaningful story aided by a great soundtrack then look no further.

This game is COMPLETELY worth the 3 hours it took me to finish it. It's more of an interactive story with a fixed ending, but no matter what it's gorgeous. First off, the pixel art is intricate and varies enough between areas that buildings don't look like slightly modified copies of each other. Each character sprite is unique, and even age is portrayed well beyond the color of his hair. In the events where line art is used, it doesn't always fit (the most blatant example would be with the rocketd.) It turns away from the aesthetic.  The story is probably the best part of the game. The premise is this: two scientists use technology to enter a dying man's mind and grant him one final wish before he passes. It's simple enough, but clearly proves otherwise. As they go through his memories things become more complicated due to two characters and their effects on his life. The only real hindrance to progression of the story are the puzzles, which are by no means difficult. The only problem I personally had with the story is that for replayability I wish there could be multiple endings that can be achieved. Unfortunately that's not the case. The soundtrack is also very good. There is a key theme (For River/To the Moon) that appears frequently and is the biggest identifier of the game overall. Multiple characters are depicted playing it at different points in both reality and the future generated by the scientists.  Emotions were definitely played with over the course of this. I cried at least three times, but probably laughed even more. Neil, one of the scientists, and even Eva on occasion were great sources of amusement beyond the entertainment of the story. They're more than just edgy people doing a job.    Presentation is also done well. All of the characters are unique. My belief is that River and Isabelle both had Aspberger's as that's what I drew from the story (I drew the conclusion on Isabelle after the point where the admits to having the same diagnosis as River.) The fixation on folding rabbits is her indirect way of trying to remind Johnny of when they first met, not in the cafeteria but on the log at the carnival. Isabelle and River both present Aspberger's in two completely different ways that are both accurate within reason. Not to mention, they don't refer to others as normal. Isabelle can be quoted as referring to Johnny as 'neurotypical' and satisfies that need to present autism as a whole as not an illness, but a trait. Clearly the writers did their research to write characters from an informed perspective and as a consumer I greatly appreciate this.     The story's twists definitely kept it from being predictable even though we knew from the beginning how it would end. I may even play again, though probably for much less enjoyment than I had the first time.  Honestly, my only other complaint was the controls. Movement was point and click or arrow keys, though considering the mouse is needed for other functions I would have appreciated WASD movement over arrows. The only point when WASD is used is during a sequence where plants need to be shot in different directions. The right click to access the pause/options wasn't necessary, but as the developers didn't exclude escape as an option it's more redundant than obnoxious.  Overall I'd give this game a 9/10. The only things that could make it better would be multiple endings, more scenarios/clients, and different controls. Otherwise the game is beautiful as-is. I likely won't be playing it again for awhile, but luckily for me I have A Bird Story in my library already. If you're looking for a story-heavy game with pixel graphics and an amazing soundtrack, look no further. I can't recommend it much more than this. If someone has something better let me know. I'll throw money at them in a heartbeat.
